00158         // Get string length 
00159         size_t strlength(const char_t* s) 
00160         { 
00161                 assert(s); 
00162  
00163         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00164                 return wcslen(s); 
00165         #else 
00166                 return strlen(s); 
00167         #endif 
00168         } 
00169  
00170         // Compare two strings 
00171         bool strequal(const char_t* src, const char_t* dst) 
00172         { 
00173                 assert(src && dst); 
00174  
00175         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00176                 return wcscmp(src, dst) == 0; 
00177         #else 
00178                 return strcmp(src, dst) == 0; 
00179         #endif 
00180         } 
00181  
00182         // Compare lhs with [rhs_begin, rhs_end) 
00183         bool strequalrange(const char_t* lhs, const char_t* rhs, size_t count) 
00184         { 
00185                 for (size_t i = 0; i < count; ++i) 
00186                         if (lhs[i] != rhs[i]) 
00187                                 return false; 
00188          
00189                 return lhs[count] == 0; 
00190         } 
00191          
00192 #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00193         // Convert string to wide string, assuming all symbols are ASCII 
00194         void widen_ascii(wchar_t* dest, const char* source) 
00195         { 
00196                 for (const char* i = source; *i; ++i) *dest++ = *i; 
00197                 *dest = 0; 
00198         } 
00199 #endif 
00200 }

00232         static const size_t MemoryPage_size = 32768; 
00233  
00234         static const uintptr_t MemoryPage_alignment = 32; 
00235         static const uintptr_t MemoryPage_pointer_mask = ~(MemoryPage_alignment - 1); 
00236         static const uintptr_t MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask = 16; 
00237         static const uintptr_t MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask = 8; 
00238         static const uintptr_t MemoryPage_type_mask = 7; 
00239  
00240         struct Allocator; 
00241  
00242         struct MemoryPage 
00243         { 
00244                 static MemoryPage* construct(void* memory) 
00245                 { 
00246                         if (!memory) return 0; //$ redundant, left for performance 
00247  
00248                         MemoryPage* result = static_cast<MemoryPage*>(memory); 
00249  
00250                         result->allocator = 0; 
00251                         result->memory = 0; 
00252                         result->prev = 0; 
00253                         result->next = 0; 
00254                         result->busy_size = 0; 
00255                         result->freed_size = 0; 
00256  
00257                         return result; 
00258                 } 
00259  
00260                 Allocator* allocator; 
00261  
00262                 void* memory; 
00263  
00264                 MemoryPage* prev; 
00265                 MemoryPage* next; 
00266  
00267                 size_t busy_size; 
00268                 size_t freed_size; 
00269  
00270                 char data[1]; 
00271         }; 
00272  
00273         struct MemoryString_header 
00274         { 
00275                 uint16_t page_offset; // offset from page->data 
00276                 uint16_t full_size; // 0 if string occupies whole page 
00277         }; 
00278  
00279         struct Allocator 
00280         { 
00281                 Allocator(MemoryPage* root): _root(root), _busy_size(root->busy_size) 
00282                 { 
00283                 } 
00284  
00285                 MemoryPage* allocate_page(size_t data_size) 
00286                 { 
00287                         size_t size = offsetof(MemoryPage, data) + data_size; 
00288  
00289                         // allocate block with some alignment, leaving memory for worst-case padding 
00290                         void* memory = global_allocate(size + MemoryPage_alignment); 
00291                         if (!memory) return 0; 
00292  
00293                         // align upwards to page boundary 
00294                         void* page_memory = reinterpret_cast<void*>((reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(memory) + (MemoryPage_alignment - 1)) & ~(MemoryPage_alignment - 1)); 
00295  
00296                         // prepare page structure 
00297                         MemoryPage* page = MemoryPage::construct(page_memory); 
00298  
00299                         page->memory = memory; 
00300                         page->allocator = _root->allocator; 
00301  
00302                         return page; 
00303                 } 
00304  
00305                 static void deallocate_page(MemoryPage* page) 
00306                 { 
00307                         global_deallocate(page->memory); 
00308                 } 
00309  
00310                 void* allocate_memory_oob(size_t size, MemoryPage*& out_page); 
00311  
00312                 void* allocate_memory(size_t size, MemoryPage*& out_page) 
00313                 { 
00314                         if (_busy_size + size > MemoryPage_size) return allocate_memory_oob(size, out_page); 
00315  
00316                         void* buf = _root->data + _busy_size; 
00317  
00318                         _busy_size += size; 
00319  
00320                         out_page = _root; 
00321  
00322                         return buf; 
00323                 } 
00324  
00325                 void deallocate_memory(void* ptr, size_t size, MemoryPage* page) 
00326                 { 
00327                         if (page == _root) page->busy_size = _busy_size; 
00328  
00329                         assert(ptr >= page->data && ptr < page->data + page->busy_size); 
00330                         (void)!ptr; 
00331  
00332                         page->freed_size += size; 
00333                         assert(page->freed_size <= page->busy_size); 
00334  
00335                         if (page->freed_size == page->busy_size) 
00336                         { 
00337                                 if (page->next == 0) 
00338                                 { 
00339                                         assert(_root == page); 
00340  
00341                                         // top page freed, just reset sizes 
00342                                         page->busy_size = page->freed_size = 0; 
00343                                         _busy_size = 0; 
00344                                 } 
00345                                 else 
00346                                 { 
00347                                         assert(_root != page); 
00348                                         assert(page->prev); 
00349  
00350                                         // remove from the list 
00351                                         page->prev->next = page->next; 
00352                                         page->next->prev = page->prev; 
00353  
00354                                         // deallocate 
00355                                         deallocate_page(page); 
00356                                 } 
00357                         } 
00358                 } 
00359  
00360                 char_t* allocate_string(size_t length) 
00361                 { 
00362                         // allocate memory for string and header block 
00363                         size_t size = sizeof(MemoryString_header) + length * sizeof(char_t); 
00364                          
00365                         // round size up to pointer alignment boundary 
00366                         size_t full_size = (size + (sizeof(void*) - 1)) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
00367  
00368                         MemoryPage* page; 
00369                         MemoryString_header* header = static_cast<MemoryString_header*>(allocate_memory(full_size, page)); 
00370  
00371                         if (!header) return 0; 
00372  
00373                         // setup header 
00374                         ptrdiff_t page_offset = reinterpret_cast<char*>(header) - page->data; 
00375  
00376                         assert(page_offset >= 0 && page_offset < (1 << 16)); 
00377                         header->page_offset = static_cast<uint16_t>(page_offset); 
00378  
00379                         // full_size == 0 for large strings that occupy the whole page 
00380                         assert(full_size < (1 << 16) || (page->busy_size == full_size && page_offset == 0)); 
00381                         header->full_size = static_cast<uint16_t>(full_size < (1 << 16) ? full_size : 0); 
00382  
00383                         return reinterpret_cast<char_t*>(header + 1); 
00384                 } 
00385  
00386                 void deallocate_string(char_t* string) 
00387                 { 
00388                         // get header 
00389                         MemoryString_header* header = reinterpret_cast<MemoryString_header*>(string) - 1; 
00390  
00391                         // deallocate 
00392                         size_t page_offset = offsetof(MemoryPage, data) + header->page_offset; 
00393                         MemoryPage* page = reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(reinterpret_cast<char*>(header) - page_offset); 
00394  
00395                         // if full_size == 0 then this string occupies the whole page 
00396                         size_t full_size = header->full_size == 0 ? page->busy_size : header->full_size; 
00397  
00398                         deallocate_memory(header, full_size, page); 
00399                 } 
00400  
00401                 MemoryPage* _root; 
00402                 size_t _busy_size; 
00403         }; 
00404  
00405         XML_NO_INLINE void* Allocator::allocate_memory_oob(size_t size, MemoryPage*& out_page) 
00406         { 
00407                 const size_t large_allocation_threshold = MemoryPage_size / 4; 
00408  
00409                 MemoryPage* page = allocate_page(size <= large_allocation_threshold ? MemoryPage_size : size); 
00410                 if (!page) return 0; 
00411  
00412                 if (size <= large_allocation_threshold) 
00413                 { 
00414                         _root->busy_size = _busy_size; 
00415  
00416                         // insert page at the end of linked list 
00417                         page->prev = _root; 
00418                         _root->next = page; 
00419                         _root = page; 
00420  
00421                         _busy_size = size; 
00422                 } 
00423                 else 
00424                 { 
00425                         // insert page before the end of linked list, so that it is deleted as soon as possible 
00426                         // the last page is not deleted even if it's empty (see deallocate_memory) 
00427                         assert(_root->prev); 
00428  
00429                         page->prev = _root->prev; 
00430                         page->next = _root; 
00431  
00432                         _root->prev->next = page; 
00433                         _root->prev = page; 
00434                 } 
00435  
00436                 // allocate inside page 
00437                 page->busy_size = size; 
00438  
00439                 out_page = page; 
00440                 return page->data; 
00441         } 
00442 }

00448         //// A 'name=value' XML attribute structure. 
00449         struct AttributeStruct 
00450         { 
00451                 //// Default ctor 
00452                 AttributeStruct(MemoryPage* page): header(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(page)), name(0), value(0), prev_attribute_c(0), next_attribute(0) 
00453                 { 
00454                 } 
00455  
00456                 uintptr_t header; 
00457  
00458                 char_t* name;   ////< Pointer to attribute name. 
00459                 char_t* value;  ////< Pointer to attribute value. 
00460  
00461                 AttributeStruct* prev_attribute_c;      ////< Previous attribute (cyclic list) 
00462                 AttributeStruct* next_attribute;        ////< Next attribute 
00463         }; 
00464  
00465         //// An XML document tree node. 
00466         struct NodeStruct 
00467         { 
00468                 //// Default ctor 
00469                 //// \param type - node type 
00470                 NodeStruct(MemoryPage* page, NodeType type): header(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(page) | (type - 1)), parent(0), name(0), value(0), first_child(0), prev_sibling_c(0), next_sibling(0), first_attribute(0) 
00471                 { 
00472                 } 
00473  
00474                 uintptr_t header; 
00475  
00476                 NodeStruct*             parent;                                 ////< Pointer to parent 
00477  
00478                 char_t*                                 name;                                   ////< Pointer to element name. 
00479                 char_t*                                 value;                                  ////< Pointer to any associated string data. 
00480  
00481                 NodeStruct*             first_child;                    ////< First child 
00482                  
00483                 NodeStruct*             prev_sibling_c;                 ////< Left brother (cyclic list) 
00484                 NodeStruct*             next_sibling;                   ////< Right brother 
00485                  
00486                 AttributeStruct*        first_attribute;                ////< First attribute 
00487         }; 
00488 } 
00489 } // \phys

00510 // Low-level DOM operations 
00511 namespace 
00512 { 
00513         inline AttributeStruct* allocate_attribute(Allocator& alloc) 
00514         { 
00515                 MemoryPage* page; 
00516                 void* memory = alloc.allocate_memory(sizeof(AttributeStruct), page); 
00517  
00518                 return new (memory) AttributeStruct(page); 
00519         } 
00520  
00521         inline NodeStruct* allocate_node(Allocator& alloc, NodeType type) 
00522         { 
00523                 MemoryPage* page; 
00524                 void* memory = alloc.allocate_memory(sizeof(NodeStruct), page); 
00525  
00526                 return new (memory) NodeStruct(page, type); 
00527         } 
00528  
00529         inline void destroy_attribute(AttributeStruct* a, Allocator& alloc) 
00530         { 
00531                 uintptr_t header = a->header; 
00532  
00533                 if (header & MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask) alloc.deallocate_string(a->name); 
00534                 if (header & MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask) alloc.deallocate_string(a->value); 
00535  
00536                 alloc.deallocate_memory(a, sizeof(AttributeStruct), reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(header & MemoryPage_pointer_mask)); 
00537         } 
00538  
00539         inline void destroy_node(NodeStruct* n, Allocator& alloc) 
00540         { 
00541                 uintptr_t header = n->header; 
00542  
00543                 if (header & MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask) alloc.deallocate_string(n->name); 
00544                 if (header & MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask) alloc.deallocate_string(n->value); 
00545  
00546                 for (AttributeStruct* attr = n->first_attribute; attr; ) 
00547                 { 
00548                         AttributeStruct* next = attr->next_attribute; 
00549  
00550                         destroy_attribute(attr, alloc); 
00551  
00552                         attr = next; 
00553                 } 
00554  
00555                 for (NodeStruct* child = n->first_child; child; ) 
00556                 { 
00557                         NodeStruct* next = child->next_sibling; 
00558  
00559                         destroy_node(child, alloc); 
00560  
00561                         child = next; 
00562                 } 
00563  
00564                 alloc.deallocate_memory(n, sizeof(NodeStruct), reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(header & MemoryPage_pointer_mask)); 
00565         } 
00566  
00567         XML_NO_INLINE NodeStruct* append_node(NodeStruct* node, Allocator& alloc, NodeType type = node_element) 
00568         { 
00569                 NodeStruct* child = allocate_node(alloc, type); 
00570                 if (!child) return 0; 
00571  
00572                 child->parent = node; 
00573  
00574                 NodeStruct* first_child = node->first_child; 
00575                          
00576                 if (first_child) 
00577                 { 
00578                         NodeStruct* last_child = first_child->prev_sibling_c; 
00579  
00580                         last_child->next_sibling = child; 
00581                         child->prev_sibling_c = last_child; 
00582                         first_child->prev_sibling_c = child; 
00583                 } 
00584                 else 
00585                 { 
00586                         node->first_child = child; 
00587                         child->prev_sibling_c = child; 
00588                 } 
00589                          
00590                 return child; 
00591         } 
00592  
00593         XML_NO_INLINE AttributeStruct* append_attribute_ll(NodeStruct* node, Allocator& alloc) 
00594         { 
00595                 AttributeStruct* a = allocate_attribute(alloc); 
00596                 if (!a) return 0; 
00597  
00598                 AttributeStruct* first_attribute = node->first_attribute; 
00599  
00600                 if (first_attribute) 
00601                 { 
00602                         AttributeStruct* last_attribute = first_attribute->prev_attribute_c; 
00603  
00604                         last_attribute->next_attribute = a; 
00605                         a->prev_attribute_c = last_attribute; 
00606                         first_attribute->prev_attribute_c = a; 
00607                 } 
00608                 else 
00609                 { 
00610                         node->first_attribute = a; 
00611                         a->prev_attribute_c = a; 
00612                 } 
00613                          
00614                 return a; 
00615         } 
00616 }

00632 // Unicode utilities 
00633 namespace 
00634 { 
00635         inline uint16_t endian_swap(uint16_t value) 
00636         { 
00637                 return static_cast<uint16_t>(((value & 0xff) << 8) | (value >> 8)); 
00638         } 
00639  
00640         inline uint32_t endian_swap(uint32_t value) 
00641         { 
00642                 return ((value & 0xff) << 24) | ((value & 0xff00) << 8) | ((value & 0xff0000) >> 8) | (value >> 24); 
00643         } 
00644  
00645         struct utf8_counter 
00646         { 
00647                 typedef size_t value_type; 
00648  
00649                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00650                 { 
00651                         // U+0000..U+007F 
00652                         if (ch < 0x80) return result + 1; 
00653                         // U+0080..U+07FF 
00654                         else if (ch < 0x800) return result + 2; 
00655                         // U+0800..U+FFFF 
00656                         else return result + 3; 
00657                 } 
00658  
00659                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t) 
00660                 { 
00661                         // U+10000..U+10FFFF 
00662                         return result + 4; 
00663                 } 
00664         }; 
00665  
00666         struct utf8_writer 
00667         { 
00668                 typedef uint8_t* value_type; 
00669  
00670                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00671                 { 
00672                         // U+0000..U+007F 
00673                         if (ch < 0x80) 
00674                         { 
00675                                 *result = static_cast<uint8_t>(ch); 
00676                                 return result + 1; 
00677                         } 
00678                         // U+0080..U+07FF 
00679                         else if (ch < 0x800) 
00680                         { 
00681                                 result[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0xC0 | (ch >> 6)); 
00682                                 result[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (ch & 0x3F)); 
00683                                 return result + 2; 
00684                         } 
00685                         // U+0800..U+FFFF 
00686                         else 
00687                         { 
00688                                 result[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0xE0 | (ch >> 12)); 
00689                                 result[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F)); 
00690                                 result[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (ch & 0x3F)); 
00691                                 return result + 3; 
00692                         } 
00693                 } 
00694  
00695                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00696                 { 
00697                         // U+10000..U+10FFFF 
00698                         result[0] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0xF0 | (ch >> 18)); 
00699                         result[1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | ((ch >> 12) & 0x3F)); 
00700                         result[2] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F)); 
00701                         result[3] = static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (ch & 0x3F)); 
00702                         return result + 4; 
00703                 } 
00704  
00705                 static value_type any(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00706                 { 
00707                         return (ch < 0x10000) ? low(result, ch) : high(result, ch); 
00708                 } 
00709         }; 
00710  
00711         struct utf16_counter 
00712         { 
00713                 typedef size_t value_type; 
00714  
00715                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t) 
00716                 { 
00717                         return result + 1; 
00718                 } 
00719  
00720                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t) 
00721                 { 
00722                         return result + 2; 
00723                 } 
00724         }; 
00725  
00726         struct utf16_writer 
00727         { 
00728                 typedef uint16_t* value_type; 
00729  
00730                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00731                 { 
00732                         *result = static_cast<uint16_t>(ch); 
00733  
00734                         return result + 1; 
00735                 } 
00736  
00737                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00738                 { 
00739                         uint32_t msh = (uint32_t)(ch - 0x10000) >> 10; 
00740                         uint32_t lsh = (uint32_t)(ch - 0x10000) & 0x3ff; 
00741  
00742                         result[0] = static_cast<uint16_t>(0xD800 + msh); 
00743                         result[1] = static_cast<uint16_t>(0xDC00 + lsh); 
00744  
00745                         return result + 2; 
00746                 } 
00747  
00748                 static value_type any(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00749                 { 
00750                         return (ch < 0x10000) ? low(result, ch) : high(result, ch); 
00751                 } 
00752         }; 
00753  
00754         struct utf32_counter 
00755         { 
00756                 typedef size_t value_type; 
00757  
00758                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t) 
00759                 { 
00760                         return result + 1; 
00761                 } 
00762  
00763                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t) 
00764                 { 
00765                         return result + 1; 
00766                 } 
00767         }; 
00768  
00769         struct utf32_writer 
00770         { 
00771                 typedef uint32_t* value_type; 
00772  
00773                 static value_type low(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00774                 { 
00775                         *result = ch; 
00776  
00777                         return result + 1; 
00778                 } 
00779  
00780                 static value_type high(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00781                 { 
00782                         *result = ch; 
00783  
00784                         return result + 1; 
00785                 } 
00786  
00787                 static value_type any(value_type result, uint32_t ch) 
00788                 { 
00789                         *result = ch; 
00790  
00791                         return result + 1; 
00792                 } 
00793         }; 
00794  
00795         template <size_t size> struct wchar_selector; 
00796  
00797         template <> struct wchar_selector<2> 
00798         { 
00799                 typedef uint16_t type; 
00800                 typedef utf16_counter counter; 
00801                 typedef utf16_writer writer; 
00802         }; 
00803  
00804         template <> struct wchar_selector<4> 
00805         { 
00806                 typedef uint32_t type; 
00807                 typedef utf32_counter counter; 
00808                 typedef utf32_writer writer; 
00809         }; 
00810  
00811         typedef wchar_selector<sizeof(wchar_t)>::counter wchar_counter; 
00812         typedef wchar_selector<sizeof(wchar_t)>::writer wchar_writer; 
00813  
00814         template <typename Traits, typename opt_swap = opt_false> struct utf_decoder 
00815         { 
00816                 static inline typename Traits::value_type decode_utf8_block(const uint8_t* data, size_t size, typename Traits::value_type result) 
00817                 { 
00818                         const uint8_t utf8_byte_mask = 0x3f; 
00819  
00820                         while (size) 
00821                         { 
00822                                 uint8_t lead = *data; 
00823  
00824                                 // 0xxxxxxx -> U+0000..U+007F 
00825                                 if (lead < 0x80) 
00826                                 { 
00827                                         result = Traits::low(result, lead); 
00828                                         data += 1; 
00829                                         size -= 1; 
00830  
00831                                         // process aligned single-byte (ascii) blocks 
00832                                         if ((reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(data) & 3) == 0) 
00833                                         { 
00834                                                 while (size >= 4 && (*reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data) & 0x80808080) == 0) 
00835                                                 { 
00836                                                         result = Traits::low(result, data[0]); 
00837                                                         result = Traits::low(result, data[1]); 
00838                                                         result = Traits::low(result, data[2]); 
00839                                                         result = Traits::low(result, data[3]); 
00840                                                         data += 4; 
00841                                                         size -= 4; 
00842                                                 } 
00843                                         } 
00844                                 } 
00845                                 // 110xxxxx -> U+0080..U+07FF 
00846                                 else if ((unsigned)(lead - 0xC0) < 0x20 && size >= 2 && (data[1] & 0xc0) == 0x80) 
00847                                 { 
00848                                         result = Traits::low(result, ((lead & ~0xC0) << 6) | (data[1] & utf8_byte_mask)); 
00849                                         data += 2; 
00850                                         size -= 2; 
00851                                 } 
00852                                 // 1110xxxx -> U+0800-U+FFFF 
00853                                 else if ((unsigned)(lead - 0xE0) < 0x10 && size >= 3 && (data[1] & 0xc0) == 0x80 && (data[2] & 0xc0) == 0x80) 
00854                                 { 
00855                                         result = Traits::low(result, ((lead & ~0xE0) << 12) | ((data[1] & utf8_byte_mask) << 6) | (data[2] & utf8_byte_mask)); 
00856                                         data += 3; 
00857                                         size -= 3; 
00858                                 } 
00859                                 // 11110xxx -> U+10000..U+10FFFF 
00860                                 else if ((unsigned)(lead - 0xF0) < 0x08 && size >= 4 && (data[1] & 0xc0) == 0x80 && (data[2] & 0xc0) == 0x80 && (data[3] & 0xc0) == 0x80) 
00861                                 { 
00862                                         result = Traits::high(result, ((lead & ~0xF0) << 18) | ((data[1] & utf8_byte_mask) << 12) | ((data[2] & utf8_byte_mask) << 6) | (data[3] & utf8_byte_mask)); 
00863                                         data += 4; 
00864                                         size -= 4; 
00865                                 } 
00866                                 // 10xxxxxx or 11111xxx -> invalid 
00867                                 else 
00868                                 { 
00869                                         data += 1; 
00870                                         size -= 1; 
00871                                 } 
00872                         } 
00873  
00874                         return result; 
00875                 } 
00876  
00877                 static inline typename Traits::value_type decode_utf16_block(const uint16_t* data, size_t size, typename Traits::value_type result) 
00878                 { 
00879                         const uint16_t* end = data + size; 
00880  
00881                         while (data < end) 
00882                         { 
00883                                 uint16_t lead = opt_swap::value ? endian_swap(*data) : *data; 
00884  
00885                                 // U+0000..U+D7FF 
00886                                 if (lead < 0xD800) 
00887                                 { 
00888                                         result = Traits::low(result, lead); 
00889                                         data += 1; 
00890                                 } 
00891                                 // U+E000..U+FFFF 
00892                                 else if ((unsigned)(lead - 0xE000) < 0x2000) 
00893                                 { 
00894                                         result = Traits::low(result, lead); 
00895                                         data += 1; 
00896                                 } 
00897                                 // surrogate pair lead 
00898                                 else if ((unsigned)(lead - 0xD800) < 0x400 && data + 1 < end) 
00899                                 { 
00900                                         uint16_t next = opt_swap::value ? endian_swap(data[1]) : data[1]; 
00901  
00902                                         if ((unsigned)(next - 0xDC00) < 0x400) 
00903                                         { 
00904                                                 result = Traits::high(result, 0x10000 + ((lead & 0x3ff) << 10) + (next & 0x3ff)); 
00905                                                 data += 2; 
00906                                         } 
00907                                         else 
00908                                         { 
00909                                                 data += 1; 
00910                                         } 
00911                                 } 
00912                                 else 
00913                                 { 
00914                                         data += 1; 
00915                                 } 
00916                         } 
00917  
00918                         return result; 
00919                 } 
00920  
00921                 static inline typename Traits::value_type decode_utf32_block(const uint32_t* data, size_t size, typename Traits::value_type result) 
00922                 { 
00923                         const uint32_t* end = data + size; 
00924  
00925                         while (data < end) 
00926                         { 
00927                                 uint32_t lead = opt_swap::value ? endian_swap(*data) : *data; 
00928  
00929                                 // U+0000..U+FFFF 
00930                                 if (lead < 0x10000) 
00931                                 { 
00932                                         result = Traits::low(result, lead); 
00933                                         data += 1; 
00934                                 } 
00935                                 // U+10000..U+10FFFF 
00936                                 else 
00937                                 { 
00938                                         result = Traits::high(result, lead); 
00939                                         data += 1; 
00940                                 } 
00941                         } 
00942  
00943                         return result; 
00944                 } 
00945         }; 
00946  
00947         template <typename T> inline void convert_utf_endian_swap(T* result, const T* data, size_t length) 
00948         { 
00949                 for (size_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) result[i] = endian_swap(data[i]); 
00950         } 
00951  
00952         inline void convert_wchar_endian_swap(wchar_t* result, const wchar_t* data, size_t length) 
00953         { 
00954                 for (size_t i = 0; i < length; ++i) result[i] = static_cast<wchar_t>(endian_swap(static_cast<wchar_selector<sizeof(wchar_t)>::type>(data[i]))); 
00955         } 
00956 }

01033         bool is_little_endian() 
01034         { 
01035                 unsigned int ui = 1; 
01036  
01037                 return *reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&ui) == 1; 
01038         } 
01039  
01040         Encoding get_wchar_encoding() 
01041         { 
01042                 STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 || sizeof(wchar_t) == 4); 
01043  
01044                 if (sizeof(wchar_t) == 2) 
01045                         return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
01046                 else  
01047                         return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
01048         } 
01049  
01050         Encoding guess_buffer_encoding(uint8_t d0, uint8_t d1, uint8_t d2, uint8_t d3) 
01051         { 
01052                 // look for BOM in first few bytes 
01053                 if (d0 == 0 && d1 == 0 && d2 == 0xfe && d3 == 0xff) return encoding_utf32_be; 
01054                 if (d0 == 0xff && d1 == 0xfe && d2 == 0 && d3 == 0) return encoding_utf32_le; 
01055                 if (d0 == 0xfe && d1 == 0xff) return encoding_utf16_be; 
01056                 if (d0 == 0xff && d1 == 0xfe) return encoding_utf16_le; 
01057                 if (d0 == 0xef && d1 == 0xbb && d2 == 0xbf) return encoding_utf8; 
01058  
01059                 // look for <, <? or <?xm in various encodings 
01060                 if (d0 == 0 && d1 == 0 && d2 == 0 && d3 == 0x3c) return encoding_utf32_be; 
01061                 if (d0 == 0x3c && d1 == 0 && d2 == 0 && d3 == 0) return encoding_utf32_le; 
01062                 if (d0 == 0 && d1 == 0x3c && d2 == 0 && d3 == 0x3f) return encoding_utf16_be; 
01063                 if (d0 == 0x3c && d1 == 0 && d2 == 0x3f && d3 == 0) return encoding_utf16_le; 
01064                 if (d0 == 0x3c && d1 == 0x3f && d2 == 0x78 && d3 == 0x6d) return encoding_utf8; 
01065  
01066                 // look for utf16 < followed by node name (this may fail, but is better than utf8 since it's zero terminated so early) 
01067                 if (d0 == 0 && d1 == 0x3c) return encoding_utf16_be; 
01068                 if (d0 == 0x3c && d1 == 0) return encoding_utf16_le; 
01069  
01070                 // no known BOM detected, assume utf8 
01071                 return encoding_utf8; 
01072         } 
01073  
01074         Encoding get_buffer_encoding(Encoding encoding, const void* contents, size_t size) 
01075         { 
01076                 // replace wchar encoding with utf implementation 
01077                 if (encoding == encoding_wchar) return get_wchar_encoding(); 
01078  
01079                 // replace utf16 encoding with utf16 with specific endianness 
01080                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
01081  
01082                 // replace utf32 encoding with utf32 with specific endianness 
01083                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
01084  
01085                 // only do autodetection if no explicit encoding is requested 
01086                 if (encoding != encoding_auto) return encoding; 
01087  
01088                 // skip encoding autodetection if input buffer is too small 
01089                 if (size < 4) return encoding_utf8; 
01090  
01091                 // try to guess encoding (based on XML specification, Appendix F.1) 
01092                 const uint8_t* data = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(contents); 
01093  
01094                 DMC_VOLATILE uint8_t d0 = data[0], d1 = data[1], d2 = data[2], d3 = data[3]; 
01095  
01096                 return guess_buffer_encoding(d0, d1, d2, d3); 
01097         } 
01098  
01099         bool get_mutable_buffer(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, bool is_mutable) 
01100         { 
01101                 if (is_mutable) 
01102                 { 
01103                         out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(const_cast<void*>(contents)); 
01104                 } 
01105                 else 
01106                 { 
01107                         void* buffer = global_allocate(size > 0 ? size : 1); 
01108                         if (!buffer) return false; 
01109  
01110                         memcpy(buffer, contents, size); 
01111  
01112                         out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(buffer); 
01113                 } 
01114  
01115                 out_length = size / sizeof(char_t); 
01116  
01117                 return true; 
01118         } 
01119  
01120 #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
01121         inline bool need_endian_swap_utf(Encoding le, Encoding re) 
01122         { 
01123                 return (le == encoding_utf16_be && re == encoding_utf16_le) || (le == encoding_utf16_le && re == encoding_utf16_be) || 
01124                            (le == encoding_utf32_be && re == encoding_utf32_le) || (le == encoding_utf32_le && re == encoding_utf32_be); 
01125         } 
01126  
01127         bool convert_buffer_endian_swap(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, bool is_mutable) 
01128         { 
01129                 const char_t* data = static_cast<const char_t*>(contents); 
01130          
01131                 if (is_mutable) 
01132                 { 
01133                         out_buffer = const_cast<char_t*>(data); 
01134                 } 
01135                 else 
01136                 { 
01137                         out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate(size > 0 ? size : 1)); 
01138                         if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01139                 } 
01140  
01141                 out_length = size / sizeof(char_t); 
01142  
01143                 convert_wchar_endian_swap(out_buffer, data, out_length); 
01144  
01145                 return true; 
01146         } 
01147  
01148         bool convert_buffer_utf8(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size) 
01149         { 
01150                 const uint8_t* data = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(contents); 
01151  
01152                 // first pass: get length in wchar_t units 
01153                 out_length = utf_decoder<wchar_counter>::decode_utf8_block(data, size, 0); 
01154  
01155                 // allocate buffer of suitable length 
01156                 out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((out_length > 0 ? out_length : 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
01157                 if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01158  
01159                 // second pass: convert utf8 input to wchar_t 
01160                 wchar_writer::value_type out_begin = reinterpret_cast<wchar_writer::value_type>(out_buffer); 
01161                 wchar_writer::value_type out_end = utf_decoder<wchar_writer>::decode_utf8_block(data, size, out_begin); 
01162  
01163                 assert(out_end == out_begin + out_length); 
01164                 (void)!out_end; 
01165  
01166                 return true; 
01167         } 
01168  
01169         template <typename opt_swap> bool convert_buffer_utf16(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, opt_swap) 
01170         { 
01171                 const uint16_t* data = static_cast<const uint16_t*>(contents); 
01172                 size_t length = size / sizeof(uint16_t); 
01173  
01174                 // first pass: get length in wchar_t units 
01175                 out_length = utf_decoder<wchar_counter, opt_swap>::decode_utf16_block(data, length, 0); 
01176  
01177                 // allocate buffer of suitable length 
01178                 out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((out_length > 0 ? out_length : 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
01179                 if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01180  
01181                 // second pass: convert utf16 input to wchar_t 
01182                 wchar_writer::value_type out_begin = reinterpret_cast<wchar_writer::value_type>(out_buffer); 
01183                 wchar_writer::value_type out_end = utf_decoder<wchar_writer, opt_swap>::decode_utf16_block(data, length, out_begin); 
01184  
01185                 assert(out_end == out_begin + out_length); 
01186                 (void)!out_end; 
01187  
01188                 return true; 
01189         } 
01190  
01191         template <typename opt_swap> bool convert_buffer_utf32(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, opt_swap) 
01192         { 
01193                 const uint32_t* data = static_cast<const uint32_t*>(contents); 
01194                 size_t length = size / sizeof(uint32_t); 
01195  
01196                 // first pass: get length in wchar_t units 
01197                 out_length = utf_decoder<wchar_counter, opt_swap>::decode_utf32_block(data, length, 0); 
01198  
01199                 // allocate buffer of suitable length 
01200                 out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((out_length > 0 ? out_length : 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
01201                 if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01202  
01203                 // second pass: convert utf32 input to wchar_t 
01204                 wchar_writer::value_type out_begin = reinterpret_cast<wchar_writer::value_type>(out_buffer); 
01205                 wchar_writer::value_type out_end = utf_decoder<wchar_writer, opt_swap>::decode_utf32_block(data, length, out_begin); 
01206  
01207                 assert(out_end == out_begin + out_length); 
01208                 (void)!out_end; 
01209  
01210                 return true; 
01211         } 
01212  
01213         bool convert_buffer(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, Encoding encoding, const void* contents, size_t size, bool is_mutable) 
01214         { 
01215                 // get native encoding 
01216                 Encoding wchar_encoding = get_wchar_encoding(); 
01217  
01218                 // fast path: no conversion required 
01219                 if (encoding == wchar_encoding) return get_mutable_buffer(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, is_mutable); 
01220  
01221                 // only endian-swapping is required 
01222                 if (need_endian_swap_utf(encoding, wchar_encoding)) return convert_buffer_endian_swap(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, is_mutable); 
01223  
01224                 // source encoding is utf8 
01225                 if (encoding == encoding_utf8) return convert_buffer_utf8(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size); 
01226  
01227                 // source encoding is utf16 
01228                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le) 
01229                 { 
01230                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
01231  
01232                         return (native_encoding == encoding) ? 
01233                                 convert_buffer_utf16(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_false()) : 
01234                                 convert_buffer_utf16(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_true()); 
01235                 } 
01236  
01237                 // source encoding is utf32 
01238                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le) 
01239                 { 
01240                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
01241  
01242                         return (native_encoding == encoding) ? 
01243                                 convert_buffer_utf32(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_false()) : 
01244                                 convert_buffer_utf32(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_true()); 
01245                 } 
01246  
01247                 assert(!"Invalid encoding"); 
01248                 return false; 
01249         } 
01250 #else 
01251         template <typename opt_swap> bool convert_buffer_utf16(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, opt_swap) 
01252         { 
01253                 const uint16_t* data = static_cast<const uint16_t*>(contents); 
01254                 size_t length = size / sizeof(uint16_t); 
01255  
01256                 // first pass: get length in utf8 units 
01257                 out_length = utf_decoder<utf8_counter, opt_swap>::decode_utf16_block(data, length, 0); 
01258  
01259                 // allocate buffer of suitable length 
01260                 out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((out_length > 0 ? out_length : 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
01261                 if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01262  
01263                 // second pass: convert utf16 input to utf8 
01264                 uint8_t* out_begin = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(out_buffer); 
01265                 uint8_t* out_end = utf_decoder<utf8_writer, opt_swap>::decode_utf16_block(data, length, out_begin); 
01266  
01267                 assert(out_end == out_begin + out_length); 
01268                 (void)!out_end; 
01269  
01270                 return true; 
01271         } 
01272  
01273         template <typename opt_swap> bool convert_buffer_utf32(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, const void* contents, size_t size, opt_swap) 
01274         { 
01275                 const uint32_t* data = static_cast<const uint32_t*>(contents); 
01276                 size_t length = size / sizeof(uint32_t); 
01277  
01278                 // first pass: get length in utf8 units 
01279                 out_length = utf_decoder<utf8_counter, opt_swap>::decode_utf32_block(data, length, 0); 
01280  
01281                 // allocate buffer of suitable length 
01282                 out_buffer = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((out_length > 0 ? out_length : 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
01283                 if (!out_buffer) return false; 
01284  
01285                 // second pass: convert utf32 input to utf8 
01286                 uint8_t* out_begin = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(out_buffer); 
01287                 uint8_t* out_end = utf_decoder<utf8_writer, opt_swap>::decode_utf32_block(data, length, out_begin); 
01288  
01289                 assert(out_end == out_begin + out_length); 
01290                 (void)!out_end; 
01291  
01292                 return true; 
01293         } 
01294  
01295         bool convert_buffer(char_t*& out_buffer, size_t& out_length, Encoding encoding, const void* contents, size_t size, bool is_mutable) 
01296         { 
01297                 // fast path: no conversion required 
01298                 if (encoding == encoding_utf8) return get_mutable_buffer(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, is_mutable); 
01299  
01300                 // source encoding is utf16 
01301                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le) 
01302                 { 
01303                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
01304  
01305                         return (native_encoding == encoding) ? 
01306                                 convert_buffer_utf16(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_false()) : 
01307                                 convert_buffer_utf16(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_true()); 
01308                 } 
01309  
01310                 // source encoding is utf32 
01311                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le) 
01312                 { 
01313                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
01314  
01315                         return (native_encoding == encoding) ? 
01316                                 convert_buffer_utf32(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_false()) : 
01317                                 convert_buffer_utf32(out_buffer, out_length, contents, size, opt_true()); 
01318                 } 
01319  
01320                 assert(!"Invalid encoding"); 
01321                 return false; 
01322         } 
01323 #endif 
01324  
01325         size_t as_utf8_begin(const wchar_t* str, size_t length) 
01326         { 
01327                 STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 || sizeof(wchar_t) == 4); 
01328  
01329                 // get length in utf8 characters 
01330                 return sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 ? 
01331                         utf_decoder<utf8_counter>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(str), length, 0) : 
01332                         utf_decoder<utf8_counter>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(str), length, 0); 
01333         } 
01334  
01335         void as_utf8_end(char* buffer, size_t size, const wchar_t* str, size_t length) 
01336         { 
01337                 STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 || sizeof(wchar_t) == 4); 
01338  
01339                 // convert to utf8 
01340                 uint8_t* begin = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(buffer); 
01341                 uint8_t* end = sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 ? 
01342                         utf_decoder<utf8_writer>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(str), length, begin) : 
01343                         utf_decoder<utf8_writer>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(str), length, begin); 
01344          
01345                 assert(begin + size == end); 
01346                 (void)!end; 
01347  
01348                 // zero-terminate 
01349                 buffer[size] = 0; 
01350         } 
01351          
01352 #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
01353         std::string as_utf8_impl(const wchar_t* str, size_t length) 
01354         { 
01355                 // first pass: get length in utf8 characters 
01356                 size_t size = as_utf8_begin(str, length); 
01357  
01358                 // allocate resulting string 
01359                 std::string result; 
01360                 result.resize(size); 
01361  
01362                 // second pass: convert to utf8 
01363                 if (size > 0) as_utf8_end(&result[0], size, str, length); 
01364  
01365                 return result; 
01366         } 
01367  
01368         std::wstring as_wide_impl(const char* str, size_t size) 
01369         { 
01370                 const uint8_t* data = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(str); 
01371  
01372                 // first pass: get length in wchar_t units 
01373                 size_t length = utf_decoder<wchar_counter>::decode_utf8_block(data, size, 0); 
01374  
01375                 // allocate resulting string 
01376                 std::wstring result; 
01377                 result.resize(length); 
01378  
01379                 // second pass: convert to wchar_t 
01380                 if (length > 0) 
01381                 { 
01382                         wchar_writer::value_type begin = reinterpret_cast<wchar_writer::value_type>(&result[0]); 
01383                         wchar_writer::value_type end = utf_decoder<wchar_writer>::decode_utf8_block(data, size, begin); 
01384  
01385                         assert(begin + length == end); 
01386                         (void)!end; 
01387                 } 
01388  
01389                 return result; 
01390         } 
01391 #endif 
01392  
01393         inline bool strcpy_insitu_allow(size_t length, uintptr_t allocated, char_t* target) 
01394         { 
01395                 assert(target); 
01396                 size_t target_length = strlength(target); 
01397  
01398                 // always reuse document buffer memory if possible 
01399                 if (!allocated) return target_length >= length; 
01400  
01401                 // reuse heap memory if waste is not too great 
01402                 const size_t reuse_threshold = 32; 
01403  
01404                 return target_length >= length && (target_length < reuse_threshold || target_length - length < target_length / 2); 
01405         } 
01406  
01407         bool strcpy_insitu(char_t*& dest, uintptr_t& header, uintptr_t header_mask, const char_t* source) 
01408         { 
01409                 size_t source_length = strlength(source); 
01410  
01411                 if (source_length == 0) 
01412                 { 
01413                         // empty string and null pointer are equivalent, so just deallocate old memory 
01414                         Allocator* alloc = reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(header & MemoryPage_pointer_mask)->allocator; 
01415  
01416                         if (header & header_mask) alloc->deallocate_string(dest); 
01417                          
01418                         // mark the string as not allocated 
01419                         dest = 0; 
01420                         header &= ~header_mask; 
01421  
01422                         return true; 
01423                 } 
01424                 else if (dest && strcpy_insitu_allow(source_length, header & header_mask, dest)) 
01425                 { 
01426                         // we can reuse old buffer, so just copy the new data (including zero terminator) 
01427                         memcpy(dest, source, (source_length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)); 
01428                          
01429                         return true; 
01430                 } 
01431                 else 
01432                 { 
01433                         Allocator* alloc = reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(header & MemoryPage_pointer_mask)->allocator; 
01434  
01435                         // allocate new buffer 
01436                         char_t* buf = alloc->allocate_string(source_length + 1); 
01437                         if (!buf) return false; 
01438  
01439                         // copy the string (including zero terminator) 
01440                         memcpy(buf, source, (source_length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)); 
01441  
01442                         // deallocate old buffer (*after* the above to protect against overlapping memory and/or allocation failures) 
01443                         if (header & header_mask) alloc->deallocate_string(dest); 
01444                          
01445                         // the string is now allocated, so set the flag 
01446                         dest = buf; 
01447                         header |= header_mask; 
01448  
01449                         return true; 
01450                 } 
01451         } 
01452  
01453         struct gap 
01454         { 
01455                 char_t* end; 
01456                 size_t size; 
01457                          
01458                 gap(): end(0), size(0) 
01459                 { 
01460                 } 
01461                          
01462                 // Push new gap, move s count bytes further (skipping the gap). 
01463                 // Collapse previous gap. 
01464                 void push(char_t*& s, size_t count) 
01465                 { 
01466                         if (end) // there was a gap already; collapse it 
01467                         { 
01468                                 // Move [old_gap_end, new_gap_start) to [old_gap_start, ...) 
01469                                 assert(s >= end); 
01470                                 memmove(end - size, end, reinterpret_cast<char*>(s) - reinterpret_cast<char*>(end)); 
01471                         } 
01472                                  
01473                         s += count; // end of current gap 
01474                                  
01475                         // "merge" two gaps 
01476                         end = s; 
01477                         size += count; 
01478                 } 
01479                          
01480                 // Collapse all gaps, return past-the-end pointer 
01481                 char_t* flush(char_t* s) 
01482                 { 
01483                         if (end) 
01484                         { 
01485                                 // Move [old_gap_end, current_pos) to [old_gap_start, ...) 
01486                                 assert(s >= end); 
01487                                 memmove(end - size, end, reinterpret_cast<char*>(s) - reinterpret_cast<char*>(end)); 
01488  
01489                                 return s - size; 
01490                         } 
01491                         else return s; 
01492                 } 
01493         }; 
01494          
01495         char_t* strconv_escape(char_t* s, gap& g) 
01496         { 
01497                 char_t* stre = s + 1; 
01498  
01499                 switch (*stre) 
01500                 { 
01501                         case '#':       // &#... 
01502                         { 
01503                                 unsigned int ucsc = 0; 
01504  
01505                                 if (stre[1] == 'x') // &#x... (hex code) 
01506                                 { 
01507                                         stre += 2; 
01508  
01509                                         char_t ch = *stre; 
01510  
01511                                         if (ch == ';') return stre; 
01512  
01513                                         for (;;) 
01514                                         { 
01515                                                 if (static_cast<unsigned int>(ch - '0') <= 9) 
01516                                                         ucsc = 16 * ucsc + (ch - '0'); 
01517                                                 else if (static_cast<unsigned int>((ch | ' ') - 'a') <= 5) 
01518                                                         ucsc = 16 * ucsc + ((ch | ' ') - 'a' + 10); 
01519                                                 else if (ch == ';') 
01520                                                         break; 
01521                                                 else // cancel 
01522                                                         return stre; 
01523  
01524                                                 ch = *++stre; 
01525                                         } 
01526                                          
01527                                         ++stre; 
01528                                 } 
01529                                 else    // &#... (dec code) 
01530                                 { 
01531                                         char_t ch = *++stre; 
01532  
01533                                         if (ch == ';') return stre; 
01534  
01535                                         for (;;) 
01536                                         { 
01537                                                 if (static_cast<unsigned int>(ch - '0') <= 9) 
01538                                                         ucsc = 10 * ucsc + (ch - '0'); 
01539                                                 else if (ch == ';') 
01540                                                         break; 
01541                                                 else // cancel 
01542                                                         return stre; 
01543  
01544                                                 ch = *++stre; 
01545                                         } 
01546                                          
01547                                         ++stre; 
01548                                 } 
01549  
01550                         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
01551                                 s = reinterpret_cast<char_t*>(wchar_writer::any(reinterpret_cast<wchar_writer::value_type>(s), ucsc)); 
01552                         #else 
01553                                 s = reinterpret_cast<char_t*>(utf8_writer::any(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(s), ucsc)); 
01554                         #endif 
01555                                          
01556                                 g.push(s, stre - s); 
01557                                 return stre; 
01558                         } 
01559                         case 'a':       // &a 
01560                         { 
01561                                 ++stre; 
01562  
01563                                 if (*stre == 'm') // &am 
01564                                 { 
01565                                         if (*++stre == 'p' && *++stre == ';') // &amp; 
01566                                         { 
01567                                                 *s++ = '&'; 
01568                                                 ++stre; 
01569                                                          
01570                                                 g.push(s, stre - s); 
01571                                                 return stre; 
01572                                         } 
01573                                 } 
01574                                 else if (*stre == 'p') // &ap 
01575                                 { 
01576                                         if (*++stre == 'o' && *++stre == 's' && *++stre == ';') // &apos; 
01577                                         { 
01578                                                 *s++ = '\''; 
01579                                                 ++stre; 
01580  
01581                                                 g.push(s, stre - s); 
01582                                                 return stre; 
01583                                         } 
01584                                 } 
01585                                 break; 
01586                         } 
01587                         case 'g': // &g 
01588                         { 
01589                                 if (*++stre == 't' && *++stre == ';') // &gt; 
01590                                 { 
01591                                         *s++ = '>'; 
01592                                         ++stre; 
01593                                          
01594                                         g.push(s, stre - s); 
01595                                         return stre; 
01596                                 } 
01597                                 break; 
01598                         } 
01599                         case 'l': // &l 
01600                         { 
01601                                 if (*++stre == 't' && *++stre == ';') // &lt; 
01602                                 { 
01603                                         *s++ = '<'; 
01604                                         ++stre; 
01605                                                  
01606                                         g.push(s, stre - s); 
01607                                         return stre; 
01608                                 } 
01609                                 break; 
01610                         } 
01611                         case 'q': // &q 
01612                         { 
01613                                 if (*++stre == 'u' && *++stre == 'o' && *++stre == 't' && *++stre == ';') // &quot; 
01614                                 { 
01615                                         *s++ = '"'; 
01616                                         ++stre; 
01617                                          
01618                                         g.push(s, stre - s); 
01619                                         return stre; 
01620                                 } 
01621                                 break; 
01622                         } 
01623                 } 
01624                  
01625                 return stre; 
01626         } 
01627  
01628         // Utility macro for last character handling 
01629         #define ENDSWITH(c, e) ((c) == (e) || ((c) == 0 && endch == (e))) 
01630  
01631         char_t* strconv_comment(char_t* s, char_t endch) 
01632         { 
01633                 gap g; 
01634                  
01635                 while (true) 
01636                 { 
01637                         while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_comment)) ++s; 
01638                  
01639                         if (*s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair 
01640                         { 
01641                                 *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a 
01642                                  
01643                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01644                         } 
01645                         else if (s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')) // comment ends here 
01646                         { 
01647                                 *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01648                                  
01649                                 return s + (s[2] == '>' ? 3 : 2); 
01650                         } 
01651                         else if (*s == 0) 
01652                         { 
01653                                 return 0; 
01654                         } 
01655                         else ++s; 
01656                 } 
01657         } 
01658  
01659         char_t* strconv_cdata(char_t* s, char_t endch) 
01660         { 
01661                 gap g; 
01662                          
01663                 while (true) 
01664                 { 
01665                         while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_cdata)) ++s; 
01666                          
01667                         if (*s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair 
01668                         { 
01669                                 *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a 
01670                                  
01671                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01672                         } 
01673                         else if (s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')) // CDATA ends here 
01674                         { 
01675                                 *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01676                                  
01677                                 return s + 1; 
01678                         } 
01679                         else if (*s == 0) 
01680                         { 
01681                                 return 0; 
01682                         } 
01683                         else ++s; 
01684                 } 
01685         } 
01686          
01687         typedef char_t* (*strconv_pcdata_t)(char_t*); 
01688                  
01689         template <typename opt_eol, typename opt_escape> struct strconv_pcdata_impl 
01690         { 
01691                 static char_t* parse(char_t* s) 
01692                 { 
01693                         gap g; 
01694                          
01695                         while (true) 
01696                         { 
01697                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_pcdata)) ++s; 
01698                                          
01699                                 if (*s == '<') // PCDATA ends here 
01700                                 { 
01701                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01702                                          
01703                                         return s + 1; 
01704                                 } 
01705                                 else if (opt_eol::value && *s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair 
01706                                 { 
01707                                         *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a 
01708                                          
01709                                         if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01710                                 } 
01711                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&') 
01712                                 { 
01713                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01714                                 } 
01715                                 else if (*s == 0) 
01716                                 { 
01717                                         return s; 
01718                                 } 
01719                                 else ++s; 
01720                         } 
01721                 } 
01722         }; 
01723          
01724         strconv_pcdata_t get_strconv_pcdata(unsigned int optmask) 
01725         { 
01726                 STATIC_ASSERT(parse_escapes == 0x10 && parse_eol == 0x20); 
01727  
01728                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 3) // get bitmask for flags (eol escapes) 
01729                 { 
01730                 case 0: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_false>::parse; 
01731                 case 1: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_true>::parse; 
01732                 case 2: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_false>::parse; 
01733                 case 3: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_true>::parse; 
01734                 default: return 0; // should not get here 
01735                 } 
01736         } 
01737  
01738         typedef char_t* (*strconv_attribute_t)(char_t*, char_t); 
01739          
01740         template <typename opt_escape> struct strconv_attribute_impl 
01741         { 
01742                 static char_t* parse_wnorm(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01743                 { 
01744                         gap g; 
01745  
01746                         // trim leading whitespaces 
01747                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01748                         { 
01749                                 char_t* str = s; 
01750                                  
01751                                 do ++str; 
01752                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)); 
01753                                  
01754                                 g.push(s, str - s); 
01755                         } 
01756  
01757                         while (true) 
01758                         { 
01759                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr_ws | ct_space)) ++s; 
01760                                  
01761                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01762                                 { 
01763                                         char_t* str = g.flush(s); 
01764                                          
01765                                         do *str-- = 0; 
01766                                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)); 
01767                                  
01768                                         return s + 1; 
01769                                 } 
01770                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01771                                 { 
01772                                         *s++ = ' '; 
01773                  
01774                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01775                                         { 
01776                                                 char_t* str = s + 1; 
01777                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)) ++str; 
01778                                                  
01779                                                 g.push(s, str - s); 
01780                                         } 
01781                                 } 
01782                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&') 
01783                                 { 
01784                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01785                                 } 
01786                                 else if (!*s) 
01787                                 { 
01788                                         return 0; 
01789                                 } 
01790                                 else ++s; 
01791                         } 
01792                 } 
01793  
01794                 static char_t* parse_wconv(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01795                 { 
01796                         gap g; 
01797  
01798                         while (true) 
01799                         { 
01800                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr_ws)) ++s; 
01801                                  
01802                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01803                                 { 
01804                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01805                                  
01806                                         return s + 1; 
01807                                 } 
01808                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) 
01809                                 { 
01810                                         if (*s == '\r') 
01811                                         { 
01812                                                 *s++ = ' '; 
01813                                  
01814                                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01815                                         } 
01816                                         else *s++ = ' '; 
01817                                 } 
01818                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&') 
01819                                 { 
01820                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01821                                 } 
01822                                 else if (!*s) 
01823                                 { 
01824                                         return 0; 
01825                                 } 
01826                                 else ++s; 
01827                         } 
01828                 } 
01829  
01830                 static char_t* parse_eol(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01831                 { 
01832                         gap g; 
01833  
01834                         while (true) 
01835                         { 
01836                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr)) ++s; 
01837                                  
01838                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01839                                 { 
01840                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01841                                  
01842                                         return s + 1; 
01843                                 } 
01844                                 else if (*s == '\r') 
01845                                 { 
01846                                         *s++ = '\n'; 
01847                                          
01848                                         if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1); 
01849                                 } 
01850                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&') 
01851                                 { 
01852                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01853                                 } 
01854                                 else if (!*s) 
01855                                 { 
01856                                         return 0; 
01857                                 } 
01858                                 else ++s; 
01859                         } 
01860                 } 
01861  
01862                 static char_t* parse_simple(char_t* s, char_t end_quote) 
01863                 { 
01864                         gap g; 
01865  
01866                         while (true) 
01867                         { 
01868                                 while (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr)) ++s; 
01869                                  
01870                                 if (*s == end_quote) 
01871                                 { 
01872                                         *g.flush(s) = 0; 
01873                                  
01874                                         return s + 1; 
01875                                 } 
01876                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&') 
01877                                 { 
01878                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g); 
01879                                 } 
01880                                 else if (!*s) 
01881                                 { 
01882                                         return 0; 
01883                                 } 
01884                                 else ++s; 
01885                         } 
01886                 } 
01887         }; 
01888  
01889         strconv_attribute_t get_strconv_attribute(unsigned int optmask) 
01890         { 
01891                 STATIC_ASSERT(parse_escapes == 0x10 && parse_eol == 0x20 && parse_wconv_attribute == 0x40 && parse_wnorm_attribute == 0x80); 
01892                  
01893                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 15) // get bitmask for flags (wconv wnorm eol escapes) 
01894                 { 
01895                 case 0:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_simple; 
01896                 case 1:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_simple; 
01897                 case 2:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_eol; 
01898                 case 3:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_eol; 
01899                 case 4:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wconv; 
01900                 case 5:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wconv; 
01901                 case 6:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wconv; 
01902                 case 7:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wconv; 
01903                 case 8:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm; 
01904                 case 9:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm; 
01905                 case 10: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm; 
01906                 case 11: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm; 
01907                 case 12: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm; 
01908                 case 13: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm; 
01909                 case 14: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm; 
01910                 case 15: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm; 
01911                 default: return 0; // should not get here 
01912                 } 
01913         } 
01914  
01915         inline ParseResult make_parse_result(ParseStatus status, ptrdiff_t offset = 0) 
01916         { 
01917                 ParseResult result; 
01918                 result.status = status; 
01919                 result.offset = offset; 
01920  
01921                 return result; 
01922         } 
01923  
01924         struct Parser 
01925         { 
01926                 Allocator alloc; 
01927                 char_t* error_offset; 
01928                 jmp_buf error_handler; 
01929
