01930                 // Parser utilities. 
01931                 #define SKIPWS()                        { while (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) ++s; } 
01932                 #define OPTSET(OPT)                     ( optmsk & OPT ) 
01933                 #define PUSHNODE(TYPE)          { cursor = append_node(cursor, alloc, TYPE); if (!cursor) THROW_ERROR(StatusOutOfMemory, s); } 
01934                 #define POPNODE()                       { cursor = cursor->parent; } 
01935                 #define SCANFOR(X)                      { while (*s != 0 && !(X)) ++s; } 
01936                 #define SCANWHILE(X)            { while ((X)) ++s; } 
01937                 #define ENDSEG()                        { ch = *s; *s = 0; ++s; } 
01938                 #define THROW_ERROR(err, m)     error_offset = m, longjmp(error_handler, err) 
01939                 #define CHECK_ERROR(err, m)     { if (*s == 0) THROW_ERROR(err, m); } 
01940                  
01941                 Parser(const Allocator& alloc): alloc(alloc), error_offset(0) 
01942                 { 
01943                 } 
01944  
01945                 // DOCTYPE consists of nested sections of the following possible types: 
01946                 // <!-- ... -->, <? ... ?>, "...", '...' 
01947                 // <![...]]> 
01948                 // <!...> 
01949                 // First group can not contain nested groups 
01950                 // Second group can contain nested groups of the same type 
01951                 // Third group can contain all other groups 
01952                 char_t* parse_doctype_primitive(char_t* s) 
01953                 { 
01954                         if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'') 
01955                         { 
01956                                 // quoted string 
01957                                 char_t ch = *s++; 
01958                                 SCANFOR(*s == ch); 
01959                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
01960  
01961                                 s++; 
01962                         } 
01963                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '?') 
01964                         { 
01965                                 // <? ... ?> 
01966                                 s += 2; 
01967                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && s[1] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because ?> can't terminate proper doctype 
01968                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
01969  
01970                                 s += 2; 
01971                         } 
01972                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '-' && s[3] == '-') 
01973                         { 
01974                                 s += 4; 
01975                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && s[2] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because --> can't terminate proper doctype 
01976                                 if (!*s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
01977  
01978                                 s += 4; 
01979                         } 
01980                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
01981  
01982                         return s; 
01983                 } 
01984  
01985                 char_t* parse_doctype_ignore(char_t* s) 
01986                 { 
01987                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '['); 
01988                         s++; 
01989  
01990                         while (*s) 
01991                         { 
01992                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '[') 
01993                                 { 
01994                                         // nested ignore section 
01995                                         s = parse_doctype_ignore(s); 
01996                                 } 
01997                                 else if (s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>') 
01998                                 { 
01999                                         // ignore section end 
02000                                         s += 3; 
02001  
02002                                         return s; 
02003                                 } 
02004                                 else s++; 
02005                         } 
02006  
02007                         THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
02008  
02009                         return s; 
02010                 } 
02011  
02012                 char_t* parse_doctype_group(char_t* s, char_t endch, bool toplevel) 
02013                 { 
02014                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!'); 
02015                         s++; 
02016  
02017                         while (*s) 
02018                         { 
02019                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] != '-') 
02020                                 { 
02021                                         if (s[2] == '[') 
02022                                         { 
02023                                                 // ignore 
02024                                                 s = parse_doctype_ignore(s); 
02025                                         } 
02026                                         else 
02027                                         { 
02028                                                 // some control group 
02029                                                 s = parse_doctype_group(s, endch, false); 
02030                                         } 
02031                                 } 
02032                                 else if (s[0] == '<' || s[0] == '"' || s[0] == '\'') 
02033                                 { 
02034                                         // unknown tag (forbidden), or some primitive group 
02035                                         s = parse_doctype_primitive(s); 
02036                                 } 
02037                                 else if (*s == '>') 
02038                                 { 
02039                                         s++; 
02040  
02041                                         return s; 
02042                                 } 
02043                                 else s++; 
02044                         } 
02045  
02046                         if (!toplevel || endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
02047  
02048                         return s; 
02049                 } 
02050  
02051                 char_t* parse_exclamation(char_t* s, NodeStruct* cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02052                 { 
02053                         // parse node contents, starting with exclamation mark 
02054                         ++s; 
02055  
02056                         if (*s == '-') // '<!-...' 
02057                         { 
02058                                 ++s; 
02059  
02060                                 if (*s == '-') // '<!--...' 
02061                                 { 
02062                                         ++s; 
02063  
02064                                         if (OPTSET(parse_comments)) 
02065                                         { 
02066                                                 PUSHNODE(node_comment); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02067                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset. 
02068                                         } 
02069  
02070                                         if (OPTSET(parse_eol) && OPTSET(parse_comments)) 
02071                                         { 
02072                                                 s = strconv_comment(s, endch); 
02073  
02074                                                 if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, cursor->value); 
02075                                         } 
02076                                         else 
02077                                         { 
02078                                                 // Scan for terminating '-->'. 
02079                                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02080                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02081  
02082                                                 if (OPTSET(parse_comments)) 
02083                                                         *s = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment at the first terminating '-'. 
02084  
02085                                                 s += (s[2] == '>' ? 3 : 2); // Step over the '\0->'. 
02086                                         } 
02087                                 } 
02088                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02089                         } 
02090                         else if (*s == '[') 
02091                         { 
02092                                 // '<![CDATA[...' 
02093                                 if (*++s=='C' && *++s=='D' && *++s=='A' && *++s=='T' && *++s=='A' && *++s == '[') 
02094                                 { 
02095                                         ++s; 
02096  
02097                                         if (OPTSET(parse_cdata)) 
02098                                         { 
02099                                                 PUSHNODE(node_cdata); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02100                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset. 
02101  
02102                                                 if (OPTSET(parse_eol)) 
02103                                                 { 
02104                                                         s = strconv_cdata(s, endch); 
02105  
02106                                                         if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, cursor->value); 
02107                                                 } 
02108                                                 else 
02109                                                 { 
02110                                                         // Scan for terminating ']]>'. 
02111                                                         SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02112                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02113  
02114                                                         *s++ = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment. 
02115                                                 } 
02116                                         } 
02117                                         else // Flagged for discard, but we still have to scan for the terminator. 
02118                                         { 
02119                                                 // Scan for terminating ']]>'. 
02120                                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')); 
02121                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02122  
02123                                                 ++s; 
02124                                         } 
02125  
02126                                         s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1); // Step over the last ']>'. 
02127                                 } 
02128                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02129                         } 
02130                         else if (s[0] == 'D' && s[1] == 'O' && s[2] == 'C' && s[3] == 'T' && s[4] == 'Y' && s[5] == 'P' && ENDSWITH(s[6], 'E')) 
02131                         { 
02132                                 s -= 2; 
02133  
02134                                 if (cursor->parent) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadDoctype, s); 
02135  
02136                                 char_t* mark = s + 9; 
02137  
02138                                 s = parse_doctype_group(s, endch, true); 
02139  
02140                                 if (OPTSET(parse_doctype)) 
02141                                 { 
02142                                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*mark, ct_space)) ++mark; 
02143  
02144                                         PUSHNODE(node_doctype); 
02145  
02146                                         cursor->value = mark; 
02147  
02148                                         assert((s[0] == 0 && endch == '>') || s[-1] == '>'); 
02149                                         s[*s == 0 ? 0 : -1] = 0; 
02150  
02151                                         POPNODE(); 
02152                                 } 
02153                         } 
02154                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '-') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadComment, s); 
02155                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '[') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadCdata, s); 
02156                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusUnrecognizedTag, s); 
02157  
02158                         return s; 
02159                 } 
02160  
02161                 char_t* parse_question(char_t* s, NodeStruct*& ref_cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02162                 { 
02163                         // load into registers 
02164                         NodeStruct* cursor = ref_cursor; 
02165                         char_t ch = 0; 
02166  
02167                         // parse node contents, starting with question mark 
02168                         ++s; 
02169  
02170                         // read PI target 
02171                         char_t* target = s; 
02172  
02173                         if (!IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02174  
02175                         SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); 
02176                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02177  
02178                         // determine node type; stricmp / strcasecmp is not portable 
02179                         bool declaration = (target[0] | ' ') == 'x' && (target[1] | ' ') == 'm' && (target[2] | ' ') == 'l' && target + 3 == s; 
02180  
02181                         if (declaration ? OPTSET(parse_declaration) : OPTSET(parse_pi)) 
02182                         { 
02183                                 if (declaration) 
02184                                 { 
02185                                         // disallow non top-level declarations 
02186                                         if (cursor->parent) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02187  
02188                                         PUSHNODE(node_declaration); 
02189                                 } 
02190                                 else 
02191                                 { 
02192                                         PUSHNODE(node_pi); 
02193                                 } 
02194  
02195                                 cursor->name = target; 
02196  
02197                                 ENDSEG(); 
02198  
02199                                 // parse value/attributes 
02200                                 if (ch == '?') 
02201                                 { 
02202                                         // empty node 
02203                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02204                                         s += (*s == '>'); 
02205  
02206                                         POPNODE(); 
02207                                 } 
02208                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02209                                 { 
02210                                         SKIPWS(); 
02211  
02212                                         // scan for tag end 
02213                                         char_t* value = s; 
02214  
02215                                         SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>')); 
02216                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02217  
02218                                         if (declaration) 
02219                                         { 
02220                                                 // replace ending ? with / so that 'element' terminates properly 
02221                                                 *s = '/'; 
02222  
02223                                                 // we exit from this function with cursor at node_declaration, which is a signal to parse() to go to LOC_ATTRIBUTES 
02224                                                 s = value; 
02225                                         } 
02226                                         else 
02227                                         { 
02228                                                 // store value and step over > 
02229                                                 cursor->value = value; 
02230                                                 POPNODE(); 
02231  
02232                                                 ENDSEG(); 
02233  
02234                                                 s += (*s == '>'); 
02235                                         } 
02236                                 } 
02237                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02238                         } 
02239                         else 
02240                         { 
02241                                 // scan for tag end 
02242                                 SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>')); 
02243                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02244  
02245                                 s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1); 
02246                         } 
02247  
02248                         // store from registers 
02249                         ref_cursor = cursor; 
02250  
02251                         return s; 
02252                 } 
02253  
02254                 void parse(char_t* s, NodeStruct* xmldoc, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch) 
02255                 { 
02256                         strconv_attribute_t strconv_attribute = get_strconv_attribute(optmsk); 
02257                         strconv_pcdata_t strconv_pcdata = get_strconv_pcdata(optmsk); 
02258                          
02259                         char_t ch = 0; 
02260                         NodeStruct* cursor = xmldoc; 
02261                         char_t* mark = s; 
02262  
02263                         while (*s != 0) 
02264                         { 
02265                                 if (*s == '<') 
02266                                 { 
02267                                         ++s; 
02268  
02269                                 LOC_TAG: 
02270                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // '<#...' 
02271                                         { 
02272                                                 PUSHNODE(node_element); // Append a new node to the tree. 
02273  
02274                                                 cursor->name = s; 
02275  
02276                                                 SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator. 
02277                                                 ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over. 
02278  
02279                                                 if (ch == '>') 
02280                                                 { 
02281                                                         // end of tag 
02282                                                 } 
02283                                                 else if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02284                                                 { 
02285                                                 LOC_ATTRIBUTES: 
02286                                                         while (true) 
02287                                                         { 
02288                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02289                                                  
02290                                                                 if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // <... #... 
02291                                                                 { 
02292                                                                         AttributeStruct* a = append_attribute_ll(cursor, alloc); // Make space for this attribute. 
02293                                                                         if (!a) THROW_ERROR(StatusOutOfMemory, s); 
02294  
02295                                                                         a->name = s; // Save the offset. 
02296  
02297                                                                         SCANWHILE(IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator. 
02298                                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02299  
02300                                                                         ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over. 
02301                                                                         CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02302  
02303                                                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
02304                                                                         { 
02305                                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02306                                                                                 CHECK_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance 
02307  
02308                                                                                 ch = *s; 
02309                                                                                 ++s; 
02310                                                                         } 
02311                                                                          
02312                                                                         if (ch == '=') // '<... #=...' 
02313                                                                         { 
02314                                                                                 SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace. 
02315  
02316                                                                                 if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'') // '<... #="...' 
02317                                                                                 { 
02318                                                                                         ch = *s; // Save quote char to avoid breaking on "''" -or- '""'. 
02319                                                                                         ++s; // Step over the quote. 
02320                                                                                         a->value = s; // Save the offset. 
02321  
02322                                                                                         s = strconv_attribute(s, ch); 
02323                                                                                  
02324                                                                                         if (!s) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, a->value); 
02325  
02326                                                                                         // After this line the loop continues from the start; 
02327                                                                                         // Whitespaces, / and > are ok, symbols and EOF are wrong, 
02328                                                                                         // everything else will be detected 
02329                                                                                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02330                                                                                 } 
02331                                                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02332                                                                         } 
02333                                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadAttribute, s); 
02334                                                                 } 
02335                                                                 else if (*s == '/') 
02336                                                                 { 
02337                                                                         ++s; 
02338                                                                          
02339                                                                         if (*s == '>') 
02340                                                                         { 
02341                                                                                 POPNODE(); 
02342                                                                                 s++; 
02343                                                                                 break; 
02344                                                                         } 
02345                                                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>') 
02346                                                                         { 
02347                                                                                 POPNODE(); 
02348                                                                                 break; 
02349                                                                         } 
02350                                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02351                                                                 } 
02352                                                                 else if (*s == '>') 
02353                                                                 { 
02354                                                                         ++s; 
02355  
02356                                                                         break; 
02357                                                                 } 
02358                                                                 else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>') 
02359                                                                 { 
02360                                                                         break; 
02361                                                                 } 
02362                                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02363                                                         } 
02364  
02365                                                         // !!! 
02366                                                 } 
02367                                                 else if (ch == '/') // '<#.../' 
02368                                                 { 
02369                                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02370  
02371                                                         POPNODE(); // Pop. 
02372  
02373                                                         s += (*s == '>'); 
02374                                                 } 
02375                                                 else if (ch == 0) 
02376                                                 { 
02377                                                         // we stepped over null terminator, backtrack & handle closing tag 
02378                                                         --s; 
02379                                                          
02380                                                         if (endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02381                                                 } 
02382                                                 else THROW_ERROR(StatusBadStartElement, s); 
02383                                         } 
02384                                         else if (*s == '/') 
02385                                         { 
02386                                                 ++s; 
02387  
02388                                                 char_t* name = cursor->name; 
02389                                                 if (!name) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02390                                                  
02391                                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)) 
02392                                                 { 
02393                                                         if (*s++ != *name++) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02394                                                 } 
02395  
02396                                                 if (*name) 
02397                                                 { 
02398                                                         if (*s == 0 && name[0] == endch && name[1] == 0) THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02399                                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02400                                                 } 
02401                                                          
02402                                                 POPNODE(); // Pop. 
02403  
02404                                                 SKIPWS(); 
02405  
02406                                                 if (*s == 0) 
02407                                                 { 
02408                                                         if (endch != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02409                                                 } 
02410                                                 else 
02411                                                 { 
02412                                                         if (*s != '>') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadEndElement, s); 
02413                                                         ++s; 
02414                                                 } 
02415                                         } 
02416                                         else if (*s == '?') // '<?...' 
02417                                         { 
02418                                                 s = parse_question(s, cursor, optmsk, endch); 
02419  
02420                                                 assert(cursor); 
02421                                                 if ((cursor->header & MemoryPage_type_mask) + 1 == node_declaration) goto LOC_ATTRIBUTES; 
02422                                         } 
02423                                         else if (*s == '!') // '<!...' 
02424                                         { 
02425                                                 s = parse_exclamation(s, cursor, optmsk, endch); 
02426                                         } 
02427                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '?') THROW_ERROR(StatusBadPi, s); 
02428                                         else THROW_ERROR(StatusUnrecognizedTag, s); 
02429                                 } 
02430                                 else 
02431                                 { 
02432                                         mark = s; // Save this offset while searching for a terminator. 
02433  
02434                                         SKIPWS(); // Eat whitespace if no genuine PCDATA here. 
02435  
02436                                         if ((!OPTSET(parse_ws_pcdata) || mark == s) && (*s == '<' || !*s)) 
02437                                         { 
02438                                                 continue; 
02439                                         } 
02440  
02441                                         s = mark; 
02442                                                          
02443                                         if (cursor->parent) 
02444                                         { 
02445                                                 PUSHNODE(node_pcdata); // Append a new node on the tree. 
02446                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset. 
02447  
02448                                                 s = strconv_pcdata(s); 
02449                                                                  
02450                                                 POPNODE(); // Pop since this is a standalone. 
02451                                                  
02452                                                 if (!*s) break; 
02453                                         } 
02454                                         else 
02455                                         { 
02456                                                 SCANFOR(*s == '<'); // '...<' 
02457                                                 if (!*s) break; 
02458                                                  
02459                                                 ++s; 
02460                                         } 
02461  
02462                                         // We're after '<' 
02463                                         goto LOC_TAG; 
02464                                 } 
02465                         } 
02466  
02467                         // check that last tag is closed 
02468                         if (cursor != xmldoc) THROW_ERROR(StatusEndElementMismatch, s); 
02469                 } 
02470  
02471                 static ParseResult parse(char_t* buffer, size_t length, NodeStruct* root, unsigned int optmsk) 
02472                 { 
02473                         DocumentStruct* xmldoc = static_cast<DocumentStruct*>(root); 
02474  
02475                         // store buffer for offset_debug 
02476                         xmldoc->buffer = buffer; 
02477  
02478                         // early-out for empty documents 
02479                         if (length == 0) return make_parse_result(StatusOk); 
02480  
02481                         // create parser on stack 
02482                         Parser parser(*xmldoc); 
02483  
02484                         // save last character and make buffer zero-terminated (speeds up parsing) 
02485                         char_t endch = buffer[length - 1]; 
02486                         buffer[length - 1] = 0; 
02487                          
02488                         // perform actual parsing 
02489                         int error = setjmp(parser.error_handler); 
02490  
02491                         if (error == 0) 
02492                         { 
02493                                 parser.parse(buffer, xmldoc, optmsk, endch); 
02494                         } 
02495  
02496                         ParseResult result = make_parse_result(static_cast<ParseStatus>(error), parser.error_offset ? parser.error_offset - buffer : 0); 
02497                         assert(result.offset >= 0 && static_cast<size_t>(result.offset) <= length); 
02498  
02499                         // update allocator state 
02500                         *static_cast<Allocator*>(xmldoc) = parser.alloc; 
02501  
02502                         // since we removed last character, we have to handle the only possible false positive 
02503                         if (result && endch == '<') 
02504                         { 
02505                                 // there's no possible well-formed document with < at the end 
02506                                 return make_parse_result(StatusUnrecognizedTag, length); 
02507                         } 
02508  
02509                         return result; 
02510                 } 
02511         }; 
02512  
02513         // Output facilities 
02514         Encoding get_write_native_encoding() 
02515         { 
02516         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
02517                 return get_wchar_encoding(); 
02518         #else 
02519                 return encoding_utf8; 
02520         #endif 
02521         } 
02522  
02523         Encoding get_write_encoding(Encoding encoding) 
02524         { 
02525                 // replace wchar encoding with utf implementation 
02526                 if (encoding == encoding_wchar) return get_wchar_encoding(); 
02527  
02528                 // replace utf16 encoding with utf16 with specific endianness 
02529                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
02530  
02531                 // replace utf32 encoding with utf32 with specific endianness 
02532                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
02533  
02534                 // only do autodetection if no explicit encoding is requested 
02535                 if (encoding != encoding_auto) return encoding; 
02536  
02537                 // assume utf8 encoding 
02538                 return encoding_utf8; 
02539         } 
02540  
02541 #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
02542         size_t get_valid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02543         { 
02544                 assert(length > 0); 
02545  
02546                 // discard last character if it's the lead of a surrogate pair  
02547                 return (sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 && (unsigned)(static_cast<uint16_t>(data[length - 1]) - 0xD800) < 0x400) ? length - 1 : length; 
02548         } 
02549  
02550         size_t convert_buffer(char* result, const char_t* data, size_t length, Encoding encoding) 
02551         { 
02552                 // only endian-swapping is required 
02553                 if (need_endian_swap_utf(encoding, get_wchar_encoding())) 
02554                 { 
02555                         convert_wchar_endian_swap(reinterpret_cast<char_t*>(result), data, length); 
02556  
02557                         return length * sizeof(char_t); 
02558                 } 
02559          
02560                 // convert to utf8 
02561                 if (encoding == encoding_utf8) 
02562                 { 
02563                         uint8_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(result); 
02564  
02565                         uint8_t* end = sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 ? 
02566                                 utf_decoder<utf8_writer>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(data), length, dest) : 
02567                                 utf_decoder<utf8_writer>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02568  
02569                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest); 
02570                 } 
02571  
02572                 // convert to utf16 
02573                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le) 
02574                 { 
02575                         uint16_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint16_t*>(result); 
02576  
02577                         // convert to native utf16 
02578                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_writer>::decode_utf32_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02579  
02580                         // swap if necessary 
02581                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
02582  
02583                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02584  
02585                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t); 
02586                 } 
02587  
02588                 // convert to utf32 
02589                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le) 
02590                 { 
02591                         uint32_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t*>(result); 
02592  
02593                         // convert to native utf32 
02594                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_writer>::decode_utf16_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint16_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02595  
02596                         // swap if necessary 
02597                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
02598  
02599                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02600  
02601                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t); 
02602                 } 
02603  
02604                 assert(!"Invalid encoding"); 
02605                 return 0; 
02606         } 
02607 #else 
02608         size_t get_valid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02609         { 
02610                 assert(length > 4); 
02611  
02612                 for (size_t i = 1; i <= 4; ++i) 
02613                 { 
02614                         uint8_t ch = static_cast<uint8_t>(data[length - i]); 
02615  
02616                         // either a standalone character or a leading one 
02617                         if ((ch & 0xc0) != 0x80) return length - i; 
02618                 } 
02619  
02620                 // there are four non-leading characters at the end, sequence tail is broken so might as well process the whole chunk 
02621                 return length; 
02622         } 
02623  
02624         size_t convert_buffer(char* result, const char_t* data, size_t length, Encoding encoding) 
02625         { 
02626                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le) 
02627                 { 
02628                         uint16_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint16_t*>(result); 
02629  
02630                         // convert to native utf16 
02631                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_writer>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02632  
02633                         // swap if necessary 
02634                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be; 
02635  
02636                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02637  
02638                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t); 
02639                 } 
02640  
02641                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le) 
02642                 { 
02643                         uint32_t* dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t*>(result); 
02644  
02645                         // convert to native utf32 
02646                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_writer>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest); 
02647  
02648                         // swap if necessary 
02649                         Encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be; 
02650  
02651                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest)); 
02652  
02653                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t); 
02654                 } 
02655  
02656                 assert(!"Invalid encoding"); 
02657                 return 0; 
02658         } 
02659 #endif 
02660  
02661         class BufferedWriter 
02662         { 
02663                 BufferedWriter(const BufferedWriter&); 
02664                 BufferedWriter& operator=(const BufferedWriter&); 
02665  
02666         public: 
02667                 BufferedWriter(Writer& writer, Encoding user_encoding): writer(writer), bufsize(0), encoding(get_write_encoding(user_encoding)) 
02668                 { 
02669                 } 
02670  
02671                 ~BufferedWriter() 
02672                 { 
02673                         flush(); 
02674                 } 
02675  
02676                 void flush() 
02677                 { 
02678                         flush(buffer, bufsize); 
02679                         bufsize = 0; 
02680                 } 
02681  
02682                 void flush(const char_t* data, size_t size) 
02683                 { 
02684                         if (size == 0) return; 
02685  
02686                         // fast path, just write data 
02687                         if (encoding == get_write_native_encoding()) 
02688                                 writer.write(data, size * sizeof(char_t)); 
02689                         else 
02690                         { 
02691                                 // convert chunk 
02692                                 size_t result = convert_buffer(scratch, data, size, encoding); 
02693                                 assert(result <= sizeof(scratch)); 
02694  
02695                                 // write data 
02696                                 writer.write(scratch, result); 
02697                         } 
02698                 } 
02699  
02700                 void write(const char_t* data, size_t length) 
02701                 { 
02702                         if (bufsize + length > bufcapacity) 
02703                         { 
02704                                 // flush the remaining buffer contents 
02705                                 flush(); 
02706  
02707                                 // handle large chunks 
02708                                 if (length > bufcapacity) 
02709                                 { 
02710                                         if (encoding == get_write_native_encoding()) 
02711                                         { 
02712                                                 // fast path, can just write data chunk 
02713                                                 writer.write(data, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
02714                                                 return; 
02715                                         } 
02716  
02717                                         // need to convert in suitable chunks 
02718                                         while (length > bufcapacity) 
02719                                         { 
02720                                                 // get chunk size by selecting such number of characters that are guaranteed to fit into scratch buffer 
02721                                                 // and form a complete codepoint sequence (i.e. discard start of last codepoint if necessary) 
02722                                                 size_t chunk_size = get_valid_length(data, bufcapacity); 
02723  
02724                                                 // convert chunk and write 
02725                                                 flush(data, chunk_size); 
02726  
02727                                                 // iterate 
02728                                                 data += chunk_size; 
02729                                                 length -= chunk_size; 
02730                                         } 
02731  
02732                                         // small tail is copied below 
02733                                         bufsize = 0; 
02734                                 } 
02735                         } 
02736  
02737                         memcpy(buffer + bufsize, data, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
02738                         bufsize += length; 
02739                 } 
02740  
02741                 void write(const char_t* data) 
02742                 { 
02743                         write(data, strlength(data)); 
02744                 } 
02745  
02746                 void write(char_t d0) 
02747                 { 
02748                         if (bufsize + 1 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02749  
02750                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02751                         bufsize += 1; 
02752                 } 
02753  
02754                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1) 
02755                 { 
02756                         if (bufsize + 2 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02757  
02758                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02759                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02760                         bufsize += 2; 
02761                 } 
02762  
02763                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2) 
02764                 { 
02765                         if (bufsize + 3 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02766  
02767                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02768                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02769                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02770                         bufsize += 3; 
02771                 } 
02772  
02773                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3) 
02774                 { 
02775                         if (bufsize + 4 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02776  
02777                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02778                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02779                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02780                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02781                         bufsize += 4; 
02782                 } 
02783  
02784                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4) 
02785                 { 
02786                         if (bufsize + 5 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02787  
02788                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02789                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02790                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02791                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02792                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4; 
02793                         bufsize += 5; 
02794                 } 
02795  
02796                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4, char_t d5) 
02797                 { 
02798                         if (bufsize + 6 > bufcapacity) flush(); 
02799  
02800                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0; 
02801                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1; 
02802                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2; 
02803                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3; 
02804                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4; 
02805                         buffer[bufsize + 5] = d5; 
02806                         bufsize += 6; 
02807                 } 
02808  
02809                 // utf8 maximum expansion: x4 (-> utf32) 
02810                 // utf16 maximum expansion: x2 (-> utf32) 
02811                 // utf32 maximum expansion: x1 
02812                 enum { bufcapacity = 2048 }; 
02813  
02814                 char_t buffer[bufcapacity]; 
02815                 char scratch[4 * bufcapacity]; 
02816  
02817                 Writer& writer; 
02818                 size_t bufsize; 
02819                 Encoding encoding; 
02820         }; 
02821  
02822         void write_bom(Writer& writer, Encoding encoding) 
02823         { 
02824                 switch (encoding) 
02825                 { 
02826                 case encoding_utf8: 
02827                         writer.write("\xef\xbb\xbf", 3); 
02828                         break; 
02829  
02830                 case encoding_utf16_be: 
02831                         writer.write("\xfe\xff", 2); 
02832                         break; 
02833  
02834                 case encoding_utf16_le: 
02835                         writer.write("\xff\xfe", 2); 
02836                         break; 
02837  
02838                 case encoding_utf32_be: 
02839                         writer.write("\x00\x00\xfe\xff", 4); 
02840                         break; 
02841  
02842                 case encoding_utf32_le: 
02843                         writer.write("\xff\xfe\x00\x00", 4); 
02844                         break; 
02845  
02846                 default: 
02847                         assert(!"Invalid encoding"); 
02848                 } 
02849         } 
02850  
02851         void text_output_escaped(BufferedWriter& writer, const char_t* s, chartypex_t type) 
02852         { 
02853                 while (*s) 
02854                 { 
02855                         const char_t* prev = s; 
02856                          
02857                         // While *s is a usual symbol 
02858                         while (!IS_CHARTYPEX(*s, type)) ++s; 
02859                  
02860                         writer.write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev)); 
02861  
02862                         switch (*s) 
02863                         { 
02864                                 case 0: break; 
02865                                 case '&': 
02866                                         writer.write('&', 'a', 'm', 'p', ';'); 
02867                                         ++s; 
02868                                         break; 
02869                                 case '<': 
02870                                         writer.write('&', 'l', 't', ';'); 
02871                                         ++s; 
02872                                         break; 
02873                                 case '>': 
02874                                         writer.write('&', 'g', 't', ';'); 
02875                                         ++s; 
02876                                         break; 
02877                                 case '"': 
02878                                         writer.write('&', 'q', 'u', 'o', 't', ';'); 
02879                                         ++s; 
02880                                         break; 
02881                                 default: // s is not a usual symbol 
02882                                 { 
02883                                         unsigned int ch = static_cast<unsigned int>(*s++); 
02884                                         assert(ch < 32); 
02885  
02886                                         writer.write('&', '#', static_cast<char_t>((ch / 10) + '0'), static_cast<char_t>((ch % 10) + '0'), ';'); 
02887                                 } 
02888                         } 
02889                 } 
02890         } 
02891  
02892         void text_output_cdata(BufferedWriter& writer, const char_t* s) 
02893         { 
02894                 do 
02895                 { 
02896                         writer.write('<', '!', '[', 'C', 'D'); 
02897                         writer.write('A', 'T', 'A', '['); 
02898  
02899                         const char_t* prev = s; 
02900  
02901                         // look for ]]> sequence - we can't output it as is since it terminates CDATA 
02902                         while (*s && !(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>')) ++s; 
02903  
02904                         // skip ]] if we stopped at ]]>, > will go to the next CDATA section 
02905                         if (*s) s += 2; 
02906  
02907                         writer.write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev)); 
02908  
02909                         writer.write(']', ']', '>'); 
02910                 } 
02911                 while (*s); 
02912         } 
02913  
02914         void node_output_attributes(BufferedWriter& writer, const Node& node) 
02915         { 
02916                 const char_t* default_name = XML_TEXT(":anonymous"); 
02917  
02918                 for (Attribute a = node.first_attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute()) 
02919                 { 
02920                         writer.write(' '); 
02921                         writer.write(a.name()[0] ? a.name() : default_name); 
02922                         writer.write('=', '"'); 
02923  
02924                         text_output_escaped(writer, a.value(), ctx_special_attr); 
02925  
02926                         writer.write('"'); 
02927                 } 
02928         } 
02929  
02930         void node_output(BufferedWriter& writer, const Node& node, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, unsigned int depth) 
02931         { 
02932                 const char_t* default_name = XML_TEXT(":anonymous"); 
02933  
02934                 if ((flags & format_indent) != 0 && (flags & format_raw) == 0) 
02935                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < depth; ++i) writer.write(indent); 
02936  
02937                 switch (node.type()) 
02938                 { 
02939                 case node_document: 
02940                 { 
02941                         for (Node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling()) 
02942                                 node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth); 
02943                         break; 
02944                 } 
02945                          
02946                 case node_element: 
02947                 { 
02948                         const char_t* name = node.name()[0] ? node.name() : default_name; 
02949  
02950                         writer.write('<'); 
02951                         writer.write(name); 
02952  
02953                         node_output_attributes(writer, node); 
02954  
02955                         if (flags & format_raw) 
02956                         { 
02957                                 if (!node.first_child()) 
02958                                         writer.write(' ', '/', '>'); 
02959                                 else 
02960                                 { 
02961                                         writer.write('>'); 
02962  
02963                                         for (Node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling()) 
02964                                                 node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth + 1); 
02965  
02966                                         writer.write('<', '/'); 
02967                                         writer.write(name); 
02968                                         writer.write('>'); 
02969                                 } 
02970                         } 
02971                         else if (!node.first_child()) 
02972                                 writer.write(' ', '/', '>', '\n'); 
02973                         else if (node.first_child() == node.last_child() && (node.first_child().type() == node_pcdata || node.first_child().type() == node_cdata)) 
02974                         { 
02975                                 writer.write('>'); 
02976  
02977                                 if (node.first_child().type() == node_pcdata) 
02978                                         text_output_escaped(writer, node.first_child().value(), ctx_special_pcdata); 
02979                                 else 
02980                                         text_output_cdata(writer, node.first_child().value()); 
02981  
02982                                 writer.write('<', '/'); 
02983                                 writer.write(name); 
02984                                 writer.write('>', '\n'); 
02985                         } 
02986                         else 
02987                         { 
02988                                 writer.write('>', '\n'); 
02989                                  
02990                                 for (Node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling()) 
02991                                         node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth + 1); 
02992  
02993                                 if ((flags & format_indent) != 0 && (flags & format_raw) == 0) 
02994                                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < depth; ++i) writer.write(indent); 
02995                                  
02996                                 writer.write('<', '/'); 
02997                                 writer.write(name); 
02998                                 writer.write('>', '\n'); 
02999                         } 
03000  
03001                         break; 
03002                 } 
03003                  
03004                 case node_pcdata: 
03005                         text_output_escaped(writer, node.value(), ctx_special_pcdata); 
03006                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n'); 
03007                         break; 
03008  
03009                 case node_cdata: 
03010                         text_output_cdata(writer, node.value()); 
03011                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n'); 
03012                         break; 
03013  
03014                 case node_comment: 
03015                         writer.write('<', '!', '-', '-'); 
03016                         writer.write(node.value()); 
03017                         writer.write('-', '-', '>'); 
03018                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n'); 
03019                         break; 
03020  
03021                 case node_pi: 
03022                 case node_declaration: 
03023                         writer.write('<', '?'); 
03024                         writer.write(node.name()[0] ? node.name() : default_name); 
03025  
03026                         if (node.type() == node_declaration) 
03027                         { 
03028                                 node_output_attributes(writer, node); 
03029                         } 
03030                         else if (node.value()[0]) 
03031                         { 
03032                                 writer.write(' '); 
03033                                 writer.write(node.value()); 
03034                         } 
03035  
03036                         writer.write('?', '>'); 
03037                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n'); 
03038                         break; 
03039  
03040                 case node_doctype: 
03041                         writer.write('<', '!', 'D', 'O', 'C'); 
03042                         writer.write('T', 'Y', 'P', 'E'); 
03043  
03044                         if (node.value()[0]) 
03045                         { 
03046                                 writer.write(' '); 
03047                                 writer.write(node.value()); 
03048                         } 
03049  
03050                         writer.write('>'); 
03051                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n'); 
03052                         break; 
03053  
03054                 default: 
03055                         assert(!"Invalid node type"); 
03056                 } 
03057         } 
03058  
03059         inline bool has_declaration(const Node& node) 
03060         { 
03061                 for (Node child = node.first_child(); child; child = child.next_sibling()) 
03062                 { 
03063                         NodeType type = child.type(); 
03064  
03065                         if (type == node_declaration) return true; 
03066                         if (type == node_element) return false; 
03067                 } 
03068  
03069                 return false; 
03070         } 
03071  
03072         inline bool allow_insert_child(NodeType parent, NodeType child) 
03073         { 
03074                 if (parent != node_document && parent != node_element) return false; 
03075                 if (child == node_document || child == node_null) return false; 
03076                 if (parent != node_document && (child == node_declaration || child == node_doctype)) return false; 
03077  
03078                 return true; 
03079         } 
03080  
03081         void recursive_copy_skip(Node& dest, const Node& source, const Node& skip) 
03082         { 
03083                 assert(dest.type() == source.type()); 
03084  
03085                 switch (source.type()) 
03086                 { 
03087                 case node_element: 
03088                 { 
03089                         dest.set_name(source.name()); 
03090  
03091                         for (Attribute a = source.first_attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute()) 
03092                                 dest.append_attribute(a.name()).set_value(a.value()); 
03093  
03094                         for (Node c = source.first_child(); c; c = c.next_sibling()) 
03095                         { 
03096                                 if (c == skip) continue; 
03097  
03098                                 Node cc = dest.append_child(c.type()); 
03099                                 assert(cc); 
03100  
03101                                 recursive_copy_skip(cc, c, skip); 
03102                         } 
03103  
03104                         break; 
03105                 } 
03106  
03107                 case node_pcdata: 
03108                 case node_cdata: 
03109                 case node_comment: 
03110                 case node_doctype: 
03111                         dest.set_value(source.value()); 
03112                         break; 
03113  
03114                 case node_pi: 
03115                         dest.set_name(source.name()); 
03116                         dest.set_value(source.value()); 
03117                         break; 
03118  
03119                 case node_declaration: 
03120                 { 
03121                         dest.set_name(source.name()); 
03122  
03123                         for (Attribute a = source.first_attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute()) 
03124                                 dest.append_attribute(a.name()).set_value(a.value()); 
03125  
03126                         break; 
03127                 } 
03128  
03129                 default: 
03130                         assert(!"Invalid node type"); 
03131                 } 
03132         } 
03133  
03134         // we need to get length of entire file to load it in memory; the only (relatively) sane way to do it is via seek/tell trick 
03135         ParseStatus get_file_size(FILE* file, size_t& out_result) 
03136         { 
03137         #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400 
03138                 // there are 64-bit versions of fseek/ftell, let's use them 
03139                 typedef __int64 length_type; 
03140  
03141                 _fseeki64(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03142                 length_type length = _ftelli64(file); 
03143                 _fseeki64(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03144         #elif defined(__MINGW32__) && !defined(__NO_MINGW_LFS) && !defined(__STRICT_ANSI__) 
03145                 // there are 64-bit versions of fseek/ftell, let's use them 
03146                 typedef off64_t length_type; 
03147  
03148                 fseeko64(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03149                 length_type length = ftello64(file); 
03150                 fseeko64(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03151         #else 
03152                 // if this is a 32-bit OS, long is enough; if this is a unix system, long is 64-bit, which is enough; otherwise we can't do anything anyway. 
03153                 typedef long length_type; 
03154  
03155                 fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END); 
03156                 length_type length = ftell(file); 
03157                 fseek(file, 0, SEEK_SET); 
03158         #endif 
03159  
03160                 // check for I/O errors 
03161                 if (length < 0) return StatusIOError; 
03162                  
03163                 // check for overflow 
03164                 size_t result = static_cast<size_t>(length); 
03165  
03166                 if (static_cast<length_type>(result) != length) return StatusOutOfMemory; 
03167  
03168                 // finalize 
03169                 out_result = result; 
03170  
03171                 return StatusOk; 
03172         } 
03173  
03174         ParseResult load_file_impl(Document& doc, FILE* file, unsigned int options, Encoding encoding) 
03175         { 
03176                 if (!file) return make_parse_result(StatusFileNotFound); 
03177  
03178                 // get file size (can result in I/O errors) 
03179                 size_t size = 0; 
03180                 ParseStatus size_status = get_file_size(file, size); 
03181  
03182                 if (size_status != StatusOk) 
03183                 { 
03184                         fclose(file); 
03185                         return make_parse_result(size_status); 
03186                 } 
03187                  
03188                 // allocate buffer for the whole file 
03189                 char* contents = static_cast<char*>(global_allocate(size > 0 ? size : 1)); 
03190  
03191                 if (!contents) 
03192                 { 
03193                         fclose(file); 
03194                         return make_parse_result(StatusOutOfMemory); 
03195                 } 
03196  
03197                 // read file in memory 
03198                 size_t read_size = fread(contents, 1, size, file); 
03199                 fclose(file); 
03200  
03201                 if (read_size != size) 
03202                 { 
03203                         global_deallocate(contents); 
03204                         return make_parse_result(StatusIOError); 
03205                 } 
03206                  
03207                 return doc.load_buffer_inplace_own(contents, size, options, encoding); 
03208         } 
03209  
03210 #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
03211         template <typename T> ParseResult load_stream_impl(Document& doc, std::basic_istream<T>& stream, unsigned int options, Encoding encoding) 
03212         { 
03213                 // get length of remaining data in stream 
03214                 typename std::basic_istream<T>::pos_type pos = stream.tellg(); 
03215                 stream.seekg(0, std::ios::end); 
03216                 std::streamoff length = stream.tellg() - pos; 
03217                 stream.seekg(pos); 
03218  
03219                 if (stream.fail() || pos < 0) return make_parse_result(StatusIOError); 
03220  
03221                 // guard against huge files 
03222                 size_t read_length = static_cast<size_t>(length); 
03223  
03224                 if (static_cast<std::streamsize>(read_length) != length || length < 0) return make_parse_result(StatusOutOfMemory); 
03225  
03226                 // read stream data into memory (guard against stream exceptions with buffer holder) 
03227                 buffer_holder buffer(global_allocate((read_length > 0 ? read_length : 1) * sizeof(T)), global_deallocate); 
03228                 if (!buffer.data) return make_parse_result(StatusOutOfMemory); 
03229  
03230                 stream.read(static_cast<T*>(buffer.data), static_cast<std::streamsize>(read_length)); 
03231  
03232                 // read may set failbit | eofbit in case gcount() is less than read_length (i.e. line ending conversion), so check for other I/O errors 
03233                 if (stream.bad()) return make_parse_result(StatusIOError); 
03234  
03235                 // load data from buffer 
03236                 size_t actual_length = static_cast<size_t>(stream.gcount()); 
03237                 assert(actual_length <= read_length); 
03238  
03239                 return doc.load_buffer_inplace_own(buffer.release(), actual_length * sizeof(T), options, encoding); 
03240         } 
03241 #endif 
03242  
03243 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__BORLANDC__) || defined(__MINGW32__) 
03244         FILE* open_file_wide(const wchar_t* path, const wchar_t* mode) 
03245         { 
03246                 return _wfopen(path, mode); 
03247         } 
03248 #else 
03249         char* convert_path_heap(const wchar_t* str) 
03250         { 
03251                 assert(str); 
03252  
03253                 // first pass: get length in utf8 characters 
03254                 size_t length = wcslen(str); 
03255                 size_t size = as_utf8_begin(str, length); 
03256  
03257                 // allocate resulting string 
03258                 char* result = static_cast<char*>(global_allocate(size + 1)); 
03259                 if (!result) return 0; 
03260  
03261                 // second pass: convert to utf8 
03262                 as_utf8_end(result, size, str, length); 
03263  
03264                 return result; 
03265         } 
03266  
03267         FILE* open_file_wide(const wchar_t* path, const wchar_t* mode) 
03268         { 
03269                 // there is no standard function to open wide paths, so our best bet is to try utf8 path 
03270                 char* path_utf8 = convert_path_heap(path); 
03271                 if (!path_utf8) return 0; 
03272  
03273                 // convert mode to ASCII (we mirror _wfopen interface) 
03274                 char mode_ascii[4] = {0}; 
03275                 for (size_t i = 0; mode[i]; ++i) mode_ascii[i] = static_cast<char>(mode[i]); 
03276  
03277                 // try to open the utf8 path 
03278                 FILE* result = fopen(path_utf8, mode_ascii); 
03279  
03280                 // free dummy buffer 
03281                 global_deallocate(path_utf8); 
03282  
03283                 return result; 
03284         } 
03285 #endif 
03286 }

03323                 }

03822  
03823         Attribute Node::append_attribute(const char_t* name) 
03824         { 
03825                 if (type() != node_element && type() != node_declaration) return Attribute(); 
03826                  
03827                 Attribute a(append_attribute_ll(_root, get_allocator(_root))); 
03828                 a.set_name(name); 
03829                  
03830                 return a; 
03831         } 
03832  
03833         Attribute Node::prepend_attribute(const char_t* name) 
03834         { 
03835                 if (type() != node_element && type() != node_declaration) return Attribute(); 
03836                  
03837                 Attribute a(allocate_attribute(get_allocator(_root))); 
03838                 if (!a) return Attribute(); 
03839  
03840                 a.set_name(name); 
03841                  
03842                 AttributeStruct* head = _root->first_attribute; 
03843  
03844                 if (head) 
03845                 { 
03846                         a._attr->prev_attribute_c = head->prev_attribute_c; 
03847                         head->prev_attribute_c = a._attr; 
03848                 } 
03849                 else 
03850                         a._attr->prev_attribute_c = a._attr; 
03851                  
03852                 a._attr->next_attribute = head; 
03853                 _root->first_attribute = a._attr; 
03854                                  
03855                 return a; 
03856         } 
03857  
03858         Attribute Node::insert_attribute_before(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr) 
03859         { 
03860                 if ((type() != node_element && type() != node_declaration) || attr.empty()) return Attribute(); 
03861                  
03862                 // check that attribute belongs to *this 
03863                 AttributeStruct* cur = attr._attr; 
03864  
03865                 while (cur->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute) cur = cur->prev_attribute_c; 
03866  
03867                 if (cur != _root->first_attribute) return Attribute(); 
03868  
03869                 Attribute a(allocate_attribute(get_allocator(_root))); 
03870                 if (!a) return Attribute(); 
03871  
03872                 a.set_name(name); 
03873  
03874                 if (attr._attr->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute) 
03875                         attr._attr->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute = a._attr; 
03876                 else 
03877                         _root->first_attribute = a._attr; 
03878                  
03879                 a._attr->prev_attribute_c = attr._attr->prev_attribute_c; 
03880                 a._attr->next_attribute = attr._attr; 
03881                 attr._attr->prev_attribute_c = a._attr; 
03882                                  
03883                 return a; 
03884         } 
03885  
03886         Attribute Node::insert_attribute_after(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr) 
03887         { 
03888                 if ((type() != node_element && type() != node_declaration) || attr.empty()) return Attribute(); 
03889                  
03890                 // check that attribute belongs to *this 
03891                 AttributeStruct* cur = attr._attr; 
03892  
03893                 while (cur->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute) cur = cur->prev_attribute_c; 
03894  
03895                 if (cur != _root->first_attribute) return Attribute(); 
03896  
03897                 Attribute a(allocate_attribute(get_allocator(_root))); 
03898                 if (!a) return Attribute(); 
03899  
03900                 a.set_name(name); 
03901  
03902                 if (attr._attr->next_attribute) 
03903                         attr._attr->next_attribute->prev_attribute_c = a._attr; 
03904                 else 
03905                         _root->first_attribute->prev_attribute_c = a._attr; 
03906                  
03907                 a._attr->next_attribute = attr._attr->next_attribute; 
03908                 a._attr->prev_attribute_c = attr._attr; 
03909                 attr._attr->next_attribute = a._attr; 
03910  
03911                 return a; 
03912         }

03954         Node Node::append_child(NodeType type) 
03955         { 
03956                 if (!allow_insert_child(this->type(), type)) return Node(); 
03957                  
03958                 Node n(append_node(_root, get_allocator(_root), type)); 
03959  
03960                 if (type == node_declaration) n.set_name(XML_TEXT("xml")); 
03961  
03962                 return n; 
03963         } 
03964  
03965         Node Node::prepend_child(NodeType type) 
03966         { 
03967                 if (!allow_insert_child(this->type(), type)) return Node(); 
03968                  
03969                 Node n(allocate_node(get_allocator(_root), type)); 
03970                 if (!n) return Node(); 
03971  
03972                 n._root->parent = _root; 
03973  
03974                 NodeStruct* head = _root->first_child; 
03975  
03976                 if (head) 
03977                 { 
03978                         n._root->prev_sibling_c = head->prev_sibling_c; 
03979                         head->prev_sibling_c = n._root; 
03980                 } 
03981                 else 
03982                         n._root->prev_sibling_c = n._root; 
03983                  
03984                 n._root->next_sibling = head; 
03985                 _root->first_child = n._root; 
03986                                  
03987                 if (type == node_declaration) n.set_name(XML_TEXT("xml")); 
03988  
03989                 return n; 
03990         } 
03991  
03992         Node Node::insert_child_before(NodeType type, const Node& node) 
03993         { 
03994                 if (!allow_insert_child(this->type(), type)) return Node(); 
03995                 if (!node._root || node._root->parent != _root) return Node(); 
03996          
03997                 Node n(allocate_node(get_allocator(_root), type)); 
03998                 if (!n) return Node(); 
03999  
04000                 n._root->parent = _root; 
04001                  
04002                 if (node._root->prev_sibling_c->next_sibling) 
04003                         node._root->prev_sibling_c->next_sibling = n._root; 
04004                 else 
04005                         _root->first_child = n._root; 
04006                  
04007                 n._root->prev_sibling_c = node._root->prev_sibling_c; 
04008                 n._root->next_sibling = node._root; 
04009                 node._root->prev_sibling_c = n._root; 
04010  
04011                 if (type == node_declaration) n.set_name(XML_TEXT("xml")); 
04012  
04013                 return n; 
04014         }
