04016         Node Node::insert_child_after(NodeType type, const Node& node) 
04017         { 
04018                 if (!allow_insert_child(this->type(), type)) return Node(); 
04019                 if (!node._root || node._root->parent != _root) return Node(); 
04020          
04021                 Node n(allocate_node(get_allocator(_root), type)); 
04022                 if (!n) return Node(); 
04023  
04024                 n._root->parent = _root; 
04025          
04026                 if (node._root->next_sibling) 
04027                         node._root->next_sibling->prev_sibling_c = n._root; 
04028                 else 
04029                         _root->first_child->prev_sibling_c = n._root; 
04030                  
04031                 n._root->next_sibling = node._root->next_sibling; 
04032                 n._root->prev_sibling_c = node._root; 
04033                 node._root->next_sibling = n._root; 
04034  
04035                 if (type == node_declaration) n.set_name(XML_TEXT("xml")); 
04036  
04037                 return n; 
04038         }

04111  
04112         bool Node::remove_attribute(const char_t* name) 
04113         { 
04114                 return remove_attribute(attribute(name)); 
04115         } 
04116  
04117         bool Node::remove_attribute(const Attribute& a) 
04118         { 
04119                 if (!_root || !a._attr) return false; 
04120  
04121                 // check that attribute belongs to *this 
04122                 AttributeStruct* attr = a._attr; 
04123  
04124                 while (attr->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute) attr = attr->prev_attribute_c; 
04125  
04126                 if (attr != _root->first_attribute) return false; 
04127  
04128                 if (a._attr->next_attribute) a._attr->next_attribute->prev_attribute_c = a._attr->prev_attribute_c; 
04129                 else if (_root->first_attribute) _root->first_attribute->prev_attribute_c = a._attr->prev_attribute_c; 
04130                  
04131                 if (a._attr->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute) a._attr->prev_attribute_c->next_attribute = a._attr->next_attribute; 
04132                 else _root->first_attribute = a._attr->next_attribute; 
04133  
04134                 destroy_attribute(a._attr, get_allocator(_root)); 
04135  
04136                 return true; 
04137         } 
04138  
04139         bool Node::remove_child(const char_t* name) 
04140         { 
04141                 return remove_child(child(name)); 
04142         } 
04143  
04144         bool Node::remove_child(const Node& n) 
04145         { 
04146                 if (!_root || !n._root || n._root->parent != _root) return false; 
04147  
04148                 if (n._root->next_sibling) n._root->next_sibling->prev_sibling_c = n._root->prev_sibling_c; 
04149                 else if (_root->first_child) _root->first_child->prev_sibling_c = n._root->prev_sibling_c; 
04150                  
04151                 if (n._root->prev_sibling_c->next_sibling) n._root->prev_sibling_c->next_sibling = n._root->next_sibling; 
04152                 else _root->first_child = n._root->next_sibling; 
04153                  
04154                 destroy_node(n._root, get_allocator(_root)); 
04155  
04156                 return true; 
04157         } 
04158  
04159         Node Node::find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* name, const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const 
04160         { 
04161                 if (!_root) return Node(); 
04162                  
04163                 for (NodeStruct* i = _root->first_child; i; i = i->next_sibling) 
04164                         if (i->name && strequal(name, i->name)) 
04165                         { 
04166                                 for (AttributeStruct* a = i->first_attribute; a; a = a->next_attribute) 
04167                                         if (strequal(attr_name, a->name) && strequal(attr_value, a->value)) 
04168                                                 return Node(i); 
04169                         } 
04170  
04171                 return Node(); 
04172         } 
04173  
04174         Node Node::find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const 
04175         { 
04176                 if (!_root) return Node(); 
04177                  
04178                 for (NodeStruct* i = _root->first_child; i; i = i->next_sibling) 
04179                         for (AttributeStruct* a = i->first_attribute; a; a = a->next_attribute) 
04180                                 if (strequal(attr_name, a->name) && strequal(attr_value, a->value)) 
04181                                         return Node(i); 
04182  
04183                 return Node(); 
04184         } 
04185  
04186 #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
04187         string_t Node::path(char_t delimiter) const 
04188         { 
04189                 string_t path; 
04190  
04191                 Node cursor = *this; // Make a copy. 
04192                  
04193                 path = cursor.name(); 
04194  
04195                 while (cursor.parent()) 
04196                 { 
04197                         cursor = cursor.parent(); 
04198                          
04199                         string_t temp = cursor.name(); 
04200                         temp += delimiter; 
04201                         temp += path; 
04202                         path.swap(temp); 
04203                 } 
04204  
04205                 return path; 
04206         } 
04207 #endif 
04208  
04209         Node Node::first_element_by_path(const char_t* path, char_t delimiter) const 
04210         { 
04211                 Node found = *this; // Current search context. 
04212  
04213                 if (!_root || !path || !path[0]) return found; 
04214  
04215                 if (path[0] == delimiter) 
04216                 { 
04217                         // Absolute path; e.g. '/foo/bar' 
04218                         found = found.root(); 
04219                         ++path; 
04220                 } 
04221  
04222                 const char_t* path_segment = path; 
04223  
04224                 while (*path_segment == delimiter) ++path_segment; 
04225  
04226                 const char_t* path_segment_end = path_segment; 
04227  
04228                 while (*path_segment_end && *path_segment_end != delimiter) ++path_segment_end; 
04229  
04230                 if (path_segment == path_segment_end) return found; 
04231  
04232                 const char_t* next_segment = path_segment_end; 
04233  
04234                 while (*next_segment == delimiter) ++next_segment; 
04235  
04236                 if (*path_segment == '.' && path_segment + 1 == path_segment_end) 
04237                         return found.first_element_by_path(next_segment, delimiter); 
04238                 else if (*path_segment == '.' && *(path_segment+1) == '.' && path_segment + 2 == path_segment_end) 
04239                         return found.parent().first_element_by_path(next_segment, delimiter); 
04240                 else 
04241                 { 
04242                         for (NodeStruct* j = found._root->first_child; j; j = j->next_sibling) 
04243                         { 
04244                                 if (j->name && strequalrange(j->name, path_segment, static_cast<size_t>(path_segment_end - path_segment))) 
04245                                 { 
04246                                         Node subsearch = Node(j).first_element_by_path(next_segment, delimiter); 
04247  
04248                                         if (subsearch) return subsearch; 
04249                                 } 
04250                         } 
04251  
04252                         return Node(); 
04253                 } 
04254         } 
04255  
04256         bool Node::traverse(TreeWalker& walker) 
04257         { 
04258                 walker._depth = -1; 
04259                  
04260                 Node arg_begin = *this; 
04261                 if (!walker.begin(arg_begin)) return false; 
04262  
04263                 Node cur = first_child(); 
04264                                  
04265                 if (cur) 
04266                 { 
04267                         ++walker._depth; 
04268  
04269                         do  
04270                         { 
04271                                 Node arg_for_each = cur; 
04272                                 if (!walker.for_each(arg_for_each)) 
04273                                         return false; 
04274                                                  
04275                                 if (cur.first_child()) 
04276                                 { 
04277                                         ++walker._depth; 
04278                                         cur = cur.first_child(); 
04279                                 } 
04280                                 else if (cur.next_sibling()) 
04281                                         cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
04282                                 else 
04283                                 { 
04284                                         // Borland C++ workaround 
04285                                         while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur != *this && (bool)cur.parent()) 
04286                                         { 
04287                                                 --walker._depth; 
04288                                                 cur = cur.parent(); 
04289                                         } 
04290                                                  
04291                                         if (cur != *this) 
04292                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
04293                                 } 
04294                         } 
04295                         while (cur && cur != *this); 
04296                 } 
04297  
04298                 assert(walker._depth == -1); 
04299  
04300                 Node arg_end = *this; 
04301                 return walker.end(arg_end); 
04302         }

04307         }

04338  
04339         ptrdiff_t Node::offset_debug() const 
04340         { 
04341                 NodeStruct* r = root()._root; 
04342  
04343                 if (!r) return -1; 
04344  
04345                 const char_t* buffer = static_cast<DocumentStruct*>(r)->buffer; 
04346  
04347                 if (!buffer) return -1; 
04348  
04349                 switch (type()) 
04350                 { 
04351                 case node_document: 
04352                         return 0; 
04353  
04354                 case node_element: 
04355                 case node_declaration: 
04356                 case node_pi: 
04357                         return (_root->header & MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask) ? -1 : _root->name - buffer; 
04358  
04359                 case node_pcdata: 
04360                 case node_cdata: 
04361                 case node_comment: 
04362                 case node_doctype: 
04363                         return (_root->header & MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask) ? -1 : _root->value - buffer; 
04364  
04365                 default: 
04366                         return -1; 
04367                 } 
04368         }

04512  
04513         const char* ParseResult::description() const 
04514         { 
04515                 switch (status) 
04516                 { 
04517                 case StatusOk: return "No error"; 
04518  
04519                 case StatusFileNotFound: return "File was not found"; 
04520                 case StatusIOError: return "Error reading from file/stream"; 
04521                 case StatusOutOfMemory: return "Could not allocate memory"; 
04522                 case StatusInternalError: return "Internal error occurred"; 
04523  
04524                 case StatusUnrecognizedTag: return "Could not determine tag type"; 
04525  
04526                 case StatusBadPi: return "Error parsing document declaration/processing instruction"; 
04527                 case StatusBadComment: return "Error parsing comment"; 
04528                 case StatusBadCdata: return "Error parsing CDATA section"; 
04529                 case StatusBadDoctype: return "Error parsing document type declaration"; 
04530                 case StatusBadPcdata: return "Error parsing PCDATA section"; 
04531                 case StatusBadStartElement: return "Error parsing start element tag"; 
04532                 case StatusBadAttribute: return "Error parsing element attribute"; 
04533                 case StatusBadEndElement: return "Error parsing end element tag"; 
04534                 case StatusEndElementMismatch: return "Start-end tags mismatch"; 
04535  
04536                 default: return "Unknown error"; 
04537                 } 
04538         } 
04539  
04540         Document::Document(): _buffer(0) 
04541         { 
04542                 create(); 
04543         } 
04544  
04545         Document::~Document() 
04546         { 
04547                 destroy(); 
04548         } 
04549  
04550         void Document::reset() 
04551         { 
04552                 destroy(); 
04553                 create(); 
04554         } 
04555  
04556         void Document::reset(const Document& proto) 
04557         { 
04558                 reset(); 
04559  
04560                 for (Node cur = proto.first_child(); cur; cur = cur.next_sibling()) 
04561                         append_copy(cur); 
04562         } 
04563  
04564         void Document::create() 
04565         { 
04566                 // initialize sentinel page 
04567                 STATIC_ASSERT(offsetof(MemoryPage, data) + sizeof(DocumentStruct) + MemoryPage_alignment <= sizeof(_memory)); 
04568  
04569                 // align upwards to page boundary 
04570                 void* page_memory = reinterpret_cast<void*>((reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(_memory) + (MemoryPage_alignment - 1)) & ~(MemoryPage_alignment - 1)); 
04571  
04572                 // prepare page structure 
04573                 MemoryPage* page = MemoryPage::construct(page_memory); 
04574  
04575                 page->busy_size = MemoryPage_size; 
04576  
04577                 // allocate new root 
04578                 _root = new (page->data) DocumentStruct(page); 
04579                 _root->prev_sibling_c = _root; 
04580  
04581                 // setup sentinel page 
04582                 page->allocator = static_cast<DocumentStruct*>(_root); 
04583         } 
04584  
04585         void Document::destroy() 
04586         { 
04587                 // destroy static storage 
04588                 if (_buffer) 
04589                 { 
04590                         global_deallocate(_buffer); 
04591                         _buffer = 0; 
04592                 } 
04593  
04594                 // destroy dynamic storage, leave sentinel page (it's in static memory) 
04595                 if (_root) 
04596                 { 
04597                         MemoryPage* root_page = reinterpret_cast<MemoryPage*>(_root->header & MemoryPage_pointer_mask); 
04598                         assert(root_page && !root_page->prev && !root_page->memory); 
04599  
04600                         // destroy all pages 
04601                         for (MemoryPage* page = root_page->next; page; ) 
04602                         { 
04603                                 MemoryPage* next = page->next; 
04604  
04605                                 Allocator::deallocate_page(page); 
04606  
04607                                 page = next; 
04608                         } 
04609  
04610                         // cleanup root page 
04611                         root_page->allocator = 0; 
04612                         root_page->next = 0; 
04613                         root_page->busy_size = root_page->freed_size = 0; 
04614  
04615                         _root = 0; 
04616                 } 
04617         }

04664  
04665         ParseResult Document::load_buffer_impl(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, Encoding encoding, bool is_mutable, bool own) 
04666         { 
04667                 reset(); 
04668  
04669                 // check input buffer 
04670                 assert(contents || size == 0); 
04671  
04672                 // get actual encoding 
04673                 Encoding buffer_encoding = get_buffer_encoding(encoding, contents, size); 
04674  
04675                 // get private buffer 
04676                 char_t* buffer = 0; 
04677                 size_t length = 0; 
04678  
04679                 if (!convert_buffer(buffer, length, buffer_encoding, contents, size, is_mutable)) return make_parse_result(StatusOutOfMemory); 
04680                  
04681                 // delete original buffer if we performed a conversion 
04682                 if (own && buffer != contents && contents) global_deallocate(contents); 
04683  
04684                 // parse 
04685                 ParseResult res = Parser::parse(buffer, length, _root, options); 
04686  
04687                 // remember encoding 
04688                 res.encoding = buffer_encoding; 
04689  
04690                 // grab onto buffer if it's our buffer, user is responsible for deallocating contens himself 
04691                 if (own || buffer != contents) _buffer = buffer; 
04692  
04693                 return res; 
04694         } 
04695  
04696         ParseResult Document::load_buffer(const void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, Encoding encoding) 
04697         { 
04698                 return load_buffer_impl(const_cast<void*>(contents), size, options, encoding, false, false); 
04699         }

04711         void Document::save(Writer& writer, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, Encoding encoding) const 
04712         { 
04713                 if (flags & format_write_bom) write_bom(writer, get_write_encoding(encoding)); 
04714  
04715                 BufferedWriter buffered_writer(writer, encoding); 
04716  
04717                 if (!(flags & format_no_declaration) && !has_declaration(*this)) 
04718                 { 
04719                         buffered_writer.write(XML_TEXT("<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>")); 
04720                         if (!(flags & format_raw)) buffered_writer.write('\n'); 
04721                 } 
04722  
04723                 node_output(buffered_writer, *this, indent, flags, 0); 
04724         }

04855 // STL replacements 
04856 namespace 
04857 { 
04858         struct equal_to 
04859         { 
04860                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const 
04861                 { 
04862                         return lhs == rhs; 
04863                 } 
04864         }; 
04865  
04866         struct not_equal_to 
04867         { 
04868                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const 
04869                 { 
04870                         return lhs != rhs; 
04871                 } 
04872         }; 
04873  
04874         struct less 
04875         { 
04876                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const 
04877                 { 
04878                         return lhs < rhs; 
04879                 } 
04880         }; 
04881  
04882         struct less_equal 
04883         { 
04884                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const 
04885                 { 
04886                         return lhs <= rhs; 
04887                 } 
04888         }; 
04889  
04890         template <typename T> void swap(T& lhs, T& rhs) 
04891         { 
04892                 T temp = lhs; 
04893                 lhs = rhs; 
04894                 rhs = temp; 
04895         } 
04896  
04897         template <typename I, typename Pred> I min_element(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred) 
04898         { 
04899                 I result = begin; 
04900  
04901                 for (I it = begin + 1; it != end; ++it) 
04902                         if (pred(*it, *result)) 
04903                                 result = it; 
04904  
04905                 return result; 
04906         } 
04907  
04908         template <typename I> void reverse(I begin, I end) 
04909         { 
04910                 while (begin + 1 < end) swap(*begin++, *--end); 
04911         } 
04912  
04913         template <typename I> I unique(I begin, I end) 
04914         { 
04915                 // fast skip head 
04916                 while (begin + 1 < end && *begin != *(begin + 1)) begin++; 
04917  
04918                 if (begin == end) return begin; 
04919  
04920                 // last written element 
04921                 I write = begin++;  
04922  
04923                 // merge unique elements 
04924                 while (begin != end) 
04925                 { 
04926                         if (*begin != *write) 
04927                                 *++write = *begin++; 
04928                         else 
04929                                 begin++; 
04930                 } 
04931  
04932                 // past-the-end (write points to live element) 
04933                 return write + 1; 
04934         } 
04935  
04936         template <typename I> void copy_backwards(I begin, I end, I target) 
04937         { 
04938                 while (begin != end) *--target = *--end; 
04939         } 
04940  
04941         template <typename I, typename Pred, typename T> void insertion_sort(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred, T*) 
04942         { 
04943                 assert(begin != end); 
04944  
04945                 for (I it = begin + 1; it != end; ++it) 
04946                 { 
04947                         T val = *it; 
04948  
04949                         if (pred(val, *begin)) 
04950                         { 
04951                                 // move to front 
04952                                 copy_backwards(begin, it, it + 1); 
04953                                 *begin = val; 
04954                         } 
04955                         else 
04956                         { 
04957                                 I hole = it; 
04958  
04959                                 // move hole backwards 
04960                                 while (pred(val, *(hole - 1))) 
04961                                 { 
04962                                         *hole = *(hole - 1); 
04963                                         hole--; 
04964                                 } 
04965  
04966                                 // fill hole with element 
04967                                 *hole = val; 
04968                         } 
04969                 } 
04970         } 
04971  
04972         // std variant for elements with == 
04973         template <typename I, typename Pred> void partition(I begin, I middle, I end, const Pred& pred, I* out_eqbeg, I* out_eqend) 
04974         { 
04975                 I eqbeg = middle, eqend = middle + 1; 
04976  
04977                 // expand equal range 
04978                 while (eqbeg != begin && *(eqbeg - 1) == *eqbeg) --eqbeg; 
04979                 while (eqend != end && *eqend == *eqbeg) ++eqend; 
04980  
04981                 // process outer elements 
04982                 I ltend = eqbeg, gtbeg = eqend; 
04983  
04984                 for (;;) 
04985                 { 
04986                         // find the element from the right side that belongs to the left one 
04987                         for (; gtbeg != end; ++gtbeg) 
04988                                 if (!pred(*eqbeg, *gtbeg)) 
04989                                 { 
04990                                         if (*gtbeg == *eqbeg) swap(*gtbeg, *eqend++); 
04991                                         else break; 
04992                                 } 
04993  
04994                         // find the element from the left side that belongs to the right one 
04995                         for (; ltend != begin; --ltend) 
04996                                 if (!pred(*(ltend - 1), *eqbeg)) 
04997                                 { 
04998                                         if (*eqbeg == *(ltend - 1)) swap(*(ltend - 1), *--eqbeg); 
04999                                         else break; 
05000                                 } 
05001  
05002                         // scanned all elements 
05003                         if (gtbeg == end && ltend == begin) 
05004                         { 
05005                                 *out_eqbeg = eqbeg; 
05006                                 *out_eqend = eqend; 
05007                                 return; 
05008                         } 
05009  
05010                         // make room for elements by moving equal area 
05011                         if (gtbeg == end) 
05012                         { 
05013                                 if (--ltend != --eqbeg) swap(*ltend, *eqbeg); 
05014                                 swap(*eqbeg, *--eqend); 
05015                         } 
05016                         else if (ltend == begin) 
05017                         { 
05018                                 if (eqend != gtbeg) swap(*eqbeg, *eqend); 
05019                                 ++eqend; 
05020                                 swap(*gtbeg++, *eqbeg++); 
05021                         } 
05022                         else swap(*gtbeg++, *--ltend); 
05023                 } 
05024         } 
05025  
05026         template <typename I, typename Pred> void median3(I first, I middle, I last, const Pred& pred) 
05027         { 
05028                 if (pred(*middle, *first)) swap(*middle, *first); 
05029                 if (pred(*last, *middle)) swap(*last, *middle); 
05030                 if (pred(*middle, *first)) swap(*middle, *first); 
05031         } 
05032  
05033         template <typename I, typename Pred> void median(I first, I middle, I last, const Pred& pred) 
05034         { 
05035                 if (last - first <= 40) 
05036                 { 
05037                         // median of three for small chunks 
05038                         median3(first, middle, last, pred); 
05039                 } 
05040                 else 
05041                 { 
05042                         // median of nine 
05043                         size_t step = (last - first + 1) / 8; 
05044  
05045                         median3(first, first + step, first + 2 * step, pred); 
05046                         median3(middle - step, middle, middle + step, pred); 
05047                         median3(last - 2 * step, last - step, last, pred); 
05048                         median3(first + step, middle, last - step, pred); 
05049                 } 
05050         } 
05051  
05052         template <typename I, typename Pred> void sort(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred) 
05053         { 
05054                 // sort large chunks 
05055                 while (end - begin > 32) 
05056                 { 
05057                         // find median element 
05058                         I middle = begin + (end - begin) / 2; 
05059                         median(begin, middle, end - 1, pred); 
05060  
05061                         // partition in three chunks (< = >) 
05062                         I eqbeg, eqend; 
05063                         partition(begin, middle, end, pred, &eqbeg, &eqend); 
05064  
05065                         // loop on larger half 
05066                         if (eqbeg - begin > end - eqend) 
05067                         { 
05068                                 sort(eqend, end, pred); 
05069                                 end = eqbeg; 
05070                         } 
05071                         else 
05072                         { 
05073                                 sort(begin, eqbeg, pred); 
05074                                 begin = eqend; 
05075                         } 
05076                 } 
05077  
05078                 // insertion sort small chunk 
05079                 if (begin != end) insertion_sort(begin, end, pred, &*begin); 
05080         } 
05081 } 
05082  
05083 // Allocator used for AST and evaluation stacks 
05084 namespace 
05085 { 
05086         struct xpath_memory_block 
05087         {        
05088                 xpath_memory_block* next; 
05089  
05090                 char data[4096]; 
05091         }; 
05092                  
05093         class xpath_allocator 
05094         { 
05095                 xpath_memory_block* _root; 
05096                 size_t _root_size; 
05097  
05098         public: 
05099         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05100                 jmp_buf* error_handler; 
05101         #endif 
05102  
05103                 xpath_allocator(xpath_memory_block* root, size_t root_size = 0): _root(root), _root_size(root_size) 
05104                 { 
05105                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05106                         error_handler = 0; 
05107                 #endif 
05108                 } 
05109                  
05110                 void* allocate_nothrow(size_t size) 
05111                 { 
05112                         const size_t block_capacity = sizeof(_root->data); 
05113  
05114                         // align size so that we're able to store pointers in subsequent blocks 
05115                         size = (size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
05116  
05117                         if (_root_size + size <= block_capacity) 
05118                         { 
05119                                 void* buf = _root->data + _root_size; 
05120                                 _root_size += size; 
05121                                 return buf; 
05122                         } 
05123                         else 
05124                         { 
05125                                 size_t block_data_size = (size > block_capacity) ? size : block_capacity; 
05126                                 size_t block_size = block_data_size + offsetof(xpath_memory_block, data); 
05127  
05128                                 xpath_memory_block* block = static_cast<xpath_memory_block*>(global_allocate(block_size)); 
05129                                 if (!block) return 0; 
05130                                  
05131                                 block->next = _root; 
05132                                  
05133                                 _root = block; 
05134                                 _root_size = size; 
05135                                  
05136                                 return block->data; 
05137                         } 
05138                 } 
05139  
05140                 void* allocate(size_t size) 
05141                 { 
05142                         void* result = allocate_nothrow(size); 
05143  
05144                         if (!result) 
05145                         { 
05146                         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05147                                 assert(error_handler); 
05148                                 longjmp(*error_handler, 1); 
05149                         #else 
05150                                 throw std::bad_alloc(); 
05151                         #endif 
05152                         } 
05153  
05154                         return result; 
05155                 } 
05156  
05157                 void* reallocate(void* ptr, size_t old_size, size_t new_size) 
05158                 { 
05159                         // align size so that we're able to store pointers in subsequent blocks 
05160                         old_size = (old_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
05161                         new_size = (new_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1); 
05162  
05163                         // we can only reallocate the last object 
05164                         assert(ptr == 0 || static_cast<char*>(ptr) + old_size == _root->data + _root_size); 
05165  
05166                         // adjust root size so that we have not allocated the object at all 
05167                         bool only_object = (_root_size == old_size); 
05168  
05169                         if (ptr) _root_size -= old_size; 
05170  
05171                         // allocate a new version (this will obviously reuse the memory if possible) 
05172                         void* result = allocate(new_size); 
05173                         assert(result); 
05174  
05175                         // we have a new block 
05176                         if (result != ptr && ptr) 
05177                         { 
05178                                 // copy old data 
05179                                 assert(new_size > old_size); 
05180                                 memcpy(result, ptr, old_size); 
05181  
05182                                 // free the previous page if it had no other objects 
05183                                 if (only_object) 
05184                                 { 
05185                                         assert(_root->data == result); 
05186                                         assert(_root->next); 
05187  
05188                                         xpath_memory_block* next = _root->next->next; 
05189  
05190                                         if (next) 
05191                                         { 
05192                                                 // deallocate the whole page, unless it was the first one 
05193                                                 global_deallocate(_root->next); 
05194                                                 _root->next = next; 
05195                                         } 
05196                                 } 
05197                         } 
05198  
05199                         return result; 
05200                 } 
05201  
05202                 void revert(const xpath_allocator& state) 
05203                 { 
05204                         // free all new pages 
05205                         xpath_memory_block* cur = _root; 
05206  
05207                         while (cur != state._root) 
05208                         { 
05209                                 xpath_memory_block* next = cur->next; 
05210  
05211                                 global_deallocate(cur); 
05212  
05213                                 cur = next; 
05214                         } 
05215  
05216                         // restore state 
05217                         _root = state._root; 
05218                         _root_size = state._root_size; 
05219                 } 
05220  
05221                 void release() 
05222                 { 
05223                         xpath_memory_block* cur = _root; 
05224                         assert(cur); 
05225  
05226                         while (cur->next) 
05227                         { 
05228                                 xpath_memory_block* next = cur->next; 
05229  
05230                                 global_deallocate(cur); 
05231  
05232                                 cur = next; 
05233                         } 
05234                 } 
05235         }; 
05236  
05237         struct xpath_allocator_capture 
05238         { 
05239                 xpath_allocator_capture(xpath_allocator* alloc): _target(alloc), _state(*alloc) 
05240                 { 
05241                 } 
05242  
05243                 ~xpath_allocator_capture() 
05244                 { 
05245                         _target->revert(_state); 
05246                 } 
05247  
05248                 xpath_allocator* _target; 
05249                 xpath_allocator _state; 
05250         }; 
05251  
05252         struct xpath_stack 
05253         { 
05254                 xpath_allocator* result; 
05255                 xpath_allocator* temp; 
05256         }; 
05257  
05258         struct xpath_stack_data 
05259         { 
05260                 xpath_memory_block blocks[2]; 
05261                 xpath_allocator result; 
05262                 xpath_allocator temp; 
05263                 xpath_stack stack; 
05264  
05265         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05266                 jmp_buf error_handler; 
05267         #endif 
05268  
05269                 xpath_stack_data(): result(blocks + 0), temp(blocks + 1) 
05270                 { 
05271                         blocks[0].next = blocks[1].next = 0; 
05272  
05273                         stack.result = &result; 
05274                         stack.temp = &temp; 
05275  
05276                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
05277                         result.error_handler = temp.error_handler = &error_handler; 
05278                 #endif 
05279                 } 
05280  
05281                 ~xpath_stack_data() 
05282                 { 
05283                         result.release(); 
05284                         temp.release(); 
05285                 } 
05286         }; 
05287 } 
05288  
05289 // String class 
05290 namespace 
05291 { 
05292         class xpath_string 
05293         { 
05294                 const char_t* _buffer; 
05295                 bool _uses_heap; 
05296  
05297                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, size_t length, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05298                 { 
05299                         char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05300                         assert(result); 
05301  
05302                         memcpy(result, string, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05303                         result[length] = 0; 
05304  
05305                         return result; 
05306                 } 
05307  
05308                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05309                 { 
05310                         return duplicate_string(string, strlength(string), alloc); 
05311                 } 
05312  
05313         public: 
05314                 xpath_string(): _buffer(XML_TEXT("")), _uses_heap(false) 
05315                 { 
05316                 } 
05317  
05318                 explicit xpath_string(const char_t* str, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05319                 { 
05320                         bool empty = (*str == 0); 
05321  
05322                         _buffer = empty ? XML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(str, alloc); 
05323                         _uses_heap = !empty; 
05324                 } 
05325  
05326                 explicit xpath_string(const char_t* str, bool use_heap): _buffer(str), _uses_heap(use_heap) 
05327                 { 
05328                 } 
05329  
05330                 xpath_string(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05331                 { 
05332                         assert(begin <= end); 
05333  
05334                         bool empty = (begin == end); 
05335  
05336                         _buffer = empty ? XML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(begin, static_cast<size_t>(end - begin), alloc); 
05337                         _uses_heap = !empty; 
05338                 } 
05339  
05340                 void append(const xpath_string& o, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05341                 { 
05342                         // skip empty sources 
05343                         if (!*o._buffer) return; 
05344  
05345                         // fast append for constant empty target and constant source 
05346                         if (!*_buffer && !_uses_heap && !o._uses_heap) 
05347                         { 
05348                                 _buffer = o._buffer; 
05349                         } 
05350                         else 
05351                         { 
05352                                 // need to make heap copy 
05353                                 size_t target_length = strlength(_buffer); 
05354                                 size_t source_length = strlength(o._buffer); 
05355                                 size_t length = target_length + source_length; 
05356  
05357                                 // allocate new buffer 
05358                                 char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->reallocate(_uses_heap ? const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer) : 0, (target_length + 1) * sizeof(char_t), (length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05359                                 assert(result); 
05360  
05361                                 // append first string to the new buffer in case there was no reallocation 
05362                                 if (!_uses_heap) memcpy(result, _buffer, target_length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05363  
05364                                 // append second string to the new buffer 
05365                                 memcpy(result + target_length, o._buffer, source_length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05366                                 result[length] = 0; 
05367  
05368                                 // finalize 
05369                                 _buffer = result; 
05370                                 _uses_heap = true; 
05371                         } 
05372                 } 
05373  
05374                 const char_t* c_str() const 
05375                 { 
05376                         return _buffer; 
05377                 } 
05378  
05379                 size_t length() const 
05380                 { 
05381                         return strlength(_buffer); 
05382                 } 
05383                  
05384                 char_t* data(xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05385                 { 
05386                         // make private heap copy 
05387                         if (!_uses_heap) 
05388                         { 
05389                                 _buffer = duplicate_string(_buffer, alloc); 
05390                                 _uses_heap = true; 
05391                         } 
05392  
05393                         return const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer); 
05394                 } 
05395  
05396                 bool empty() const 
05397                 { 
05398                         return *_buffer == 0; 
05399                 } 
05400  
05401                 bool operator==(const xpath_string& o) const 
05402                 { 
05403                         return strequal(_buffer, o._buffer); 
05404                 } 
05405  
05406                 bool operator!=(const xpath_string& o) const 
05407                 { 
05408                         return !strequal(_buffer, o._buffer); 
05409                 } 
05410  
05411                 bool uses_heap() const 
05412                 { 
05413                         return _uses_heap; 
05414                 } 
05415         }; 
05416  
05417         xpath_string xpath_string_const(const char_t* str) 
05418         { 
05419                 return xpath_string(str, false); 
05420         } 
05421 } 
05422  
05423 namespace 
05424 { 
05425         bool starts_with(const char_t* string, const char_t* pattern) 
05426         { 
05427                 while (*pattern && *string == *pattern) 
05428                 { 
05429                         string++; 
05430                         pattern++; 
05431                 } 
05432  
05433                 return *pattern == 0; 
05434         } 
05435  
05436         const char_t* find_char(const char_t* s, char_t c) 
05437         { 
05438         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05439                 return wcschr(s, c); 
05440         #else 
05441                 return strchr(s, c); 
05442         #endif 
05443         } 
05444  
05445         const char_t* find_substring(const char_t* s, const char_t* p) 
05446         { 
05447         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05448                 // MSVC6 wcsstr bug workaround (if s is empty it always returns 0) 
05449                 return (*p == 0) ? s : wcsstr(s, p); 
05450         #else 
05451                 return strstr(s, p); 
05452         #endif 
05453         } 
05454  
05455         // Converts symbol to lower case, if it is an ASCII one 
05456         char_t tolower_ascii(char_t ch) 
05457         { 
05458                 return static_cast<unsigned int>(ch - 'A') < 26 ? static_cast<char_t>(ch | ' ') : ch; 
05459         } 
05460  
05461         xpath_string string_value(const xpath_node& na, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05462         { 
05463                 if (na.attribute()) 
05464                         return xpath_string_const(na.attribute().value()); 
05465                 else 
05466                 { 
05467                         const Node& n = na.node(); 
05468  
05469                         switch (n.type()) 
05470                         { 
05471                         case node_pcdata: 
05472                         case node_cdata: 
05473                         case node_comment: 
05474                         case node_pi: 
05475                                 return xpath_string_const(n.value()); 
05476                          
05477                         case node_document: 
05478                         case node_element: 
05479                         { 
05480                                 xpath_string result; 
05481  
05482                                 Node cur = n.first_child(); 
05483                                  
05484                                 while (cur && cur != n) 
05485                                 { 
05486                                         if (cur.type() == node_pcdata || cur.type() == node_cdata) 
05487                                                 result.append(xpath_string_const(cur.value()), alloc); 
05488  
05489                                         if (cur.first_child()) 
05490                                                 cur = cur.first_child(); 
05491                                         else if (cur.next_sibling()) 
05492                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
05493                                         else 
05494                                         { 
05495                                                 while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur != n) 
05496                                                         cur = cur.parent(); 
05497  
05498                                                 if (cur != n) cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
05499                                         } 
05500                                 } 
05501                                  
05502                                 return result; 
05503                         } 
05504                          
05505                         default: 
05506                                 return xpath_string(); 
05507                         } 
05508                 } 
05509         } 
05510          
05511         unsigned int node_height(Node n) 
05512         { 
05513                 unsigned int result = 0; 
05514                  
05515                 while (n) 
05516                 { 
05517                         ++result; 
05518                         n = n.parent(); 
05519                 } 
05520                  
05521                 return result; 
05522         } 
05523          
05524         bool node_is_before(Node ln, unsigned int lh, Node rn, unsigned int rh) 
05525         { 
05526                 // normalize heights 
05527                 for (unsigned int i = rh; i < lh; i++) ln = ln.parent(); 
05528                 for (unsigned int j = lh; j < rh; j++) rn = rn.parent(); 
05529                  
05530                 // one node is the ancestor of the other 
05531                 if (ln == rn) return lh < rh; 
05532                  
05533                 // find common ancestor 
05534                 while (ln.parent() != rn.parent()) 
05535                 { 
05536                         ln = ln.parent(); 
05537                         rn = rn.parent(); 
05538                 } 
05539  
05540                 // there is no common ancestor (the shared parent is null), nodes are from different documents 
05541                 if (!ln.parent()) return ln < rn; 
05542  
05543                 // determine sibling order 
05544                 for (; ln; ln = ln.next_sibling()) 
05545                         if (ln == rn) 
05546                                 return true; 
05547                                  
05548                 return false; 
05549         } 
05550  
05551         bool node_is_ancestor(Node parent, Node node) 
05552         { 
05553                 while (node && node != parent) node = node.parent(); 
05554  
05555                 return parent && node == parent; 
05556         } 
05557  
05558         const void* document_order(const xpath_node& xnode) 
05559         { 
05560                 NodeStruct* node = xnode.node().internal_object(); 
05561  
05562                 if (node) 
05563                 { 
05564                         if (node->name && (node->header & MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->name; 
05565                         if (node->value && (node->header & MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->value; 
05566                         return 0; 
05567                 } 
05568  
05569                 AttributeStruct* attr = xnode.attribute().internal_object(); 
05570  
05571                 if (attr) 
05572                 { 
05573                         if ((attr->header & MemoryPage_name_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->name; 
05574                         if ((attr->header & MemoryPage_value_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->value; 
05575                         return 0; 
05576                 } 
05577  
05578                 return 0; 
05579         } 
05580          
05581         struct document_order_comparator 
05582         { 
05583                 bool operator()(const xpath_node& lhs, const xpath_node& rhs) const 
05584                 { 
05585                         // optimized document order based check 
05586                         const void* lo = document_order(lhs); 
05587                         const void* ro = document_order(rhs); 
05588  
05589                         if (lo && ro) return lo < ro; 
05590  
05591                         // slow comparison 
05592                         Node ln = lhs.node(), rn = rhs.node(); 
05593  
05594                         // compare attributes 
05595                         if (lhs.attribute() && rhs.attribute()) 
05596                         { 
05597                                 // shared parent 
05598                                 if (lhs.parent() == rhs.parent()) 
05599                                 { 
05600                                         // determine sibling order 
05601                                         for (Attribute a = lhs.attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute()) 
05602                                                 if (a == rhs.attribute()) 
05603                                                         return true; 
05604                                          
05605                                         return false; 
05606                                 } 
05607                                  
05608                                 // compare attribute parents 
05609                                 ln = lhs.parent(); 
05610                                 rn = rhs.parent(); 
05611                         } 
05612                         else if (lhs.attribute()) 
05613                         { 
05614                                 // attributes go after the parent element 
05615                                 if (lhs.parent() == rhs.node()) return false; 
05616                                  
05617                                 ln = lhs.parent(); 
05618                         } 
05619                         else if (rhs.attribute()) 
05620                         { 
05621                                 // attributes go after the parent element 
05622                                 if (rhs.parent() == lhs.node()) return true; 
05623                                  
05624                                 rn = rhs.parent(); 
05625                         } 
05626  
05627                         if (ln == rn) return false; 
05628                          
05629                         unsigned int lh = node_height(ln); 
05630                         unsigned int rh = node_height(rn); 
05631                          
05632                         return node_is_before(ln, lh, rn, rh); 
05633                 } 
05634         }; 
05635  
05636         struct duplicate_comparator 
05637         { 
05638                 bool operator()(const xpath_node& lhs, const xpath_node& rhs) const 
05639                 { 
05640                         if (lhs.attribute()) return rhs.attribute() ? lhs.attribute() < rhs.attribute() : true; 
05641                         else return rhs.attribute() ? false : lhs.node() < rhs.node(); 
05642                 } 
05643         }; 
05644          
05645         double gen_nan() 
05646         { 
05647         #if defined(__STDC_IEC_559__) || ((FLT_RADIX - 0 == 2) && (FLT_MAX_EXP - 0 == 128) && (FLT_MANT_DIG - 0 == 24)) 
05648                 union { float f; int32_t i; } u[sizeof(float) == sizeof(int32_t) ? 1 : -1]; 
05649                 u[0].i = 0x7fc00000; 
05650                 return u[0].f; 
05651         #else 
05652                 // fallback 
05653                 const volatile double zero = 0.0; 
05654                 return zero / zero; 
05655         #endif 
05656         } 
05657          
05658         bool is_nan(double value) 
05659         { 
05660         #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__BORLANDC__) 
05661                 return !!_isnan(value); 
05662         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN) 
05663                 return fpclassify(value) == FP_NAN; 
05664         #else 
05665                 // fallback 
05666                 const volatile double v = value; 
05667                 return v != v; 
05668         #endif 
05669         } 
05670          
05671         const char_t* convert_number_to_string_special(double value) 
05672         { 
05673         #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__BORLANDC__) 
05674                 if (_finite(value)) return (value == 0) ? XML_TEXT("0") : 0; 
05675                 if (_isnan(value)) return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05676                 return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (value > 0); 
05677         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN) && defined(FP_INFINITE) && defined(FP_ZERO) 
05678                 switch (fpclassify(value)) 
05679                 { 
05680                 case FP_NAN: 
05681                         return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05682  
05683                 case FP_INFINITE: 
05684                         return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (value > 0); 
05685  
05686                 case FP_ZERO: 
05687                         return XML_TEXT("0"); 
05688  
05689                 default: 
05690                         return 0; 
05691                 } 
05692         #else 
05693                 // fallback 
05694                 const volatile double v = value; 
05695  
05696                 if (v == 0) return XML_TEXT("0"); 
05697                 if (v != v) return XML_TEXT("NaN"); 
05698                 if (v * 2 == v) return XML_TEXT("-Infinity") + (value > 0); 
05699                 return 0; 
05700         #endif 
05701         } 
05702          
05703         bool convert_number_to_boolean(double value) 
05704         { 
05705                 return (value != 0 && !is_nan(value)); 
05706         } 
05707          
05708         void truncate_zeros(char* begin, char* end) 
05709         { 
05710                 while (begin != end && end[-1] == '0') end--; 
05711  
05712                 *end = 0; 
05713         } 
05714  
05715         // gets mantissa digits in the form of 0.xxxxx with 0. implied and the exponent 
05716 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400 
05717         void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent) 
05718         { 
05719                 // get base values 
05720                 int sign, exponent; 
05721                 _ecvt_s(buffer, buffer_size, value, DBL_DIG + 1, &exponent, &sign); 
05722  
05723                 // truncate redundant zeros 
05724                 truncate_zeros(buffer, buffer + strlen(buffer)); 
05725  
05726                 // fill results 
05727                 *out_mantissa = buffer; 
05728                 *out_exponent = exponent; 
05729         } 
05730 #else 
05731         void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent) 
05732         { 
05733                 // get a scientific notation value with IEEE DBL_DIG decimals 
05734                 sprintf(buffer, "%.*e", DBL_DIG, value); 
05735                 assert(strlen(buffer) < buffer_size); 
05736                 (void)!buffer_size; 
05737  
05738                 // get the exponent (possibly negative) 
05739                 char* exponent_string = strchr(buffer, 'e'); 
05740                 assert(exponent_string); 
05741  
05742                 int exponent = atoi(exponent_string + 1); 
05743  
05744                 // extract mantissa string: skip sign 
05745                 char* mantissa = buffer[0] == '-' ? buffer + 1 : buffer; 
05746                 assert(mantissa[0] != '0' && mantissa[1] == '.'); 
05747  
05748                 // divide mantissa by 10 to eliminate integer part 
05749                 mantissa[1] = mantissa[0]; 
05750                 mantissa++; 
05751                 exponent++; 
05752  
05753                 // remove extra mantissa digits and zero-terminate mantissa 
05754                 truncate_zeros(mantissa, exponent_string); 
05755  
05756                 // fill results 
05757                 *out_mantissa = mantissa; 
05758                 *out_exponent = exponent; 
05759         } 
05760 #endif 
05761  
05762         xpath_string convert_number_to_string(double value, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
05763         { 
05764                 // try special number conversion 
05765                 const char_t* special = convert_number_to_string_special(value); 
05766                 if (special) return xpath_string_const(special); 
05767  
05768                 // get mantissa + exponent form 
05769                 char mantissa_buffer[64]; 
05770  
05771                 char* mantissa; 
05772                 int exponent; 
05773                 convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(value, mantissa_buffer, sizeof(mantissa_buffer), &mantissa, &exponent); 
05774  
05775                 // make the number! 
05776                 char_t result[512]; 
05777                 char_t* s = result; 
05778  
05779                 // sign 
05780                 if (value < 0) *s++ = '-'; 
05781  
05782                 // integer part 
05783                 if (exponent <= 0) 
05784                 { 
05785                         *s++ = '0'; 
05786                 } 
05787                 else 
05788                 { 
05789                         while (exponent > 0) 
05790                         { 
05791                                 assert(*mantissa == 0 || (unsigned)(*mantissa - '0') <= 9); 
05792                                 *s++ = *mantissa ? *mantissa++ : '0'; 
05793                                 exponent--; 
05794                         } 
05795                 } 
05796  
05797                 // fractional part 
05798                 if (*mantissa) 
05799                 { 
05800                         // decimal point 
05801                         *s++ = '.'; 
05802  
05803                         // extra zeroes from negative exponent 
05804                         while (exponent < 0) 
05805                         { 
05806                                 *s++ = '0'; 
05807                                 exponent++; 
05808                         } 
05809  
05810                         // extra mantissa digits 
05811                         while (*mantissa) 
05812                         { 
05813                                 assert((unsigned)(*mantissa - '0') <= 9); 
05814                                 *s++ = *mantissa++; 
05815                         } 
05816                 } 
05817  
05818                 // zero-terminate 
05819                 assert(s < result + sizeof(result) / sizeof(result[0])); 
05820                 *s = 0; 
05821  
05822                 return xpath_string(result, alloc); 
05823         } 
05824          
05825         bool check_string_to_number_format(const char_t* string) 
05826         { 
05827                 // parse leading whitespace 
05828                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string; 
05829  
05830                 // parse sign 
05831                 if (*string == '-') ++string; 
05832  
05833                 if (!*string) return false; 
05834  
05835                 // if there is no integer part, there should be a decimal part with at least one digit 
05836                 if (!IS_CHARTYPEX(string[0], ctx_digit) && (string[0] != '.' || !IS_CHARTYPEX(string[1], ctx_digit))) return false; 
05837  
05838                 // parse integer part 
05839                 while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string; 
05840  
05841                 // parse decimal part 
05842                 if (*string == '.') 
05843                 { 
05844                         ++string; 
05845  
05846                         while (IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string; 
05847                 } 
05848  
05849                 // parse trailing whitespace 
05850                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string; 
05851  
05852                 return *string == 0; 
05853         } 
05854  
05855         double convert_string_to_number(const char_t* string) 
05856         { 
05857                 // check string format 
05858                 if (!check_string_to_number_format(string)) return gen_nan(); 
05859  
05860                 // parse string 
05861         #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
05862                 return wcstod(string, 0); 
05863         #else 
05864                 return atof(string); 
05865         #endif 
05866         } 
05867  
05868         bool convert_string_to_number(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, double* out_result) 
05869         { 
05870                 char_t buffer[32]; 
05871  
05872                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
05873                 char_t* scratch = buffer; 
05874  
05875                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0])) 
05876                 { 
05877                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy 
05878                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
05879                         if (!scratch) return false; 
05880                 } 
05881  
05882                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform conversion 
05883                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
05884                 scratch[length] = 0; 
05885  
05886                 *out_result = convert_string_to_number(scratch); 
05887  
05888                 // free dummy buffer 
05889                 if (scratch != buffer) global_deallocate(scratch); 
05890  
05891                 return true; 
05892         } 
05893          
05894         double round_nearest(double value) 
05895         { 
05896                 return floor(value + 0.5); 
05897         } 
05898  
05899         double round_nearest_nzero(double value) 
05900         { 
05901                 // same as round_nearest, but returns -0 for [-0.5, -0] 
05902                 // ceil is used to differentiate between +0 and -0 (we return -0 for [-0.5, -0] and +0 for +0) 
05903                 return (value >= -0.5 && value <= 0) ? ceil(value) : floor(value + 0.5); 
05904         } 
05905          
05906         const char_t* qualified_name(const xpath_node& node) 
05907         { 
05908                 return node.attribute() ? node.attribute().name() : node.node().name(); 
05909         } 
05910          
05911         const char_t* local_name(const xpath_node& node) 
05912         { 
05913                 const char_t* name = qualified_name(node); 
05914                 const char_t* p = find_char(name, ':'); 
05915                  
05916                 return p ? p + 1 : name; 
05917         } 
05918  
05919         struct namespace_uri_predicate 
05920         { 
05921                 const char_t* prefix; 
05922                 size_t prefix_length; 
05923  
05924                 namespace_uri_predicate(const char_t* name) 
05925                 { 
05926                         const char_t* pos = find_char(name, ':'); 
05927  
05928                         prefix = pos ? name : 0; 
05929                         prefix_length = pos ? static_cast<size_t>(pos - name) : 0; 
05930                 } 
05931  
05932                 bool operator()(const Attribute& a) const 
05933                 { 
05934                         const char_t* name = a.name(); 
05935  
05936                         if (!starts_with(name, XML_TEXT("xmlns"))) return false; 
05937  
05938                         return prefix ? name[5] == ':' && strequalrange(name + 6, prefix, prefix_length) : name[5] == 0; 
05939                 } 
05940         }; 
05941  
05942         const char_t* namespace_uri(const Node& node) 
05943         { 
05944                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = node.name(); 
05945                  
05946                 Node p = node; 
05947                  
05948                 while (p) 
05949                 { 
05950                         Attribute a = p.find_attribute(pred); 
05951                          
05952                         if (a) return a.value(); 
05953                          
05954                         p = p.parent(); 
05955                 } 
05956                  
05957                 return XML_TEXT(""); 
05958         } 
05959  
05960         const char_t* namespace_uri(const Attribute& attr, const Node& parent) 
05961         { 
05962                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = attr.name(); 
05963                  
05964                 // Default namespace does not apply to attributes 
05965                 if (!pred.prefix) return XML_TEXT(""); 
05966                  
05967                 Node p = parent; 
05968                  
05969                 while (p) 
05970                 { 
05971                         Attribute a = p.find_attribute(pred); 
05972                          
05973                         if (a) return a.value(); 
05974                          
05975                         p = p.parent(); 
05976                 } 
05977                  
05978                 return XML_TEXT(""); 
05979         } 
05980  
05981         const char_t* namespace_uri(const xpath_node& node) 
05982         { 
05983                 return node.attribute() ? namespace_uri(node.attribute(), node.parent()) : namespace_uri(node.node()); 
05984         } 
05985  
05986         void normalize_space(char_t* buffer) 
05987         { 
05988                 char_t* write = buffer; 
05989  
05990                 for (char_t* it = buffer; *it; ) 
05991                 { 
05992                         char_t ch = *it++; 
05993  
05994                         if (IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space)) 
05995                         { 
05996                                 // replace whitespace sequence with single space 
05997                                 while (IS_CHARTYPE(*it, ct_space)) it++; 
05998  
05999                                 // avoid leading spaces 
06000                                 if (write != buffer) *write++ = ' '; 
06001                         } 
06002                         else *write++ = ch; 
06003                 } 
06004  
06005                 // remove trailing space 
06006                 if (write != buffer && IS_CHARTYPE(write[-1], ct_space)) write--; 
06007  
06008                 // zero-terminate 
06009                 *write = 0; 
06010         } 
06011  
06012         void translate(char_t* buffer, const char_t* from, const char_t* to) 
06013         { 
06014                 size_t to_length = strlength(to); 
06015  
06016                 char_t* write = buffer; 
06017  
06018                 while (*buffer) 
06019                 { 
06020                         DMC_VOLATILE char_t ch = *buffer++; 
06021  
06022                         const char_t* pos = find_char(from, ch); 
06023  
06024                         if (!pos) 
06025                                 *write++ = ch; // do not process 
06026                         else if (static_cast<size_t>(pos - from) < to_length) 
06027                                 *write++ = to[pos - from]; // replace 
06028                 } 
06029  
06030                 // zero-terminate 
06031                 *write = 0; 
06032         }

06076  
06077         unsigned int hash_string(const char_t* str) 
06078         { 
06079                 // Jenkins one-at-a-time hash (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenkins_hash_function#one-at-a-time) 
06080                 unsigned int result = 0; 
06081  
06082                 while (*str) 
06083                 { 
06084                         result += static_cast<unsigned int>(*str++); 
06085                         result += result << 10; 
06086                         result ^= result >> 6; 
06087                 } 
06088          
06089                 result += result << 3; 
06090                 result ^= result >> 11; 
06091                 result += result << 15; 
06092          
06093                 return result; 
06094         } 
06095  
06096         template <typename T> T* new_xpath_variable(const char_t* name) 
06097         { 
06098                 size_t length = strlength(name); 
06099                 if (length == 0) return 0; // empty variable names are invalid 
06100  
06101                 // $$ we can't use offsetof(T, name) because T is non-POD, so we just allocate additional length characters 
06102                 void* memory = global_allocate(sizeof(T) + length * sizeof(char_t)); 
06103                 if (!memory) return 0; 
06104  
06105                 T* result = new (memory) T(); 
06106  
06107                 memcpy(result->name, name, (length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)); 
06108  
06109                 return result; 
06110         } 
06111  
06112         xpath_variable* new_xpath_variable(xpath_value_type type, const char_t* name) 
06113         { 
06114                 switch (type) 
06115                 { 
06116                 case xpath_type_node_set: 
06117                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_node_set>(name); 
06118  
06119                 case xpath_type_number: 
06120                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_number>(name); 
06121  
06122                 case xpath_type_string: 
06123                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_string>(name); 
06124  
06125                 case xpath_type_boolean: 
06126                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_boolean>(name); 
06127  
06128                 default: 
06129                         return 0; 
06130                 } 
06131         } 
06132  
06133         template <typename T> void delete_xpath_variable(T* var) 
06134         { 
06135                 var->~T(); 
06136                 global_deallocate(var); 
06137         } 
06138  
06139         void delete_xpath_variable(xpath_value_type type, xpath_variable* var) 
06140         { 
06141                 switch (type) 
06142                 { 
06143                 case xpath_type_node_set: 
06144                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_node_set*>(var)); 
06145                         break; 
06146  
06147                 case xpath_type_number: 
06148                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_number*>(var)); 
06149                         break; 
06150  
06151                 case xpath_type_string: 
06152                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_string*>(var)); 
06153                         break; 
06154  
06155                 case xpath_type_boolean: 
06156                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_boolean*>(var)); 
06157                         break; 
06158  
06159                 default: 
06160                         assert(!"Invalid variable type"); 
06161                 } 
06162         } 
06163  
06164         xpath_variable* get_variable(xpath_variable_set* set, const char_t* begin, const char_t* end) 
06165         { 
06166                 char_t buffer[32]; 
06167  
06168                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
06169                 char_t* scratch = buffer; 
06170  
06171                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0])) 
06172                 { 
06173                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy 
06174                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
06175                         if (!scratch) return 0; 
06176                 } 
06177  
06178                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform lookup 
06179                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
06180                 scratch[length] = 0; 
06181  
06182                 xpath_variable* result = set->get(scratch); 
06183  
06184                 // free dummy buffer 
06185                 if (scratch != buffer) global_deallocate(scratch); 
06186  
06187                 return result; 
06188         } 
06189 }

06191 // Internal node set class 
06192 namespace 
06193 { 
06194         xpath_node_set::type_t xpath_sort(xpath_node* begin, xpath_node* end, xpath_node_set::type_t type, bool rev) 
06195         { 
06196                 xpath_node_set::type_t order = rev ? xpath_node_set::type_sorted_reverse : xpath_node_set::type_sorted; 
06197  
06198                 if (type == xpath_node_set::type_unsorted) 
06199                 { 
06200                         sort(begin, end, document_order_comparator()); 
06201  
06202                         type = xpath_node_set::type_sorted; 
06203                 } 
06204                  
06205                 if (type != order) reverse(begin, end); 
06206                          
06207                 return order; 
06208         } 
06209  
06210         xpath_node xpath_first(const xpath_node* begin, const xpath_node* end, xpath_node_set::type_t type) 
06211         { 
06212                 if (begin == end) return xpath_node(); 
06213  
06214                 switch (type) 
06215                 { 
06216                 case xpath_node_set::type_sorted: 
06217                         return *begin; 
06218  
06219                 case xpath_node_set::type_sorted_reverse: 
06220                         return *(end - 1); 
06221  
06222                 case xpath_node_set::type_unsorted: 
06223                         return *min_element(begin, end, document_order_comparator()); 
06224  
06225                 default: 
06226                         assert(!"Invalid node set type"); 
06227                         return xpath_node(); 
06228                 } 
06229         } 
06230         class xpath_node_set_raw 
06231         { 
06232                 xpath_node_set::type_t _type; 
06233  
06234                 xpath_node* _begin; 
06235                 xpath_node* _end; 
06236                 xpath_node* _eos; 
06237  
06238         public: 
06239                 xpath_node_set_raw(): _type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted), _begin(0), _end(0), _eos(0) 
06240                 { 
06241                 } 
06242  
06243                 xpath_node* begin() const 
06244                 { 
06245                         return _begin; 
06246                 } 
06247  
06248                 xpath_node* end() const 
06249                 { 
06250                         return _end; 
06251                 } 
06252  
06253                 bool empty() const 
06254                 { 
06255                         return _begin == _end; 
06256                 } 
06257  
06258                 size_t size() const 
06259                 { 
06260                         return static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin); 
06261                 } 
06262  
06263                 xpath_node first() const 
06264                 { 
06265                         return xpath_first(_begin, _end, _type); 
06266                 } 
06267  
06268                 void push_back(const xpath_node& node, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
06269                 { 
06270                         if (_end == _eos) 
06271                         { 
06272                                 size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin); 
06273  
06274                                 // get new capacity (1.5x rule) 
06275                                 size_t new_capacity = capacity + capacity / 2 + 1; 
06276  
06277                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one 
06278                                 xpath_node* data = static_cast<xpath_node*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(xpath_node), new_capacity * sizeof(xpath_node))); 
06279                                 assert(data); 
06280  
06281                                 // finalize 
06282                                 _begin = data; 
06283                                 _end = data + capacity; 
06284                                 _eos = data + new_capacity; 
06285                         } 
06286  
06287                         *_end++ = node; 
06288                 } 
06289  
06290                 void append(const xpath_node* begin, const xpath_node* end, xpath_allocator* alloc) 
06291                 { 
06292                         size_t size = static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin); 
06293                         size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin); 
06294                         size_t count = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
06295  
06296                         if (size + count > capacity) 
06297                         { 
06298                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one 
06299                                 xpath_node* data = static_cast<xpath_node*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(xpath_node), (size + count) * sizeof(xpath_node))); 
06300                                 assert(data); 
06301  
06302                                 // finalize 
06303                                 _begin = data; 
06304                                 _end = data + size; 
06305                                 _eos = data + size + count; 
06306                         } 
06307  
06308                         memcpy(_end, begin, count * sizeof(xpath_node)); 
06309                         _end += count; 
06310                 } 
06311  
06312                 void sort_do() 
06313                 { 
06314                         _type = xpath_sort(_begin, _end, _type, false); 
06315                 } 
06316  
06317                 void truncate(xpath_node* pos) 
06318                 { 
06319                         assert(_begin <= pos && pos <= _end); 
06320  
06321                         _end = pos; 
06322                 } 
06323  
06324                 void remove_duplicates() 
06325                 { 
06326                         if (_type == xpath_node_set::type_unsorted) 
06327                                 sort(_begin, _end, duplicate_comparator()); 
06328                  
06329                         _end = unique(_begin, _end); 
06330                 } 
06331  
06332                 xpath_node_set::type_t type() const 
06333                 { 
06334                         return _type; 
06335                 } 
06336  
06337                 void set_type(xpath_node_set::type_t type) 
06338                 { 
06339                         _type = type; 
06340                 } 
06341         }; 
06342 }
