07939                                 xpath_string from = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack); 
07940                                 xpath_string to = _right->_next->eval_string(c, swapped_stack); 
07941  
07942                                 translate(s.data(stack.result), from.c_str(), to.c_str()); 
07943  
07944                                 return s; 
07945                         } 
07946  
07947                         case ast_variable: 
07948                         { 
07949                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type()); 
07950  
07951                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_string) 
07952                                         return xpath_string_const(_data.variable->get_string()); 
07953  
07954                                 // fallthrough to type conversion 
07955                         } 
07956  
07957                         default: 
07958                         { 
07959                                 switch (_rettype) 
07960                                 { 
07961                                 case xpath_type_boolean: 
07962                                         return xpath_string_const(eval_boolean(c, stack) ? XML_TEXT("true") : XML_TEXT("false")); 
07963                                          
07964                                 case xpath_type_number: 
07965                                         return convert_number_to_string(eval_number(c, stack), stack.result); 
07966                                          
07967                                 case xpath_type_node_set: 
07968                                 { 
07969                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp); 
07970  
07971                                         xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result}; 
07972  
07973                                         xpath_node_set_raw ns = eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack); 
07974                                         return ns.empty() ? xpath_string() : string_value(ns.first(), stack.result); 
07975                                 } 
07976                                  
07977                                 default: 
07978                                         assert(!"Wrong expression for return type string"); 
07979                                         return xpath_string(); 
07980                                 } 
07981                         } 
07982                         } 
07983                 } 
07984  
07985                 xpath_node_set_raw eval_node_set(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack) 
07986                 { 
07987                         switch (_type) 
07988                         { 
07989                         case ast_op_union: 
07990                         { 
07991                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp); 
07992  
07993                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result}; 
07994  
07995                                 xpath_node_set_raw ls = _left->eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack); 
07996                                 xpath_node_set_raw rs = _right->eval_node_set(c, stack); 
07997                                  
07998                                 // we can optimize merging two sorted sets, but this is a very rare operation, so don't bother 
07999                                 rs.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted); 
08000  
08001                                 rs.append(ls.begin(), ls.end(), stack.result); 
08002                                 rs.remove_duplicates(); 
08003                                  
08004                                 return rs; 
08005                         } 
08006  
08007                         case ast_filter: 
08008                         case ast_filter_posinv: 
08009                         { 
08010                                 xpath_node_set_raw set = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack); 
08011  
08012                                 // either expression is a number or it contains position() call; sort by document order 
08013                                 if (_type == ast_filter) set.sort_do(); 
08014  
08015                                 apply_predicate(set, 0, _right, stack); 
08016                          
08017                                 return set; 
08018                         } 
08019                          
08020                         case ast_func_id: 
08021                                 return xpath_node_set_raw(); 
08022                          
08023                         case ast_step: 
08024                         { 
08025                                 switch (_axis) 
08026                                 { 
08027                                 case axis_ancestor: 
08028                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor>()); 
08029                                          
08030                                 case axis_ancestor_or_self: 
08031                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor_or_self>()); 
08032  
08033                                 case axis_attribute: 
08034                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_attribute>()); 
08035  
08036                                 case axis_child: 
08037                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_child>()); 
08038                                  
08039                                 case axis_descendant: 
08040                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_descendant>()); 
08041  
08042                                 case axis_descendant_or_self: 
08043                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_descendant_or_self>()); 
08044  
08045                                 case axis_following: 
08046                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_following>()); 
08047                                  
08048                                 case axis_following_sibling: 
08049                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_following_sibling>()); 
08050                                  
08051                                 case axis_namespace: 
08052                                         // namespaced axis is not supported 
08053                                         return xpath_node_set_raw(); 
08054                                  
08055                                 case axis_parent: 
08056                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_parent>()); 
08057                                  
08058                                 case axis_preceding: 
08059                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_preceding>()); 
08060  
08061                                 case axis_preceding_sibling: 
08062                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_preceding_sibling>()); 
08063                                  
08064                                 case axis_self: 
08065                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_self>()); 
08066                                 } 
08067                         } 
08068  
08069                         case ast_step_root: 
08070                         { 
08071                                 assert(!_right); // root step can't have any predicates 
08072  
08073                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns; 
08074  
08075                                 ns.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_sorted); 
08076  
08077                                 if (c.n.node()) ns.push_back(c.n.node().root(), stack.result); 
08078                                 else if (c.n.attribute()) ns.push_back(c.n.parent().root(), stack.result); 
08079  
08080                                 return ns; 
08081                         } 
08082  
08083                         case ast_variable: 
08084                         { 
08085                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type()); 
08086  
08087                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_node_set) 
08088                                 { 
08089                                         const xpath_node_set& s = _data.variable->get_node_set(); 
08090  
08091                                         xpath_node_set_raw ns; 
08092  
08093                                         ns.set_type(s.type()); 
08094                                         ns.append(s.begin(), s.end(), stack.result); 
08095  
08096                                         return ns; 
08097                                 } 
08098  
08099                                 // fallthrough to type conversion 
08100                         } 
08101  
08102                         default: 
08103                                 assert(!"Wrong expression for return type node set"); 
08104                                 return xpath_node_set_raw(); 
08105                         } 
08106                 } 
08107                  
08108                 bool is_posinv() 
08109                 { 
08110                         switch (_type) 
08111                         { 
08112                         case ast_func_position: 
08113                                 return false; 
08114  
08115                         case ast_string_constant: 
08116                         case ast_number_constant: 
08117                         case ast_variable: 
08118                                 return true; 
08119  
08120                         case ast_step: 
08121                         case ast_step_root: 
08122                                 return true; 
08123  
08124                         case ast_predicate: 
08125                         case ast_filter: 
08126                         case ast_filter_posinv: 
08127                                 return true; 
08128  
08129                         default: 
08130                                 if (_left && !_left->is_posinv()) return false; 
08131                                  
08132                                 for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next) 
08133                                         if (!n->is_posinv()) return false; 
08134                                          
08135                                 return true; 
08136                         } 
08137                 } 
08138  
08139                 xpath_value_type rettype() const 
08140                 { 
08141                         return static_cast<xpath_value_type>(_rettype); 
08142                 } 
08143         }; 
08144  
08145         struct xpath_parser 
08146         { 
08147                 xpath_allocator* _alloc; 
08148                 xpath_lexer _lexer; 
08149  
08150                 const char_t* _query; 
08151                 xpath_variable_set* _variables; 
08152  
08153                 xpath_parse_result* _result; 
08154  
08155         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
08156                 jmp_buf _error_handler; 
08157         #endif 
08158  
08159                 void throw_error(const char* message) 
08160                 { 
08161                         _result->error = message; 
08162                         _result->offset = _lexer.current_pos() - _query; 
08163  
08164                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
08165                         longjmp(_error_handler, 1); 
08166                 #else 
08167                         throw xpath_exception(*_result); 
08168                 #endif 
08169                 } 
08170  
08171                 void throw_error_oom() 
08172                 { 
08173                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
08174                         throw_error("Out of memory"); 
08175                 #else 
08176                         throw std::bad_alloc(); 
08177                 #endif 
08178                 } 
08179  
08180                 void* alloc_node() 
08181                 { 
08182                         void* result = _alloc->allocate_nothrow(sizeof(xpath_ast_node)); 
08183  
08184                         if (!result) throw_error_oom(); 
08185  
08186                         return result; 
08187                 } 
08188  
08189                 const char_t* alloc_string(const xpath_lexer_string& value) 
08190                 { 
08191                         if (value.begin) 
08192                         { 
08193                                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(value.end - value.begin); 
08194  
08195                                 char_t* c = static_cast<char_t*>(_alloc->allocate_nothrow((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t))); 
08196                                 if (!c) throw_error_oom(); 
08197  
08198                                 memcpy(c, value.begin, length * sizeof(char_t)); 
08199                                 c[length] = 0; 
08200  
08201                                 return c; 
08202                         } 
08203                         else return 0; 
08204                 } 
08205  
08206                 xpath_ast_node* parse_function_helper(ast_type_t type0, ast_type_t type1, size_t argc, xpath_ast_node* args[2]) 
08207                 { 
08208                         assert(argc <= 1); 
08209  
08210                         if (argc == 1 && args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set"); 
08211  
08212                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? type0 : type1, xpath_type_string, args[0]); 
08213                 } 
08214  
08215                 xpath_ast_node* parse_function(const xpath_lexer_string& name, size_t argc, xpath_ast_node* args[2]) 
08216                 { 
08217                         switch (name.begin[0]) 
08218                         { 
08219                         case 'b': 
08220                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("boolean") && argc == 1) 
08221                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_boolean, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]); 
08222                                          
08223                                 break; 
08224                          
08225                         case 'c': 
08226                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("count") && argc == 1) 
08227                                 { 
08228                                         if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set"); 
08229                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_count, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08230                                 } 
08231                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("contains") && argc == 2) 
08232                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_contains, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08233                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("concat") && argc >= 2) 
08234                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_concat, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08235                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("ceiling") && argc == 1) 
08236                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_ceiling, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08237                                          
08238                                 break; 
08239                          
08240                         case 'f': 
08241                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("false") && argc == 0) 
08242                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_false, xpath_type_boolean); 
08243                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("floor") && argc == 1) 
08244                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_floor, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08245                                          
08246                                 break; 
08247                          
08248                         case 'i': 
08249                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("id") && argc == 1) 
08250                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_id, xpath_type_node_set, args[0]); 
08251                                          
08252                                 break; 
08253                          
08254                         case 'l': 
08255                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("last") && argc == 0) 
08256                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_last, xpath_type_number); 
08257                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("lang") && argc == 1) 
08258                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_lang, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]); 
08259                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("local-name") && argc <= 1) 
08260                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_local_name_0, ast_func_local_name_1, argc, args); 
08261                          
08262                                 break; 
08263                          
08264                         case 'n': 
08265                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("name") && argc <= 1) 
08266                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_name_0, ast_func_name_1, argc, args); 
08267                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("namespace-uri") && argc <= 1) 
08268                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_namespace_uri_0, ast_func_namespace_uri_1, argc, args); 
08269                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("normalize-space") && argc <= 1) 
08270                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_normalize_space_0 : ast_func_normalize_space_1, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08271                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("not") && argc == 1) 
08272                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_not, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]); 
08273                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("number") && argc <= 1) 
08274                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_number_0 : ast_func_number_1, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08275                          
08276                                 break; 
08277                          
08278                         case 'p': 
08279                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("position") && argc == 0) 
08280                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_position, xpath_type_number); 
08281                                  
08282                                 break; 
08283                          
08284                         case 'r': 
08285                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("round") && argc == 1) 
08286                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_round, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08287  
08288                                 break; 
08289                          
08290                         case 's': 
08291                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("string") && argc <= 1) 
08292                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_0 : ast_func_string_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]); 
08293                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("string-length") && argc <= 1) 
08294                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_length_0 : ast_func_string_length_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]); 
08295                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("starts-with") && argc == 2) 
08296                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_starts_with, xpath_type_boolean, args[0], args[1]); 
08297                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("substring-before") && argc == 2) 
08298                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_substring_before, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08299                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("substring-after") && argc == 2) 
08300                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_substring_after, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08301                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("substring") && (argc == 2 || argc == 3)) 
08302                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 2 ? ast_func_substring_2 : ast_func_substring_3, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08303                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("sum") && argc == 1) 
08304                                 { 
08305                                         if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set"); 
08306                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_sum, xpath_type_number, args[0]); 
08307                                 } 
08308  
08309                                 break; 
08310                          
08311                         case 't': 
08312                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("translate") && argc == 3) 
08313                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_translate, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]); 
08314                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("true") && argc == 0) 
08315                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_true, xpath_type_boolean); 
08316                                          
08317                                 break; 
08318                         } 
08319  
08320                         throw_error("Unrecognized function or wrong parameter count"); 
08321  
08322                         return 0; 
08323                 } 
08324  
08325                 axis_t parse_axis_name(const xpath_lexer_string& name, bool& specified) 
08326                 { 
08327                         specified = true; 
08328  
08329                         switch (name.begin[0]) 
08330                         { 
08331                         case 'a': 
08332                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("ancestor")) 
08333                                         return axis_ancestor; 
08334                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("ancestor-or-self")) 
08335                                         return axis_ancestor_or_self; 
08336                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("attribute")) 
08337                                         return axis_attribute; 
08338                                  
08339                                 break; 
08340                          
08341                         case 'c': 
08342                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("child")) 
08343                                         return axis_child; 
08344                                  
08345                                 break; 
08346                          
08347                         case 'd': 
08348                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("descendant")) 
08349                                         return axis_descendant; 
08350                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("descendant-or-self")) 
08351                                         return axis_descendant_or_self; 
08352                                  
08353                                 break; 
08354                          
08355                         case 'f': 
08356                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("following")) 
08357                                         return axis_following; 
08358                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("following-sibling")) 
08359                                         return axis_following_sibling; 
08360                                  
08361                                 break; 
08362                          
08363                         case 'n': 
08364                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("namespace")) 
08365                                         return axis_namespace; 
08366                                  
08367                                 break; 
08368                          
08369                         case 'p': 
08370                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("parent")) 
08371                                         return axis_parent; 
08372                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("preceding")) 
08373                                         return axis_preceding; 
08374                                 else if (name == XML_TEXT("preceding-sibling")) 
08375                                         return axis_preceding_sibling; 
08376                                  
08377                                 break; 
08378                          
08379                         case 's': 
08380                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("self")) 
08381                                         return axis_self; 
08382                                  
08383                                 break; 
08384                         } 
08385  
08386                         specified = false; 
08387                         return axis_child; 
08388                 } 
08389  
08390                 nodetest_t parse_node_test_type(const xpath_lexer_string& name) 
08391                 { 
08392                         switch (name.begin[0]) 
08393                         { 
08394                         case 'c': 
08395                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("comment")) 
08396                                         return nodetest_type_comment; 
08397  
08398                                 break; 
08399  
08400                         case 'n': 
08401                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("node")) 
08402                                         return nodetest_type_node; 
08403  
08404                                 break; 
08405  
08406                         case 'p': 
08407                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("processing-instruction")) 
08408                                         return nodetest_type_pi; 
08409  
08410                                 break; 
08411  
08412                         case 't': 
08413                                 if (name == XML_TEXT("text")) 
08414                                         return nodetest_type_text; 
08415  
08416                                 break; 
08417                         } 
08418  
08419                         return nodetest_none; 
08420                 } 
08421  
08422                 // PrimaryExpr ::= VariableReference | '(' Expr ')' | Literal | Number | FunctionCall 
08423                 xpath_ast_node* parse_primary_expression() 
08424                 { 
08425                         switch (_lexer.current()) 
08426                         { 
08427                         case lex_var_ref: 
08428                         { 
08429                                 xpath_lexer_string name = _lexer.contents(); 
08430  
08431                                 if (!_variables) 
08432                                         throw_error("Unknown variable: variable set is not provided"); 
08433  
08434                                 xpath_variable* var = get_variable(_variables, name.begin, name.end); 
08435  
08436                                 if (!var) 
08437                                         throw_error("Unknown variable: variable set does not contain the given name"); 
08438  
08439                                 _lexer.next(); 
08440  
08441                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_variable, var->type(), var); 
08442                         } 
08443  
08444                         case lex_open_brace: 
08445                         { 
08446                                 _lexer.next(); 
08447  
08448                                 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression(); 
08449  
08450                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace) 
08451                                         throw_error("Unmatched braces"); 
08452  
08453                                 _lexer.next(); 
08454  
08455                                 return n; 
08456                         } 
08457  
08458                         case lex_quoted_string: 
08459                         { 
08460                                 const char_t* value = alloc_string(_lexer.contents()); 
08461  
08462                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_string_constant, xpath_type_string, value); 
08463                                 _lexer.next(); 
08464  
08465                                 return n; 
08466                         } 
08467  
08468                         case lex_number: 
08469                         { 
08470                                 double value = 0; 
08471  
08472                                 if (!convert_string_to_number(_lexer.contents().begin, _lexer.contents().end, &value)) 
08473                                         throw_error_oom(); 
08474  
08475                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_number_constant, xpath_type_number, value); 
08476                                 _lexer.next(); 
08477  
08478                                 return n; 
08479                         } 
08480  
08481                         case lex_string: 
08482                         { 
08483                                 xpath_ast_node* args[2] = {0}; 
08484                                 size_t argc = 0; 
08485                                  
08486                                 xpath_lexer_string function = _lexer.contents(); 
08487                                 _lexer.next(); 
08488                                  
08489                                 xpath_ast_node* last_arg = 0; 
08490                                  
08491                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_open_brace) 
08492                                         throw_error("Unrecognized function call"); 
08493                                 _lexer.next(); 
08494  
08495                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace) 
08496                                         args[argc++] = parse_expression(); 
08497  
08498                                 while (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace) 
08499                                 { 
08500                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_comma) 
08501                                                 throw_error("No comma between function arguments"); 
08502                                         _lexer.next(); 
08503                                          
08504                                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression(); 
08505                                          
08506                                         if (argc < 2) args[argc] = n; 
08507                                         else last_arg->set_next(n); 
08508  
08509                                         argc++; 
08510                                         last_arg = n; 
08511                                 } 
08512                                  
08513                                 _lexer.next(); 
08514  
08515                                 return parse_function(function, argc, args); 
08516                         } 
08517  
08518                         default: 
08519                                 throw_error("Unrecognizable primary expression"); 
08520  
08521                                 return 0; 
08522                         } 
08523                 } 
08524                  
08525                 // FilterExpr ::= PrimaryExpr | FilterExpr Predicate 
08526                 // Predicate ::= '[' PredicateExpr ']' 
08527                 // PredicateExpr ::= Expr 
08528                 xpath_ast_node* parse_filter_expression() 
08529                 { 
08530                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_primary_expression(); 
08531  
08532                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace) 
08533                         { 
08534                                 _lexer.next(); 
08535  
08536                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression(); 
08537  
08538                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Predicate has to be applied to node set"); 
08539  
08540                                 bool posinv = expr->rettype() != xpath_type_number && expr->is_posinv(); 
08541  
08542                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(posinv ? ast_filter_posinv : ast_filter, xpath_type_node_set, n, expr); 
08543  
08544                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace) 
08545                                         throw_error("Unmatched square brace"); 
08546                          
08547                                 _lexer.next(); 
08548                         } 
08549                          
08550                         return n; 
08551                 } 
08552                  
08553                 // Step ::= AxisSpecifier NodeTest Predicate* | AbbreviatedStep 
08554                 // AxisSpecifier ::= AxisName '::' | '@'? 
08555                 // NodeTest ::= NameTest | NodeType '(' ')' | 'processing-instruction' '(' Literal ')' 
08556                 // NameTest ::= '*' | NCName ':' '*' | QName 
08557                 // AbbreviatedStep ::= '.' | '..' 
08558                 xpath_ast_node* parse_step(xpath_ast_node* set) 
08559                 { 
08560                         if (set && set->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) 
08561                                 throw_error("Step has to be applied to node set"); 
08562  
08563                         bool axis_specified = false; 
08564                         axis_t axis = axis_child; // implied child axis 
08565  
08566                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_axis_attribute) 
08567                         { 
08568                                 axis = axis_attribute; 
08569                                 axis_specified = true; 
08570                                  
08571                                 _lexer.next(); 
08572                         } 
08573                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_dot) 
08574                         { 
08575                                 _lexer.next(); 
08576                                  
08577                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis_self, nodetest_type_node, 0); 
08578                         } 
08579                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_dot) 
08580                         { 
08581                                 _lexer.next(); 
08582                                  
08583                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis_parent, nodetest_type_node, 0); 
08584                         } 
08585                  
08586                         nodetest_t nt_type = nodetest_none; 
08587                         xpath_lexer_string nt_name; 
08588                          
08589                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_string) 
08590                         { 
08591                                 // node name test 
08592                                 nt_name = _lexer.contents(); 
08593                                 _lexer.next(); 
08594  
08595                                 // was it an axis name? 
08596                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_colon) 
08597                                 { 
08598                                         // parse axis name 
08599                                         if (axis_specified) throw_error("Two axis specifiers in one step"); 
08600  
08601                                         axis = parse_axis_name(nt_name, axis_specified); 
08602  
08603                                         if (!axis_specified) throw_error("Unknown axis"); 
08604  
08605                                         // read actual node test 
08606                                         _lexer.next(); 
08607  
08608                                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply) 
08609                                         { 
08610                                                 nt_type = nodetest_all; 
08611                                                 nt_name = xpath_lexer_string(); 
08612                                                 _lexer.next(); 
08613                                         } 
08614                                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_string) 
08615                                         { 
08616                                                 nt_name = _lexer.contents(); 
08617                                                 _lexer.next(); 
08618                                         } 
08619                                         else throw_error("Unrecognized node test"); 
08620                                 } 
08621                                  
08622                                 if (nt_type == nodetest_none) 
08623                                 { 
08624                                         // node type test or processing-instruction 
08625                                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_open_brace) 
08626                                         { 
08627                                                 _lexer.next(); 
08628                                                  
08629                                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_close_brace) 
08630                                                 { 
08631                                                         _lexer.next(); 
08632  
08633                                                         nt_type = parse_node_test_type(nt_name); 
08634  
08635                                                         if (nt_type == nodetest_none) throw_error("Unrecognized node type"); 
08636                                                          
08637                                                         nt_name = xpath_lexer_string(); 
08638                                                 } 
08639                                                 else if (nt_name == XML_TEXT("processing-instruction")) 
08640                                                 { 
08641                                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_quoted_string) 
08642                                                                 throw_error("Only literals are allowed as arguments to processing-instruction()"); 
08643                                                  
08644                                                         nt_type = nodetest_pi; 
08645                                                         nt_name = _lexer.contents(); 
08646                                                         _lexer.next(); 
08647                                                          
08648                                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace) 
08649                                                                 throw_error("Unmatched brace near processing-instruction()"); 
08650                                                         _lexer.next(); 
08651                                                 } 
08652                                                 else 
08653                                                         throw_error("Unmatched brace near node type test"); 
08654  
08655                                         } 
08656                                         // QName or NCName:* 
08657                                         else 
08658                                         { 
08659                                                 if (nt_name.end - nt_name.begin > 2 && nt_name.end[-2] == ':' && nt_name.end[-1] == '*') // NCName:* 
08660                                                 { 
08661                                                         nt_name.end--; // erase * 
08662                                                          
08663                                                         nt_type = nodetest_all_in_namespace; 
08664                                                 } 
08665                                                 else nt_type = nodetest_name; 
08666                                         } 
08667                                 } 
08668                         } 
08669                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply) 
08670                         { 
08671                                 nt_type = nodetest_all; 
08672                                 _lexer.next(); 
08673                         } 
08674                         else throw_error("Unrecognized node test"); 
08675                          
08676                         xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis, nt_type, alloc_string(nt_name)); 
08677                          
08678                         xpath_ast_node* last = 0; 
08679                          
08680                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace) 
08681                         { 
08682                                 _lexer.next(); 
08683                                  
08684                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression(); 
08685  
08686                                 xpath_ast_node* pred = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_predicate, xpath_type_node_set, expr); 
08687                                  
08688                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace) 
08689                                         throw_error("Unmatched square brace"); 
08690                                 _lexer.next(); 
08691                                  
08692                                 if (last) last->set_next(pred); 
08693                                 else n->set_right(pred); 
08694                                  
08695                                 last = pred; 
08696                         } 
08697                          
08698                         return n; 
08699                 } 
08700                  
08701                 // RelativeLocationPath ::= Step | RelativeLocationPath '/' Step | RelativeLocationPath '//' Step 
08702                 xpath_ast_node* parse_relative_location_path(xpath_ast_node* set) 
08703                 { 
08704                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_step(set); 
08705                          
08706                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash) 
08707                         { 
08708                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08709                                 _lexer.next(); 
08710  
08711                                 if (l == lex_double_slash) 
08712                                         n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0); 
08713                                  
08714                                 n = parse_step(n); 
08715                         } 
08716                          
08717                         return n; 
08718                 } 
08719                  
08720                 // LocationPath ::= RelativeLocationPath | AbsoluteLocationPath 
08721                 // AbsoluteLocationPath ::= '/' RelativeLocationPath? | '//' RelativeLocationPath 
08722                 xpath_ast_node* parse_location_path() 
08723                 { 
08724                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash) 
08725                         { 
08726                                 _lexer.next(); 
08727                                  
08728                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set); 
08729  
08730                                 // relative location path can start from axis_attribute, dot, double_dot, multiply and string lexemes; any other lexeme means standalone root path 
08731                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08732  
08733                                 if (l == lex_string || l == lex_axis_attribute || l == lex_dot || l == lex_double_dot || l == lex_multiply) 
08734                                         return parse_relative_location_path(n); 
08735                                 else 
08736                                         return n; 
08737                         } 
08738                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_slash) 
08739                         { 
08740                                 _lexer.next(); 
08741                                  
08742                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set); 
08743                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0); 
08744                                  
08745                                 return parse_relative_location_path(n); 
08746                         } 
08747  
08748                         // else clause moved outside of if because of bogus warning 'control may reach end of non-void function being inlined' in gcc 4.0.1 
08749                         return parse_relative_location_path(0); 
08750                 } 
08751                  
08752                 // PathExpr ::= LocationPath 
08753                 //                              | FilterExpr 
08754                 //                              | FilterExpr '/' RelativeLocationPath 
08755                 //                              | FilterExpr '//' RelativeLocationPath 
08756                 xpath_ast_node* parse_path_expression() 
08757                 { 
08758                         // Clarification. 
08759                         // PathExpr begins with either LocationPath or FilterExpr. 
08760                         // FilterExpr begins with PrimaryExpr 
08761                         // PrimaryExpr begins with '$' in case of it being a variable reference, 
08762                         // '(' in case of it being an expression, string literal, number constant or 
08763                         // function call. 
08764  
08765                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_var_ref || _lexer.current() == lex_open_brace ||  
08766                                 _lexer.current() == lex_quoted_string || _lexer.current() == lex_number || 
08767                                 _lexer.current() == lex_string) 
08768                         { 
08769                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_string) 
08770                                 { 
08771                                         // This is either a function call, or not - if not, we shall proceed with location path 
08772                                         const char_t* state = _lexer.state(); 
08773                                          
08774                                         while (IS_CHARTYPE(*state, ct_space)) ++state; 
08775                                          
08776                                         if (*state != '(') return parse_location_path(); 
08777  
08778                                         // This looks like a function call; however this still can be a node-test. Check it. 
08779                                         if (parse_node_test_type(_lexer.contents()) != nodetest_none) return parse_location_path(); 
08780                                 } 
08781                                  
08782                                 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_filter_expression(); 
08783  
08784                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash) 
08785                                 { 
08786                                         lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08787                                         _lexer.next(); 
08788                                          
08789                                         if (l == lex_double_slash) 
08790                                         { 
08791                                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Step has to be applied to node set"); 
08792  
08793                                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0); 
08794                                         } 
08795          
08796                                         // select from location path 
08797                                         return parse_relative_location_path(n); 
08798                                 } 
08799  
08800                                 return n; 
08801                         } 
08802                         else return parse_location_path(); 
08803                 } 
08804  
08805                 // UnionExpr ::= PathExpr | UnionExpr '|' PathExpr 
08806                 xpath_ast_node* parse_union_expression() 
08807                 { 
08808                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_path_expression(); 
08809  
08810                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_union) 
08811                         { 
08812                                 _lexer.next(); 
08813  
08814                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_union_expression(); 
08815  
08816                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set || expr->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) 
08817                                         throw_error("Union operator has to be applied to node sets"); 
08818  
08819                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_union, xpath_type_node_set, n, expr); 
08820                         } 
08821  
08822                         return n; 
08823                 } 
08824  
08825                 // UnaryExpr ::= UnionExpr | '-' UnaryExpr 
08826                 xpath_ast_node* parse_unary_expression() 
08827                 { 
08828                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_minus) 
08829                         { 
08830                                 _lexer.next(); 
08831  
08832                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_unary_expression(); 
08833  
08834                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_negate, xpath_type_number, expr); 
08835                         } 
08836                         else return parse_union_expression(); 
08837                 } 
08838                  
08839                 // MultiplicativeExpr ::= UnaryExpr 
08840                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr '*' UnaryExpr 
08841                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr 'div' UnaryExpr 
08842                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr 'mod' UnaryExpr 
08843                 xpath_ast_node* parse_multiplicative_expression() 
08844                 { 
08845                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_unary_expression(); 
08846  
08847                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply || (_lexer.current() == lex_string && 
08848                                    (_lexer.contents() == XML_TEXT("mod") || _lexer.contents() == XML_TEXT("div")))) 
08849                         { 
08850                                 ast_type_t op = _lexer.current() == lex_multiply ? ast_op_multiply : 
08851                                         _lexer.contents().begin[0] == 'd' ? ast_op_divide : ast_op_mod; 
08852                                 _lexer.next(); 
08853  
08854                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_unary_expression(); 
08855  
08856                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(op, xpath_type_number, n, expr); 
08857                         } 
08858  
08859                         return n; 
08860                 } 
08861  
08862                 // AdditiveExpr ::= MultiplicativeExpr 
08863                 //                                      | AdditiveExpr '+' MultiplicativeExpr 
08864                 //                                      | AdditiveExpr '-' MultiplicativeExpr 
08865                 xpath_ast_node* parse_additive_expression() 
08866                 { 
08867                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_multiplicative_expression(); 
08868  
08869                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_plus || _lexer.current() == lex_minus) 
08870                         { 
08871                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08872  
08873                                 _lexer.next(); 
08874  
08875                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_multiplicative_expression(); 
08876  
08877                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_plus ? ast_op_add : ast_op_subtract, xpath_type_number, n, expr); 
08878                         } 
08879  
08880                         return n; 
08881                 } 
08882  
08883                 // RelationalExpr ::= AdditiveExpr 
08884                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '<' AdditiveExpr 
08885                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '>' AdditiveExpr 
08886                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '<=' AdditiveExpr 
08887                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '>=' AdditiveExpr 
08888                 xpath_ast_node* parse_relational_expression() 
08889                 { 
08890                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_additive_expression(); 
08891  
08892                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_less || _lexer.current() == lex_less_or_equal ||  
08893                                    _lexer.current() == lex_greater || _lexer.current() == lex_greater_or_equal) 
08894                         { 
08895                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08896                                 _lexer.next(); 
08897  
08898                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_additive_expression(); 
08899  
08900                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_less ? ast_op_less : l == lex_greater ? ast_op_greater : 
08901                                                                 l == lex_less_or_equal ? ast_op_less_or_equal : ast_op_greater_or_equal, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr); 
08902                         } 
08903  
08904                         return n; 
08905                 } 
08906                  
08907                 // EqualityExpr ::= RelationalExpr 
08908                 //                                      | EqualityExpr '=' RelationalExpr 
08909                 //                                      | EqualityExpr '!=' RelationalExpr 
08910                 xpath_ast_node* parse_equality_expression() 
08911                 { 
08912                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_relational_expression(); 
08913  
08914                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_equal || _lexer.current() == lex_not_equal) 
08915                         { 
08916                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current(); 
08917  
08918                                 _lexer.next(); 
08919  
08920                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_relational_expression(); 
08921  
08922                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_equal ? ast_op_equal : ast_op_not_equal, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr); 
08923                         } 
08924  
08925                         return n; 
08926                 } 
08927                  
08928                 // AndExpr ::= EqualityExpr | AndExpr 'and' EqualityExpr 
08929                 xpath_ast_node* parse_and_expression() 
08930                 { 
08931                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_equality_expression(); 
08932  
08933                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_string && _lexer.contents() == XML_TEXT("and")) 
08934                         { 
08935                                 _lexer.next(); 
08936  
08937                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_equality_expression(); 
08938  
08939                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_and, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr); 
08940                         } 
08941  
08942                         return n; 
08943                 } 
08944  
08945                 // OrExpr ::= AndExpr | OrExpr 'or' AndExpr 
08946                 xpath_ast_node* parse_or_expression() 
08947                 { 
08948                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_and_expression(); 
08949  
08950                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_string && _lexer.contents() == XML_TEXT("or")) 
08951                         { 
08952                                 _lexer.next(); 
08953  
08954                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_and_expression(); 
08955  
08956                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_or, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr); 
08957                         } 
08958  
08959                         return n; 
08960                 } 
08961                  
08962                 // Expr ::= OrExpr 
08963                 xpath_ast_node* parse_expression() 
08964                 { 
08965                         return parse_or_expression(); 
08966                 } 
08967  
08968                 xpath_parser(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result): _alloc(alloc), _lexer(query), _query(query), _variables(variables), _result(result) 
08969                 { 
08970                 } 
08971  
08972                 xpath_ast_node* parse() 
08973                 { 
08974                         xpath_ast_node* result = parse_expression(); 
08975                          
08976                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_eof) 
08977                         { 
08978                                 // there are still unparsed tokens left, error 
08979                                 throw_error("Incorrect query"); 
08980                         } 
08981                          
08982                         return result; 
08983                 } 
08984  
08985                 static xpath_ast_node* parse(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result) 
08986                 { 
08987                         xpath_parser parser(query, variables, alloc, result); 
08988  
08989                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
08990                         int error = setjmp(parser._error_handler); 
08991  
08992                         return (error == 0) ? parser.parse() : 0; 
08993                 #else 
08994                         return parser.parse(); 
08995                 #endif 
08996                 } 
08997         }; 
08998  
08999         struct xpath_query_impl 
09000         { 
09001                 static xpath_query_impl* create() 
09002                 { 
09003                         void* memory = global_allocate(sizeof(xpath_query_impl)); 
09004  
09005                         return new (memory) xpath_query_impl(); 
09006                 } 
09007  
09008                 static void destroy(void* ptr) 
09009                 { 
09010                         if (!ptr) return; 
09011                          
09012                         // free all allocated pages 
09013                         static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(ptr)->alloc.release(); 
09014  
09015                         // free allocator memory (with the first page) 
09016                         global_deallocate(ptr); 
09017                 } 
09018  
09019                 xpath_query_impl(): root(0), alloc(&block) 
09020                 { 
09021                         block.next = 0; 
09022                 } 
09023  
09024                 xpath_ast_node* root; 
09025                 xpath_allocator alloc; 
09026                 xpath_memory_block block; 
09027         }; 
09028  
09029         xpath_string evaluate_string_impl(xpath_query_impl* impl, const xpath_node& n, xpath_stack_data& sd) 
09030         { 
09031                 if (!impl) return xpath_string(); 
09032  
09033         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09034                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return xpath_string(); 
09035         #endif 
09036  
09037                 xpath_context c(n, 1, 1); 
09038  
09039                 return impl->root->eval_string(c, sd.stack); 
09040         } 
09041 }

09089         }

09091         xpath_node::operator xpath_node::unspecified_bool_type() const 
09092         { 
09093                 return (_node || _attribute) ? &xpath_node::_node : 0; 
09094         } 
09095          
09096         bool xpath_node::operator!() const 
09097         { 
09098                 return !(_node || _attribute); 
09099         } 
09100  
09101         bool xpath_node::operator==(const xpath_node& n) const 
09102         { 
09103                 return _node == n._node && _attribute == n._attribute; 
09104         } 
09105          
09106         bool xpath_node::operator!=(const xpath_node& n) const 
09107         { 
09108                 return _node != n._node || _attribute != n._attribute; 
09109         }

09113         { 
09114                 return (bool)lhs && rhs;

09122  
09123         void xpath_node_set::_assign(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end) 
09124         { 
09125                 assert(begin <= end); 
09126  
09127                 size_t size = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin); 
09128  
09129                 if (size <= 1) 
09130                 { 
09131                         // deallocate old buffer 
09132                         if (_begin != &_storage) global_deallocate(_begin); 
09133  
09134                         // use internal buffer 
09135                         if (begin != end) _storage = *begin; 
09136  
09137                         _begin = &_storage; 
09138                         _end = &_storage + size; 
09139                 } 
09140                 else 
09141                 { 
09142                         // make heap copy 
09143                         xpath_node* storage = static_cast<xpath_node*>(global_allocate(size * sizeof(xpath_node))); 
09144  
09145                         if (!storage) 
09146                         { 
09147                         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09148                                 return; 
09149                         #else 
09150                                 throw std::bad_alloc(); 
09151                         #endif 
09152                         } 
09153  
09154                         memcpy(storage, begin, size * sizeof(xpath_node)); 
09155                          
09156                         // deallocate old buffer 
09157                         if (_begin != &_storage) global_deallocate(_begin); 
09158  
09159                         // finalize 
09160                         _begin = storage; 
09161                         _end = storage + size; 
09162                 } 
09163         } 
09164  
09165         xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(): _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage) 
09166         { 
09167         } 
09168  
09169         xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end, type_t type): _type(type), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage) 
09170         { 
09171                 _assign(begin, end); 
09172         } 
09173  
09174         xpath_node_set::~xpath_node_set() 
09175         { 
09176                 if (_begin != &_storage) global_deallocate(_begin); 
09177         } 
09178                  
09179         xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const xpath_node_set& ns): _type(ns._type), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage) 
09180         { 
09181                 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end); 
09182         } 
09183          
09184         xpath_node_set& xpath_node_set::operator=(const xpath_node_set& ns) 
09185         { 
09186                 if (this == &ns) return *this; 
09187                  
09188                 _type = ns._type; 
09189                 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end); 
09190  
09191                 return *this; 
09192         } 
09193  
09194         xpath_node_set::type_t xpath_node_set::type() const 
09195         { 
09196                 return _type; 
09197         } 
09198                  
09199         size_t xpath_node_set::size() const 
09200         { 
09201                 return _end - _begin; 
09202         } 
09203                  
09204         bool xpath_node_set::empty() const 
09205         { 
09206                 return _begin == _end; 
09207         } 
09208                  
09209         const xpath_node& xpath_node_set::operator[](size_t index) const 
09210         { 
09211                 assert(index < size()); 
09212                 return _begin[index]; 
09213         } 
09214  
09215         xpath_node_set::const_iterator xpath_node_set::begin() const 
09216         { 
09217                 return _begin; 
09218         } 
09219                  
09220         xpath_node_set::const_iterator xpath_node_set::end() const 
09221         {

09252         const char_t* xpath_variable::name() const 
09253         { 
09254                 switch (_type) 
09255                 { 
09256                 case xpath_type_node_set: 
09257                         return static_cast<const xpath_variable_node_set*>(this)->name; 
09258  
09259                 case xpath_type_number: 
09260                         return static_cast<const xpath_variable_number*>(this)->name; 
09261  
09262                 case xpath_type_string: 
09263                         return static_cast<const xpath_variable_string*>(this)->name; 
09264  
09265                 case xpath_type_boolean: 
09266                         return static_cast<const xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->name; 
09267  
09268                 default: 
09269                         assert(!"Invalid variable type"); 
09270                         return 0; 
09271                 } 
09272         }

09315  
09316         bool xpath_variable::set(const char_t* value) 
09317         { 
09318                 if (_type != xpath_type_string) return false; 
09319  
09320                 xpath_variable_string* var = static_cast<xpath_variable_string*>(this); 
09321  
09322                 // duplicate string 
09323                 size_t size = (strlength(value) + 1) * sizeof(char_t); 
09324  
09325                 char_t* copy = static_cast<char_t*>(global_allocate(size)); 
09326                 if (!copy) return false; 
09327  
09328                 memcpy(copy, value, size); 
09329  
09330                 // replace old string 
09331                 if (var->value) global_deallocate(var->value); 
09332                 var->value = copy; 
09333  
09334                 return true; 
09335         }

09342                 return true;

09345         xpath_variable_set::xpath_variable_set() 
09346         { 
09347                 for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); ++i) _data[i] = 0; 
09348         } 
09349  
09350         xpath_variable_set::~xpath_variable_set() 
09351         { 
09352                 for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); ++i) 
09353                 { 
09354                         xpath_variable* var = _data[i]; 
09355  
09356                         while (var) 
09357                         { 
09358                                 xpath_variable* next = var->_next; 
09359  
09360                                 delete_xpath_variable(var->_type, var); 
09361  
09362                                 var = next; 
09363                         } 
09364                 } 
09365         } 
09366  
09367         xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::find(const char_t* name) const 
09368         { 
09369                 const size_t hash_size = sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); 
09370                 size_t hash = hash_string(name) % hash_size; 
09371  
09372                 // look for existing variable 
09373                 for (xpath_variable* var = _data[hash]; var; var = var->_next) 
09374                         if (strequal(var->name(), name)) 
09375                                 return var; 
09376  
09377                 return 0; 
09378         } 
09379  
09380         xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::add(const char_t* name, xpath_value_type type) 
09381         { 
09382                 const size_t hash_size = sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); 
09383                 size_t hash = hash_string(name) % hash_size; 
09384  
09385                 // look for existing variable 
09386                 for (xpath_variable* var = _data[hash]; var; var = var->_next) 
09387                         if (strequal(var->name(), name)) 
09388                                 return var->type() == type ? var : 0; 
09389  
09390                 // add new variable 
09391                 xpath_variable* result = new_xpath_variable(type, name); 
09392  
09393                 if (result) 
09394                 { 
09395                         result->_type = type; 
09396                         result->_next = _data[hash]; 
09397  
09398                         _data[hash] = result; 
09399                 } 
09400  
09401                 return result; 
09402         }

09407                 return var ? var->set(value) : false; 
09408         }

09438         xpath_query::xpath_query(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables): _impl(0) 
09439         { 
09440                 xpath_query_impl* impl = xpath_query_impl::create(); 
09441  
09442                 if (!impl) 
09443                 { 
09444                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09445                         _result.error = "Out of memory"; 
09446                 #else 
09447                         throw std::bad_alloc(); 
09448                 #endif 
09449                 } 
09450                 else 
09451                 { 
09452                         buffer_holder impl_holder(impl, xpath_query_impl::destroy); 
09453  
09454                         impl->root = xpath_parser::parse(query, variables, &impl->alloc, &_result); 
09455  
09456                         if (impl->root) 
09457                         { 
09458                                 _impl = static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(impl_holder.release()); 
09459                                 _result.error = 0; 
09460                         } 
09461                 } 
09462         } 
09463  
09464         xpath_query::~xpath_query() 
09465         { 
09466                 xpath_query_impl::destroy(_impl); 
09467         }

09469         xpath_value_type xpath_query::return_type() const 
09470         { 
09471                 if (!_impl) return xpath_type_none; 
09472  
09473                 return static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->rettype(); 
09474         } 
09475  
09476         bool xpath_query::evaluate_boolean(const xpath_node& n) const 
09477         { 
09478                 if (!_impl) return false; 
09479                  
09480                 xpath_context c(n, 1, 1); 
09481                 xpath_stack_data sd; 
09482  
09483         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09484                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return false; 
09485         #endif 
09486                  
09487                 return static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->eval_boolean(c, sd.stack); 
09488         }

09490         double xpath_query::evaluate_number(const xpath_node& n) const 
09491         { 
09492                 if (!_impl) return gen_nan(); 
09493                  
09494                 xpath_context c(n, 1, 1); 
09495                 xpath_stack_data sd; 
09496  
09497         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09498                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return gen_nan(); 
09499         #endif 
09500  
09501                 return static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->eval_number(c, sd.stack); 
09502         }

09504 #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
09505         string_t xpath_query::evaluate_string(const xpath_node& n) const 
09506         { 
09507                 xpath_stack_data sd; 
09508  
09509                 return evaluate_string_impl(static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl), n, sd).c_str(); 
09510         } 
09511 #endif 
09512  
09513         size_t xpath_query::evaluate_string(char_t* buffer, size_t capacity, const xpath_node& n) const 
09514         { 
09515                 xpath_stack_data sd; 
09516  
09517                 xpath_string r = evaluate_string_impl(static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl), n, sd); 
09518  
09519                 size_t full_size = r.length() + 1; 
09520                  
09521                 if (capacity > 0) 
09522                 { 
09523                         size_t size = (full_size < capacity) ? full_size : capacity; 
09524                         assert(size > 0); 
09525  
09526                         memcpy(buffer, r.c_str(), (size - 1) * sizeof(char_t)); 
09527                         buffer[size - 1] = 0; 
09528                 } 
09529                  
09530                 return full_size; 
09531         } 
09532  
09533         xpath_node_set xpath_query::evaluate_node_set(const xpath_node& n) const 
09534         { 
09535                 if (!_impl) return xpath_node_set(); 
09536  
09537                 xpath_ast_node* root = static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root; 
09538  
09539                 if (root->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) 
09540                 { 
09541                 #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09542                         return xpath_node_set(); 
09543                 #else 
09544                         xpath_parse_result result; 
09545                         result.error = "Expression does not evaluate to node set"; 
09546  
09547                         throw xpath_exception(result); 
09548                 #endif 
09549                 } 
09550                  
09551                 xpath_context c(n, 1, 1); 
09552                 xpath_stack_data sd; 
09553  
09554         #ifdef XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
09555                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return xpath_node_set(); 
09556         #endif 
09557  
09558                 xpath_node_set_raw r = root->eval_node_set(c, sd.stack); 
09559  
09560                 return xpath_node_set(r.begin(), r.end(), r.type()); 
09561         }
